Job Description:
ABBYY powers intelligent automation. We reimagine the way people work and how companies accelerate business by delivering the intelligence that fuels automation platforms. Our solutions transform enterprise data and empower you with the insights you need to work smarter and faster. We help more than 5,000 companies globally, including many of the Fortune 500, to drive significant impact where it matters most: customer experience, profitability, and competitive advantage.
We bring together top experts from all over the world to form our growing team of 800+ employees. Our offices are based in 15 countries with headquarters in the United States. Joining ABBYY means being part of a professional community passionate about technology and driven to develop our skills further. We are excited to offer opportunities working in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, and Data Science.
We believe that our colleagues are our greatest asset, and we are thrilled to provide you with this opportunity to continue your journey with us. Whether you're seeking to unleash your potential in a new role or take the next step in your professional journey, you've come to the right place.
Our commitment to respect, transparency, and simplicity means you can trust us to always choose to do the right thing.
As a trusted partner for intelligent automation, we solve highly complex problems for our enterprise customers and put their information to work to transform the way they do business. Innovation and excellence run through our veins, and you will work with experts who are creating market-leading technologies, using Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, and an advanced and sophisticated tech stack.
We invite you to join our team. Reimagine your future with boundless opportunities and a team who champions your success and expand your knowledge with every customer interaction while working flexible hours!
Responsibilities
Sell ABBYY solutions to New Logo Enterprise Accounts.
Maintain and develop an active pipeline of forecasted opportunities to meet quarterly quota objectives.
Drive pipeline velocity activities to generate New Logo business.
Develop new and expanded sales prospects, negotiate sales agreements, and close sales opportunities.
Analyze customers business needs, cultivate executive relationships, identify strategic partnership opportunities, and develop strategies to ensure customer growth, satisfaction, and retention.
Lead and drive sales opportunities through strategic selling, negotiate and close business, and lead the ongoing business relationship with clients.
Provide overall sales and account management support for any new or existing customers as assigned.
Develop and maintain a communications strategy for assigned and closed customers.
Create and update Accounts, Opportunities, Orders, etc. within ABBYY’s CRM system.
Participate in product training sessions, meetings, team and skills building activities, and professional development classes.
Partner with the ABBYY Presales and Training teams to coordinate solutions demonstrations and/or product training to prospects and customers.
Prepare and provide data and information as needed for sales team meetings that focus on revenue performance, forecasts, and customer satisfaction initiatives.
Requirements
10+ years of experience successfully selling enterprise software and/or SaaS, of which 4+ years must be in the areas of Intelligent Document Automation, RPA, Business Process Automation or Process Mining.
Hunter/Closer mentality with the ability to generate new business consistently.
Strong interpersonal skills, polished, credible and comfortable interacting at CXO/executive level.
Knowledge of market research, sales and negotiation principles.
Proven contributor to a sales team with consistent achievement of sales quotas.
Strong business development, account management and relationship management skills.
Highly proficient level of computer skills including Microsoft Office, SalesForce, LinkedIn, Webinar, and social media/marketing tools.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent telephone sales skills.
Proficient organizational skills and solution presentation skills.
Self-directed, motivated individual who can work effectively in remote or office-based environments.
Fluent in English and other Asian languages
Education
• Bachelor's Degree (4-year degree), preference of Business or related study, or equivalent work experience.
We enable you to:
Be Challenged
Using established internal processes, we analyze and act on unique customer requests. No two cases are identical. As trusted advisors, we work with our customers to define the best solution for their IT and business strategies. Through this collaboration, we continue to learn more about business processes in companies from all over the world.
Be a Trusted Advisor
ABBYY's global expertise includes various industries, such as Financial Services, Insurance, Transportation & Logistics, Healthcare, Government, and Legal. We are a significant player in the RPA and broader intelligent automation market through strategic partnerships and embedded technology licensing with leading vendors. As part of our team, you're a member of a trusted community that continually strives to achieve the best results for our customers.
Be Flexible
Work-life balance looks a little different for everyone. Employees regularly collaborate with their managers to design a workday that works best with flexible working hours.
Be Yourself
The success of our employees is a top priority for us. We value a culture of trust, collaboration, and respect by fostering open communication, a continuous cycle of feedback, and recognition. We know every team member brings unique value and aspirations. We enjoy learning about each employee and seeing careers grow at ABBYY.
ABBYY is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace.

Job Description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This role reports to the Director of Customer Experience which is a group under the Regional Customer Satisfaction Team. The candidate’s primary focus is to champion service excellence delivery at our customer touchpoints (e.g. contact centers, service centers). You will lead the development, implementation, and assessment of training initiatives and quality assurance programs across multiple locations within the region.

Primary Responsibilities and Key Roles:
Enhance end-to-end customer journey through:
Customer feedback management (VOCs, Service audits, Data analysis & insights etc.)
Active engagement of relevant stakeholders to address customer pain points
Ownership of Service Recovery guidelines to empower frontline staff to resolve customer issues
Set and drive regional initiatives to improve overall customer experience and NPS based on insights from customer feedback and trends analysis, including improvement of services processes and policies through customer journey mapping
Drive a culture of service excellence throughout the CS team by working closely with relevant CS team members of subsidiaries to develop guidelines, training, and motivational programs to improve customer service handling skills, mindset and attitude of frontline service staff, agents, and technicians
Organise and chair regular Service Quality Committee meetings with stakeholders to drive service improvement
Conduct training needs analyses to determine the current state of knowledge, skills, and competencies among frontline staff. Analyze trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to ensure the development of customized training programs, and knowledge base, tailored to the unique needs of each location.
Oversee the establishment and maintenance of quality assurance protocols for both frontline staff and training facilitators. Monitor adherence to established procedures, identify areas for improvement, and recommend corrective actions to ensure consistency in service delivery and training outcomes across all locations.
Measure the effectiveness of training programs and quality assurance initiatives using appropriate metrics, such as pre- and post-training assessments, participant feedback surveys, and business impact analysis. Prepare regular reports detailing program performance, ROI, and recommendations for future enhancements.
Continuously evaluate and refine existing programs to meet evolving business needs and respond to changing market dynamics
Any other ad-hoc projects as assigned by the Director of Customer Experience
Oversee the responsibilities of the Assistant Manager, Regional VOC/NPS Management

Job Requirements
Bachelor's degree in any discipline with at least 5 years of relevant experience in service quality or consumer research functions in either hospitality or retail industries and/or e-commerce
Experience with feedback management & generating insights from VoC/NPS data for presentations to management and other departments. Experience with Excel, Tableau, and Natural Language Processing would be a plus
Experience with conducting (qualitative and quantitative studies), ie, surveys, and focus groups to gain better insights of key drivers of customer satisfaction
Understanding the end-to-end customer journey and develop action plans at each touchpoint to elevate the customer’s experience, including online purchase experience and post-purchase experience. A practitioner of design thinking methodology and a proven record of service process re-design is a plus
Strong project management skills, including the ability to plan, organize, and execute complex projects within tight deadlines
Demonstrated proficiency in adult learning theories, instructional design principles, and modern training technologies
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff and management
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and build strong working relationships

· Factory Acceptance Tests (FAT)
· Licensing of electrical installations
· High voltage switching
· Troubleshooting of electrical faults and abnormal situations
· Design & Project Work – Acting as a Qualified Person (QP), LEW for installation works, also covering areas such
as Lightning Protection, HT and LT distribution network, Earthing etc.
· Manage and lead of a team of engineers, technicians and workmen to ensure works are completed as per plan
and schedule, meeting quality & safety objectives,
· Manage and co-ordinate with clients on schedules, scope of works, on-site issues, etc,
· Attend to call-out and emergency job requests,
· Prepare incident report for completed call-out services,
· Prepare method statement and assist Professional Engineer as required,
· Other ad-hoc duties as assigned by management.

Career Progression Plan:
We invite engineering personnel who intend to embark on a career in the private sector as a hands-on electrical professional. The experience gained in this role will help candidates attain their goals of:
· Attaining of a PE Certificate,
· Attaining an LEW Grade 9 Licence (22 kV), allowing you to practise in the consumer market,
· Attaining a SP PowerGrid Authorised High Voltage Testing Engineer Licence allowing you to carry out Switchgear
Testing Works in SP PowerGrid sub-stations, and/or
· Becoming a professional and business leader - leading and managing the company's operations and business.

Job Requirements
· Minimum 5 years of related experience in electrical maintenancen industry
· Possess a recognised Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering.
· Good communication, interpersonal and time management skills.
· Possess strong leadership quality, team work, good planning and organizing ability.
· Takes initiative for personal and professional development.
· Due to nature of the work responsibilities, able and willing to work on weekends, public holidays, overnight and
odd hours.
· Applicants with PE and/or LEW qualifications are definitely welcome to apply

If you are ready to join us, please email your latest CV to admin@stechnic.com.sg.

Job Description:
Project Overview
The SMART Low Energy Electronic Systems IRG aims to identify new integrated circuit technologies that become the new added value for reduced energy per function, lower power consumption, and higher performance in our electronics infrastructure. These integrated circuits of the future are expected to impact applications in wireless communication, power electronics, LED lighting, printing, displays, and computing. The research is performed by teams that have expertise in materials, devices, and circuits, invoking new advances at all levels to produce electronic systems that perform new functions while decreasing system energy consumption. The initial technology goals are in the areas of Power Electronic Systems, Efficient Communications, and Multi-Functional Displays and Lighting Systems.
Responsibilities
Semiconductor tool maintenance and stocking up of laboratory consumables
Manage contractors/vendors and conduct risk assessment
Regulatory licence submissions and statutory audits
Incident report writing and follow-up with corrective actions
Design and build engineering solutions to improve tool uptime
Assist Programme Manager with continuous improvement projects
Requirements
Degree or Diploma holders with > 3 years of relevant experience
2-3 years of experience working in a semiconductor chemical lab and cleanroom
Knowledge of Microsoft Office
Troubleshooting skills (electrical & mechanical) on equipment
Strong attention to detail with good presentation skills
Be part of Emergency Response Team (Training will be provided)
Ability to perform physically demanding work such as moving and lifting equipment, handling of hazardous chemicals/gases/wastes
This is a one-year full-time contract position.

To apply, please visit our website at: https://portal.smart.mit.edu/careers/career-opportunities

Interested applicants are invited to send in their full CV/resume, cover letter and list of three references (to include reference names and contact information). We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Mechanical Systems and supporting Mechanical Systems / Requirements for equipment.
Develop / review commissioning schedule & optimize the duration
Provide technical support as required for marine related equipment
Optimize FSR requirement & engagement on site during commissioning
To support in developing project deliverables as per project & client requirement.
Prepare & Review of company development work methodology / procedures.
Capable of managing demanding expectations of clients which may range from addressing gaps to unexpected work scope variations while ensuring conformance to the project, regulatory and contract requirements.
Attend FAT and SAT depending on project requirements.
Independently deals with regulatory authority, class, vendors and clients with regards to comments or queries on commissioning deliverables and develops technical/engineering solutions to the issues raised.
Carry forward the HSEQ policies / requirements to the team and meet overall HSEQ objectives in all projects / feedback results to corporate HSEQ team.
Participates in meetings with the project team to review progress and addresses interface/implementation/execution issues where necessary based on the standard procedures, practices and lessons learnt from past projects to ensure that the project proceeds timely and smoothly.
Perform duties as per directives of reporting authority.
Leads site execution team on performing pre-commissioning and commissioning activities planned for Marine Mechanical systems, managing the interfaces with
Construction and Pre-Operations teams, ensuring adherence to Operations safe system of work regarding all the Marine System Commissioning SoW.
Commissioning of Marine Mechanical systems, functional tests and system certification with Class Society.
Responsible for verification and close out of all safety critical elements associated with the package.
Ensure all regulatory and statutory testing and requirements are performed and records are maintained.
Perform risk assessment for the commissioning scope, conduct toolbox meetings
Ensure to supervise technicians to carry out commissioning activities in a safe and controlled manner in accordance with site procedures and PTW requirements
Manage discipline and cohesive environment in the office. Monitor / guide all commissioning engineers/assistants/administrators.
Day to day planning of work, manage schedule & targets of the project as required.
Identify and manage resource requirement to meet schedule and targets.
Prepare and maintain commissioning records of site observations, testing processes and checklists
Coordination of functional testing of commissioned systems and engaging the operations team when and where needed
Troubleshoot the logic function, suggest modification plan of logic diagram, liaise with I&C engineer, ICSS and third-party vendor and implement.
Lead and complete the system functional, dependency & interface test (mechanical, instrument and electrical) of commissioned systems
Execute pre-commissioning and commissioning as per procedure and sign-off respective documents with client representative for system closure.
Prepare timely and accurate technical report for management and a reference for future.
Travel to offshore project sites and perform offshore commissioning / assist facility startup.
Lead the team to perform start-up at offshore following the start-up procedure, stabilization and performance testing.
Ability to set priorities and meet deadlines.
Ability to problem solve with or without the guidance of senior leadership
To conduct analytical review of complex progress reports to systematically identify issues and from there, address these issues in a timely manner.
Disciplined in time management and independent in handling/prioritizing complex work requirements within the project’s stringent timelines.
Interact with other engineering department for obtaining engineering and specific vendor documents & details.
Willingness to work and train others in a team environment, assisting other multi-cultural and interdepartmental team members
Guides and motivates the commissioning team to carry out work within the stringent project timelines through awareness of the project’s unique constraints.
Guides the junior staff to understand the technical and project required functions through discussions or knowledge sharing sessions in the light of the company’s standards, procedures and engineering requirements.
Plans and carries out audits of procedures, safety practices and documentation/records with reference to corporate standard procedures to ensure compliance and, identify gaps and training enhancement requirements of team members.
Resolve project/after sales related problems within their area of expertise in coordination with project leads
Ensure data and information accuracy from each project
Provide feedback/update to project throughout creation, testing and rollout of deliverables.
Responsible for the CIC related deliverables during proposal phase.
Create and standardize project related documentation and training programs
Coach and train project employees and clients (when needed)
Participate in CIC project reviews/assessments.
Responsible to maintain LL database of each subject.
Assess projects as per IMS standard and LL.
Lead continuous improvement process of the subject and be a focal point to respective engineering section or group.
Requirements:
Bachelor Degree in Engineering (Mechanical) with 14 to 17 years work experience (or) Master Degree in Engineering (Mechanical) with 12 to 15 years work experience with minimum of 10 years work experience in onshore/offshore Oil & Gas area or FPSO line(s). Also Diploma in Engineering with 17 to 20 years work experience (making the equivalent to degree) can also be considered.
Specialist knowledge of marine systems of at least Three related project line.
Ability to define concepts of completion process.
Experience in design of FPSO’s including FEED, detailed design, construction, commissioning & start-up phase.
Experience of Marine Mechanical Systems and EPCIC to handover to operations
Experience in Marine Utilities Systems, Emergency & Essential Diesel Generator, Fire Fighting & Safety System, LQ Marine Utilities & Life Saving Systems, LQ HVAC & Machinery Spaces Ventilation System, Deck Systems – Cargo Pumps, Ballast Systems, Tank Gauging, Cargo Offloading & Mooring, Hydraulic Remote Control Valve System, Deck Cranes, Chain Jack, Riser Handling & Mooring System & Inert Gas Generator.
Experience in marine equipment & package technical specification, such as specification and mechanical data sheet
Experience in leading the team in troubleshooting the Marine Utilities Systems, Emergency & Essential Diesel Generator, Fire Fighting & Safety System, LQ Marine Utilities & Life Saving Systems, LQ HVAC & Machinery Spaces Ventilation System, Deck Systems – Cargo Pumps, Ballast Systems, Tank Gauging, Cargo Offloading & Mooring, Hydraulic Remote Control Valve System, Deck Cranes, Chain Jack, Riser Handling & Mooring System.
Have thorough knowledge of marine equipment internals
Have knowledge of industrial codes and standards is desirable
Have proven project experience and skills in Testing, Pre-commissioning, Commissioning execution and startup offshore.
Experience in offshore plant startup and stabilization and able to provide Operations with technical support throughout start-up, stabilization, and performance testing.
Experience in commissioning and startup of Marine Utilities System, Essential Generator,Emergency Generator & Fire Pump Diesel Generator & Inert Gas Generator.
Experience in commissioning and startup of LQ AHU, Condensing & Chiller Unit, Machinery Spaces Ventilation System, LQ Life Saving System – Lifeboat, Fast Rescue Boat, Life Raft & etc.
Experience in commissioning and startup of Cargo Pumps, Ballast Pumps, Hydraulic Remote Control Valves, Cargo Offloading & Mooring System, Deck Cranes, Chain Jack, Riser Handling & Mooring System
Experience in commissioning and startup of Fire Fighting & Fire Safety System –Watermist, Low Expansion Foam, High Expansion Foam, Inergen System & etc
Work experience within strict regulatory environments and aligning commissioning
independencies with engineering compliance and contractual requirements.
High safety awareness is mandatory. A good knowledge of managing simultaneous
operations (SIMOPS) is essential.
Significant knowledge of multiple technologies, projects and applications. Working knowledge of competing and alternative technologies.
Familiar in use of Software, Database systems related to System Completion, Project
Management (MS Project / P6) and General computer literacy (MS office).
Shows evidence of good Organizing / Management skills.
Demonstrate ability to take lead.
Good communication skill.
Commitment to take responsibility and work under pressure.

Job Title: Senior Hardware Cum Plc  Hmi Automation System Design Engineer
Job Description:
Job Responsibilities:
• Review product design from electronics perspective in order to fulfil requirement
• Develop product technical specification aligned to marketing & regulatory requirement
• Collaborate with validation team to develop product industrial automation testing platform consist of PLC, HMI, IOlink Master to validate newly developed industrial tower light’s interoperability in automation system platform
• Conduct product verification to ensure product design solutions meet product specifications and functional requirements (performance, quality and compliance with international regulatory standards e.g. IEC, UL and EMC)
• Participate and execute the action plans defined in project meeting
• Provide routine update to project design leader and functional manager

Job Requirement:
You must possess electronics design engineering and industrial automation knowledge and capable of working in highly autonomous manner to develop the requirement of product industrial automation testing platform for 3 rd party supplier fabrication. Preferably you have hands-on experience in both electronics product design as well as industrial automation design using PLC, HMI, Modbus & IOlink devices
• Minimum Degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering or its equivalent
• Highly competent in setting up industrial automation device like PLC, HMI, IOLink device, Modbus device to operate in complete system level
• able to setting up industrial tower light embedded with Modbus, IOlink and/or hardwired IO to operate with Schneider Electric PLC and HMI
• able to alter PLC program, HMI program to meet different application testing needs to check the interoperability of industrial tower light
• Master the knowledge in reading & interpreting electronics schematic comprises of mixed signal embedded circuit design comprises of power electronics: SMPS circuit, protection components, MCU-based circuit
(ADC, Timer, PWM, I2C etc…), LED illumination technology, Buzzer and speaker design
• Experience in electronics development through multiple product development cycles with good understanding in component technology selection, electronics board spacing design rules, design FMEA, PCB review, EMC phenomena and countermeasure, electronics boards manufacturing process.
• Highly motivated and self-driven with good communication skills & executional excellence. Experience in Design, develop, install, commission and program Human Machine Interface (HMI) and PLC (Siemens/Schneider Electric) will be advantage.

Job Description:
Role Summary
Perform purchasing activities for a wide range of global and locally sourced materials and services for assigned commodities, rigs and/or projects as applicable.
Ensure that all purchasing activity is completed in compliance with Company policy and procedures from approved suppliers in the most cost effective, efficient manner and at the highest quality.

Key Responsibilities
Responsible for maintaining key accounts with suppliers, sourcing and supplying goods from enquiry stage to dispatch, expediting, updating systems regularly and negotiating costs and discounts with suppliers.
Provide an efficient cost-effective service to provide materials and supplies, including review of intercompany (corp. / regional / rig) material allocation next to purchase or rental.
Ensure all purchase requisitions for materials, supplies and services are converted to a purchase order or agreement as appropriate.
Follow up promptly clarifications and requests for information from suppliers
Make purchasing decisions based on benchmark prices and comparisons with costs, logistic and country import restriction.
Ensure that all purchases of repairs, services and third-party charges comply with Company policies and procedures and rig standardization guidelines
Responsible to perform expediting for overdue orders.
Monitor and Tracking of Repair and Return (R&R) items and ensure appropriate action is taken.
Assist account payable with invoice discrepancies and ensure suppliers invoices are processed for payment in timely manner.
Resolve any vendor invoicing and shipment discrepancies and negotiate acceptable and timely resolutions, escalating any complex issues to manager and internal clients.
Monitor vendor delivery performance and document any delays, quality non-conformance, quantity discrepancies and pricing issues.
Participate in vendor assessments in accordance with Company policies and procedures and make recommendations as appropriate
Requirements:
Diploma or similar discipline preferred or equivalent experience at Company’s discretion.
Experience in a similar role in procurement/logistics within the oil and gas or related industry.
Strong understanding of purchasing practices and ethics.
Strong communication skills both verbal and written.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite application, particularly Excel.
Working knowledge with procurement related systems.
Excellent analytical skill, cost conscious, disciplined and organised.

Job Description:
The Semco Maritime Technology Solutions Division is looking for a Telecom Project Manager. You will work with a strong team of experienced project managers and engineers who are all committed to delivering optimal solutions matching the needs of our offshore wind and oil & gas customers around the world.
This position offers a unique opportunity to develop your career within project management of telecommunication system projects.
It is important that you are passionate about your job and can keep your team motivated. You know how to work with all aspects of project planning and will be responsible for projects on-site. You will ensure that customers are well informed and that any unforeseen issues are handled in cooperation with the customers.
You have a strong visible profile and communicate well at all organisational levels. You take initiative and approach your tasks resolutely.
As a Project Manager you will have full P/L responsibility for the execution of projects. You will be responsible for completing financial scopes and projects according to schedules and to the satisfaction of customers. In addition, you will manage your team and sub-suppliers according to the managerial values of Semco Maritime.
Key responsibilities:
Following project process model
Overall responsible for assigned projects in ensuring adherence to all aspects (schedules, timelines, budget control, execution, completion, handover)
Manages the P&L of the project to ensure margins are maintained or improved.
Responsible for overseeing engineering and checking documentation in assigned projects.
Maintains relationship with client and acts as the main point of liaison with client for matters pertaining to the project execution, especially monetary matters and deadlines.
Oversees purchases and ensures adherence to project cost, ensuring quality and compatibility.
Responsible for maintaining good HSE practices.
Provision of project financial figures (payment/invoice forecast, etc.) to the Finance department
Prioritize project-related tasks and assignment of tasks to project engineers.
Maintain overview of WIP in assigned projects.
Any other duties assigned by the immediate Manager.
Your qualifications:
Experience with telecom projects and yard/offshore work would be an advantage.
Moreover, you are able to handle all commercial aspects when cooperating with customers. You see the big picture and address finance, HSEQ, and management and customer requests determinedly and with experience.
Effective communication skills and fluency in oral and written English are required.

Educational background and experience:
Bachelor of Engineering within Telecommunication and Electronic Engineering or other relevant background.
Certified Project Management education will be an advantage.
You have at least 5 years of international experience as a Project Manager.
Industrial experience – yard and/or offshore.
We offer:
You will be part of a dynamic worldwide team of engineers which will require your ability to work and cooperate with local engineers as well as Semco’s engineers around the world.
We provide personal and professional development in a positive environment where no two workdays are the same.

Job Description:
PERFORMANCE
Independently manages certification projects concurrently ensuring compliance with all applicable safety requirements achieving completion within time frames and cost deadlines. Evaluates products against requirements of the national / international standards and precedent decisions.
Handles a wide spectrum of projects including those that are complex generating high revenue levels
Delivers assigned projects / tests within agreed timescales the majority of the time
Demonstrates the ability to accurately manage project costs within the agreed budget
Able to maintain good productivity in line with company expectations
Demonstrates technical competence to review the work of others per divisional quality documents
Demonstrates technical competence to perform witness testing per divisional quality documents.
Demonstrates technical competence in 2 or more product qualification competencies
Reviews test data and reports and authorizes application of the CSA Mark. Prepares and / or signs Certification Reports and Certificates of Compliance.
Provides client with assistance in solving problems / failures without divulging proprietary information.
Keeps the Product Group Manager or Team Leader or Assistant Operations Manager informed of project status as required, pointing out major problems and non-compliance.
Performs other duties as assigned by the Product Group Manager or Team Leader or Assistant Operation Manager.
Evaluates and qualifies companies in the administration of Certification Programs. Reviews customer test methods and systems; reviews new / old product designs and all applicable documentation. Ensures all test equipment and quality procedures are within guidelines. Provides technical briefings on new and existing requirements. Authorizes application and / or removal of the CSA Mark.
The qualified Certifier is accountable for including the Technical Advisor or Certification Specialist in product / technical discussions that are unique to CSA or to the experience of the individual. This aids the Technical Advisor and Certification Specialist to further advance consistency of practices and to provide guidance at the front-end of the process.
Provides technical information service to external and internal customers including those forwarded by the Client Service Center. Liaises with customer in design stage to ensure requirements of national / international standards are met without compromising confidentiality.
CUSTOMER
Works with sales to support current clients and develop new client opportunities to support growth
Prepares project quotations for cost and time. Classifies product by use, environment and function. Determines applicable requirements / test / standards. Determines sample requirements and method / location for testing / evaluation best suited to customers’ needs.
Provides client feedback to Managers, Team Leader or Sales representatives, as appropriate.
Explains the different product certifications programs available to clients and the requirements for control of production.
TESTING
Performs within established DQD guidelines.
Prepares Test Lab Work Orders and Special Testing Documentation that includes details regarding applicable sections of relevant standards, test sample plan, data collection methods and tables, Job Hazard Analysis, and any other instructions.
Provides necessary guidance to Lab Technicians to ensure proper application of requirements and data collections methods are in line.
Able to demonstrate experience of performing common testing within CSA laboratories
Makes field trips and witnesses test work at manufacturer's facilities as required.
Has a good knowledge of the clauses and tests within the standards they support and can demonstrate application across multiple product types.
Demonstrates the ability to compile evaluation record, data and summary test results into forms, templates and checklists without the need for supervision.
Demonstrates the ability to correctly interpret the results from the tests with only minimal guidance and supervision
SELF DEVELOPMENT
The Certifier II is subject to internal audits for compliance and competence.
Participates in CSA Group Continuous Improvement and Innovation projects.
Makes recommendations on new programs / equipment to expand core capabilities.
Generates ideas to improve laboratory safety.
Becomes fully knowledgeable in all national / international standards through research of standards, documentation, bulletins and technical articles in area of specialty. Recommends revisions to ensure technical consistency to resolve issues of pertinent practices, processes and precedents.
Can explain to others the standards they are competent in
Performs other duties as assigned by the PGM, Team Leader, or Manager
Preferred Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering with likely 3 years of job related experience or
Certified Engineering Technologist, Journeyman Electrician or equivalent industry experience with likely 3 years of related experience
Knowledge of CSA, UL and IEC Standards
Variety of testing procedures
Knowledge of CSA programs and services
Demonstrate the ability to confidently and clearly communicate, explain findings, test results and technical decisions to others, including customers and other engineers.
High level of interpersonal and communication skills; customer service skills
Strong problem-solving ability; detail oriented
Strong organizational, time and project management skills
Able to work unsupervised, in a team-based work environment
Computer proficiency (Microsoft Office)
Technical report writing
Use of various lab equipment, instruments and tools

Job Title: Operations & Maintenance Manager  R&M  Dip  Mechanical
Job Description:
Responsibilities:

Oversee the daily operations and maintenance of the chemical plant to ensure smooth and efficient functioning of all plant machinery and equipment.
Lead a team of technicians and engineers in executing preventive, corrective, and emergency maintenance tasks for mechanical and electrical systems, ensuring minimal downtime.
Develop, implement, and monitor maintenance schedules for plant equipment, focusing on maximizing plant reliability and ensuring compliance with safety, health, and environmental standards.
Handle the repair and maintenance of both mechanical and electrical systems, including rotating equipment (pumps, compressors), piping systems, motors, generators, and other critical machinery.
Troubleshoot, analyze, and resolve mechanical and electrical issues, ensuring proper documentation of all maintenance and repair work.
Prepare and manage the maintenance budget, optimizing costs while ensuring availability of necessary spare parts and equipment.
Develop and implement continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the plant’s operational efficiency and reduce equipment downtime.
Ensure compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements related to safety, environmental standards, and plant operations.
Conduct periodic safety inspections and audits to ensure plant equipment is operating within the required safety guidelines.
Participate in the commissioning and decommissioning of plant equipment and support any plant expansion or upgrade projects.
Provide training and mentorship to the technical team to ensure the development of skills and knowledge relevant to both mechanical and electrical systems.

Requirements:

Minimum Diploma / Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent
At least 5 – 6 years of operations & maintenance experience with mechanical background in Chemical Plant
Must have repair & maintenance experience
Basic knowledge and working experience in electrical systems is highly advantageous

Job Description:
The client is the world leading semiconductor company from USA. It is ranked as one of the “Top Best Places to Work in Singapore”. Below position is open urgently.

Position: Junior Technician I (12 months Contract, Renewable)
Location: Woodlands
Working Hours: 12 hours shift - Permanent Day or Night

Job Responsibilities:
Perform manufacturing functions in the production of semiconductor devices by operating various precision equipment within established process specifications.
During pass down, obtain the list of lots to run from the day shift engineer/technician.
Shift Duties:
1. Check MES (Manufacturing Engineering System): Monitor when the lot will hit and hold the lots at downstream steps.
2.Manage Lots:
When a lot hits, raise a SharePoint request (form) and trigger the Probe Runner to manually place the wafer on the tester or oven in sequence.
Follow the Clear Quest Request (CQ) from the Engineer.
3.Operate Software:
Use MobaXTerm (Omelek) software to load and start wafer testing.
Unloading wafers from testers/ovens.
Setting pre-heat temperatures.
Monitor and update wafer testing progress in MS Excel.
4.Close CQ Requests: Ensure all requests are completed and documented.

Requirements:
Education: GCE 'A' Level.
Preferably with working experience in the semiconductor field.
Proficient in MS Excel and computer literate.

Job Description:
Overview
We are looking for result-driven candidates who would thrive under a fast-pace working environment and having a strong desire to make an impact in their organization.

What you will do
Own the entire layout implementation process: schedule estimation, floorplanning, layout construction, physical verification and memory compiler leaf-cell creation
Implement top quality layout which meet the specifications set forth by designers and layout leads while meeting the project objectives and milestones
Diligently perform all physical & reliability verifications (DRC/LVS/ERC/etc.) on the layout designs and ensure the database is fully compliant with all requirements of tape-out flow
Work closely with multi-functional members to optimize layout realization according to the desired power, performance and area optimization requirement
Candidates with strong soft skills could be tasked to undertake project management, coaching of new hires/interns or workflow improvement initiative
What you bring
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical/Electronic/Computer Engineering or equivalent
At least 8~10 years of direct experience in custom Memory layout implementation (SRAM/ROM/TCAM/CIM) in advanced finFET/GAA process nodes
Proficient in understanding DRM of advanced CMOS technologies and have a good understanding of deep sub-micron and DFM issues (eg. WPE, LOD effects, etc.)
Strong knowledge in floor-planningtechniques at different hierarchies, with emphasis on power mesh planning, critical block placement, critical signal routing and top-down integrationflow
Strong knowledge in executing and debugging various physical verification checks like DRC, LVS, ERC, Antenna, Density, ESD, LUP, EM, IR, etc
Proficient in Synopsys/Cadence layout editors
Ability in script programming (eg. Python, Tcl, Perl or C-shell) is a plus
Team player and effective in cross-team communication and time management
Location: One North, Singapore

Why MediaTek
MediaTek Incorporated (TWSE: 2454) is the world’s 5th largest global fabless semiconductor company. Joining MediaTek means becoming part of a team that powers over 2 billion ICs worldwide, enriching and enhancing everyday life. Our chipsets are integral to a wide range of products, from smartphones, mobile devices to home and IoT devices, in entertainment and multimedia products, and provide connectivity and communication solutions that keep people connected with friends and their families with access to online resources. Working at MediaTek offers you the opportunity to contribute to the world through the devices we use in our daily lives – it’s more than just a job, it’s a chance to make a meaningful impact. – Join us now!

Job Description:
Main Responsibilities
Draft process improvement ideas with the objectives to improve process / occupational safety, improve product safety/quality, reduce energy consumption, improve production capacity/productivity, and reduce costs.
Implement Process Improvement ideas via management of a Change system and/or Non-regular work system.
Coordinate, arrange, and plan new grade trial run with the R&D and Operation team, and handle the trial run and the evaluation.
Evaluate process performance and key process parameters from a long-term view and/or periodically to uncover potential risks that may lead to Plant instability, Safety, or Quality issues.
Troubleshoot plant trouble related to process, perform root cause analysis, and propose corrective and preventive measures as process engineering function or based on a request basis.
Participate actively in HAZOP, FMEA, and Control plan studies as Process engineering functions for safety and quality improvement.
Oversee Process related capital expenditures project from conceptual design up to Front End Engineering Design (FEED) and Lead the project assigned by the (assistant) manager of the department.
Study and implement Industry 4.0-related technologies as part of Productivity Improvements and Process Improvement Projects.
Participate in Company's EHSQ program and cooperate with its promotion and improvement.
Collaborates with other departments in Management systems such as ISO9001, ISO14001, ISO45001, SS651, IATF16949, Safety Case regime, Energy management system, and ISCC plus as process engineering function.
Perform study as Process Engineering Function such as NRW, MOC, and as requested by other departments.
Keep and maintain a safe and healthy work environment.

Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Chemical Engineering
Experience in Petrochemical Industries will be advantageous.
Possession of Singapore Certified Energy Manager (Preferred)
Familiarity with Safety Case Regime
Familiarity with IATF 16949 standard (Preferred)
Familiarity with ISO9001, ISO14001, ISO45001 and SS651.
Familiarity with IEC 61511 standard (Preferred)
Familiarity with Process Simulation software such as Aspen Plus®, Aspen, and HYSYS®.
Familiarity with Distributed Control Systems (DCS), in particular, its logic and sequence modification.
Able to multi-task and handle a wide spectrum of responsibilities.
Good interpersonal skills and strong analytical skills.

Job Description:
Duties

· Carrying out process design works in accordance with project contracts / scope of work
· Preparation of process deliverables including but not limited to calculations, simulations, H & M balances, PFDs, UFDs, P&IDs, Line list, datasheets, control philosophy, C&E Charts, Technical notes, Study reports etc.
· Equipment, Instrument sizing & and adequacy checks of existing ones
· Assist Process Safety works via participation in HAZIDs, HAZOPs and close out of action items ensuring design satisfies all operational and safety requirements
Contribute to preparation of operating & training manuals, project documentation as required.
· Ensure design deliverables reflect accuracy and meets codes, guidelines & standards while following company QA/QC procedures
· Ensure that assigned work is delivered on schedule, budget with intended quality
Producing cost effective solutions that are novel, technologically robust and fit for purpose,
· Management and coordination of the Process discipline engineers & designers to ensure effective use of the available resources
· Ensure that the design incorporates process integrity, conforms to mandatory standards, project requirements, good engineering practices and reflects the best possible option in terms of cost and efficiency
Review facility layout, 3D-model and piping GA / ISO drawings and other cross-functional documents to ensure correct interpretation of process requirements.
· To be responsible for all the technical decisions or corrective actions associated with process design.
Plan, Monitor & control process discipline workstream and provide progress updates to the PM and management team on a regular basis.
Consult with other disciplines and foster a cohesive working environment.
Coach and mentor lesser experienced team members
Consult with the Client / Stakeholders on various discipline attributes of the project
Handle Change management (if any) by timely initiating, coordinating, and seeking project / client approvals.
Support Q & A activities related to department standards & procedures development
· Support to proposals and other business pursuits

Requirements
· Tertiary education in Chemical or Process engineering
10-15 years' experience (with minimum 3 years as Senior Process Engineer), Coal Gasification, LNG, New energies, Power, Refinery, Petrochem, O & G domain
Those having experience in projects directly involving Coal Gasification, New Energy (H2, Ammonia, renewable energy), Energy Transformation or GHG Roadmap would be given preference.
· Experience in Conceptual, Feasibility and Optioneering Studies, with exposure to FEED, DE in an EPC/EPCm or Consulting environment
Previous experience in managing a process team
· Able to collaborate & communicate effectively within a multidiscipline design team in a matrix organization, demonstrably a good team player
Skills in Microsoft Office Programs (Word, Excel, Outlook, Power point etc.) and process simulation software particularly those to be used for projects
Self-organised, has ability to work under tight deadlines, and able prioritize work to achieve intended outcome.
Has great analytical thinking, requires min supervision
Takes ownership, works with integrity
Command over reading and written English.

Job Description:
Daily Operation Tasks:
1) Execute a post-test review of results
2) Engage customers with the aim to build & maintain good relationships with customers by understanding Customers' testing objectives and to give advice and technical explanation to customers pertaining to standard test methods, acceptance criteria, and result analysis
3) Maintain long-term quality control practices in the department
Ensure the use of appropriate standard test methods for departmental tests;
Ensure Technicians adhere to the written procedures while performing tests;
Maintain preventive maintenance, periodic verification, standardization or calibration of departmental test equipment;
Maintain and monitor long-term quality indicators such as control charts;
Advise calibration points & degree of accuracy and precision required prior to calibration of departmental test equipment;
Review of calibration certificates for errors/correction factors to be applied during operations, and measurement uncertainty to update uncertainty budget table.
4) Under heavy load, assist with the execution of tests
Learning & Development:
1) Reach the expected competency level for departmental tests according to Company policy.
2) Set up a comprehensive training syllabus to properly deliver structured training on different standard test methods
3) Deliver practical training to Technicians by referring to written procedures
4) Draft PTS Test Procedures & periodic update of existing PT Test Procedures annually & debrief/communicate summary of changes to the respective team members.
Quality Assurance:
1) Comply with quality regulations set by the Company, including following PTS Test Procedures when carrying out tests.
2) Execute method development, method validation & verification.
3) Report to seniors on departmental non-conforming work.
Safety:
1) Comply with safety & health regulations set by the Company.
2) Oversee the stock-taking of safety equipment (PPE) in the department, including loan units for visitors (if applicable).
Other assignments that your seniors may request from time to time.
Qualifications
Bachelor Degree in Material Science or relevant Engineering/ Science Field with 1 year of relevant experience
Familiar with ISO 9001 Manufacturing and ISO 17025
Possess knowledge of common material specifications and metallic material properties.
Understand why certain maintenance and calibrations are required
Keen learner (show interest and take initiative to learn own Departments' tests)
Passionate (with a Can-Do attitude)
Attentive to details (spot anomaly in work/test)
Ethically minded (show a strong sense of integrity in his work; report non-conforming event)
Good communication skills (provide technical advice and explanation to customers on work/test performed)

Job Title: Fulltime  Parttime Premium Coffee Machine Technicians
Job Description:
Premium Coffee Machine Technician

We are seeking full-time or part-time premium coffee machine technicians who specialize in the cleaning, maintenance, repair, and installation of coffee machines in cafés, offices, and hotels.

Responsibilities:
1. Perform regular cleaning and maintenance of beverage dispensers and coffee machines.
2. Diagnose and repair mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic systems of the machines.
3. Install new equipment and provide customer training on machine use and maintenance.
4. Ensure that all hygiene and safety standards are met.
5. Manage warehouse operations, including:
1) Cleaning and repairing machines
2) Inventory management of parts, tools, and machines.
3) Proper storage and handling of equipment.

1. Two years of experience as a technician, technician apprentice, or in a relevant field.
2. Able to multitask, work independently, or as a team player.
3. Responsible and highly passionate about the machinery industry.
4. Hygiene and cleanliness are top priorities.
5. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
6. Motorbike license required.
7. Warehouse inventory skills are an advantage.

Job Description:
Our client is a well-established multinational corporation, serving as a one-stop communication provider in Southeast Asia. They offer comprehensive solutions and services to meet diverse business needs in the region.
They are seeking are seeking an experienced Channel Alliance Manager to drive business expansion across the APAC region through strategic technology alliances and distributors.
In this role, you will collaborate with sales, presales, marketing, and partner teams to promote IT System Integration products and solutions. Your primary focus will be on fostering strong partnerships with key technology providers and developing joint go-to-market campaigns that drive sales growth.

Key Responsibilities:
Manage and grow relationships with strategic technology partners (e.g., Cisco, Fortinet, CrowdStrike).
Collaborate with the Partner Program Team to create and execute partner campaigns.
Drive business success by working closely with sales, presales, and marketing teams.
Develop and implement business plans with strategic technology alliances.
Build executive-level relationships with key partners.
Create and execute enablement training programs for sales and presales teams.
Generate demand and accelerate sales opportunities to closure.
Attend industry events, trade shows, and partner meetings to drive business growth.
Requirements:
Proven experience in selling IT System Integration products and solutions.
Strong understanding of IT market trends and technology (experience with Cisco, Fortinet, or CrowdStrike preferred).
Regional experience in the APAC market, with knowledge of local business landscapes and distributors.
Business development experience, especially in managing partner programs and strategic alliances.
Strong collaboration and relationship-building skills.
Willingness to travel as needed.
This role offers a fantastic opportunity to lead strategic initiatives in a dynamic and growing market. If you have a strong track record of success in IT sales and channel partnerships, we want to hear from you!
To apply, please send your latest resume, in word format outlining your relevant experience and qualifications to ong.irene@platformnco.com. We look forward hearing from you.
Only shortlisted candidates will be responded to, therefore if you do not receive a response within 14 days, please accept this as notification that you have not been shortlisted.
Please note that unfortunately, at this moment, our client is unable to extend support to candidates under the EP, SP, or WP schemes. Thank you for your understanding.

Job Description:
Job Description
Project Management - Setup and drive lifecycle of a project. Accountable for project planning, execution, monitoring, risk management, resolution of issues and achievement of the targets set for the project such as delivery of the Scope within agreed Quality, Time, Budget & other agreed KPIs/SLAs. Monitor the progress and Predict risks (Quality, timeline and budget) as needed and take necessary mitigations which lead to meet the KPI. Prioritisation of activities (self, team, external). Determine, drive and monitor internal processes within the team.
People Management - Attract, develop and retain talent to build and maintain strong, effective & competent teams and build their knowledge. Structures the group in a way that is best-suited to the project and maximizes efficiency. Coaching and empowering the team. Fostering an environment that encourages team work, motivates and inspires. Manage the day to day employee relation aspect.
Technical Leadership - Leads the team to resolve technical challenges. Leads cross initiatives to build the technical competency to meet the needs of the team or unit. Applies his or her technical expertise to solve problems and enable the team to deliver quality solutions. Develop training materials and train RF engineers and installers as required. Promotes team engagement and motivation. Provides technical guidance to RF teams in regards to the network planning / advanced optimization strategies such as layer management / traffic balancing / efficient spectrum utilization.
Quality - Accountable for meeting quality objectives. Accountable for team following best RF engineering practices, quality processes and methodologies.
Communication - Promote clarity and alignment by communicating effectively to the project team ongoing on the unit goals and status, project matters, etc. Communicate effectively up, down and laterally. Strive to have strong and healthy working relationships with the team.
Business value - Manage efficiently the stakeholders relationship and communication to ensure the project's delivery is aligned to meet not only the customer requirements but in addition add value to their business.

Qualification
At least a Diploma in Telecommunications, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Electrical & Electronics Engineering or equivalent.
At least 4 years of experience in the Identity and Access Management industry.
Significant proficiency, in-depth knowledge in Access Management System (AMS).
Experience in Testing, Commissioning, Integrating, Supporting, Fault Analysis and Diagnosis of Access Management System.
 Previous experience in leading tasks or mentoring engineers.
 Self-motivated with strong sense of responsibility and urgency.
 Good in documentation, reporting and tasks tracking ability.
 Excellent communication skills
 Strong analytical skills, able to work independently and cope with pressure.
Salary will commensurate with experience.

Job Description:
Job Descriptions:-

Inspection Products:
Conduct detailed inspections of raw materials, components and finished products to ensure products meet quality specifications and standards.
Documenting Findings:
Records and analyzes test data and inspection results.
Prepare detailed reports to document findings, deviations, and corrective actions.
Implementing Quality Standards:
Assist in the development and implementation of quality control policies, procedures, and guidelines.
Ensure compliance with company quality standards and industry regulations.
Identifying Defects:
Detect and identify defects, deviations, and non-conformities in products or processes
Recommend corrective actions and participate in root cause analysis.
Collaborating with Production Teams:
Work closely with production staff to address and resolve quality issues.
Provide training and guidance on quality standards and procedures to production personnel.
Reporting Issues:
Communicate any quality control issues to superior.
Recommend and implement solutions to improve product quality.
Job Requirements:-
Minimum Diploma in Engineering or Quality Certification or equivalent
At least 2 years of experience in semiconductor industry with quality check experience.
Experience in quality control or quality assurance in manufacturing or production environments.
Strong attention to detail and analytical skills
Familiarity with quality control tools, techniques, and equipment.
Excellent documentation and communication skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Proficiency in using computer software for data entry and analysis.

Job Description:
Summary
The Regional Head of Business Excellence is responsible for leading transversal projects and activities within the region. In close collaboration with Head Office (HO) Business Excellence team, the position will partner and support transformation project implementation, communication and change management with all key stakeholders and other HO and Regional departments.

This role requires conceptual and strategic thinking with advanced problem-solving and decision-making skills. An inspiring management style incorporating CMA CGM’s vision and values, that is naturally collaborative, bold and teamwork driven.

Responsibilities
Governance: Ensure implementation of business transformation framework defined by HO Business Excellence team for project management, communication, change management & management reporting in the region. Be the key interface for Regional Office (RO) Management & Agency General Managers for topics and projects related to Business Process Transformation
Projects: Contributing, leading, and implementing business projects in the agencies network which are transversal in nature
Continuous Improvement: Identify, Implement and Lead continuous improvement initiatives in the region
Efficiency: Focus on Productivity & Service Quality through continuous improvement
Deployment & Change management: Prepare & support RO and Agencies for project deployment and change management
Collaboration: Act as bridge between the Agency Network, RO Management, HO Business Units and Global Experience Network (GEN) Business Excellence teams
Proactively working with regional senior leadership teams to identify and deliver improvements that support our vision, values, and strategic plan

Requirements
At least 8-14 years of experience in the field of shipping & logistics complimented by process expertise in agency processes
Successful track record in areas of Business & Process Transformation, Continuous Improvement, Digitization, Customer Experience and Project Management
Demonstrated ability to lead organisational strategic planning and to implement processes that integrate business objectives into accountable outcomes
Demonstrated excellence in delivering transformational change, innovation initiatives and process improvements
Experience in implementing HO Projects successfully

Job Description:
Internship Opportunity at Singapore Environment Council
Position: Intern - Policy Research and Eco-Certification Development
Location: Singapore Environment Council (SEC)
Duration: 3 to 6 months

About Us:
Singapore Environment Council is a non-profit organisation that facilitates and co-ordinates environmental causes in Singapore. Join our team as we work to promote changes that will benefit the environment and coming generations.

Key Responsibilities:
Conduct comprehensive research on environmental policies, regulations, and best practices related to sustainability, with a focus on areas such as green procurement and eco-labelling.
Analyse data and information to identify trends, gaps, and opportunities in the field of environmental sustainability, providing insights to inform decision-making processes.
Assist in the development and refinement of green certification standards and criteria, ensuring alignment with international benchmarks and local contexts.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams within SEC to integrate sustainability principles into various sectors and industries, promoting the adoption of eco-friendly practices.
Stay updated on emerging trends, technologies, and research findings in the field of environmental sustainability, sharing insights and recommendations with the team.
Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in a relevant undergraduate or graduate program, preferably (but not necessary) in environmental science, sustainability, policy studies, or a related field.
Strong research and analytical skills, with the ability to gather, synthesize, and interpret data from diverse sources.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and concisely.
Proactive and self-motivated, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
(Most importantly) Passion for environmental conservation and sustainability, demonstrated through previous academic or extracurricular activities.
Benefits:
Hands-on experience in environmental policy research and development.
Opportunity to work alongside seasoned professionals and industry experts.
Exposure to diverse stakeholders and networks within the sustainability ecosystem.
Professional development and mentorship opportunities.
Certificate of completion and letter of recommendation upon successful internship tenure.
By responding to Singapore Environment Council's advertisement, consent is considered given to Singapore Environment Council to collect the required personal data for the purpose of recruitment. Singapore Environment Council will protect personal data with security safeguards that are reasonable and appropriate to the sensitivity of the personal data, to protect it from unauthorized access, use or disclosure and complies with applicable regulatory requirements with respect to the retention of personal data.

Kindly submit your CV updated with your availability. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Title: Senior Manager Lab Resource Mgt Resource Planning
Job Description:
Our client is actively searching for a Senior Manager, Lab Resource Management, Resource Planning & Mgt to join their team!

If you are a dynamic individual seeking a new career opportunity, read further!

The responsibilities of this role are:
Establish and upkeep processes for lab space changes (new lab setup, decommissioning, change of use, change request) and liaise with relevant stakeholders.
Oversee lab resource planning for optimisation of lab utilization and capacity management.
Adopt and implement automation, technology or process optimisation to manage lab operation data for management reporting.
Establish and lead periodical review of SOPs to streamline workflows for continuous improvement in lab operations and equipment maintenance.
Lead in the procurement activities, such as reviewing of Invitation to Quote and Invitation to Tender, Purchase Request, coordinating with vendors/suppliers to ensure timely execution of lab operations and compliance to procurement policy and relevant regulations.
Drive initiatives to manage procurement processes and vendor management for better cost benefits.
Work closely with Professional Officers, Technical Officers, Finance and relevant stakeholders on procurement of lab supplies, consumables, equipment maintenance contract services, etc., and ensure timely submission of goods receipts in the system for invoicing and payment purpose.
Support in the management of asset life cycle and ensure accurate records of assets through asset verification, in accordance with the Finance Manual.
Function as part of the Resource Planning and Management Team to support the division’s activities and administrative needs, including proper documentation of records.
Undertake any other duties as assigned by the Director, POD or supervising officer for the effective support of division operations and activities.
The ideal candidate will need to have the following qualities and experience:
Possess a good degree with minimum 8 years of relevant experience in procurement and resource management.
Experience in supply chain and lab resource management would be an advantage.
Experience in establishing and managing information system, data collection, data mining and using appropriate tools and techniques for analysis will be an advantage.
Able to effectively communicate with a wide range of individuals in a diverse community and possess the confidence to front different parties.
Proficient in analysing and assessing challenges, with demonstrated ability in developing solutions to problems, coordinating between different parties to achieve positive outcomes.
Possess strong project management skills and attention to detail, and willing to take on responsibilities and ownership of work.
Demonstrate good leadership, lead and motivate teams.
Team player and good communicator, self-motivated and good interpersonal skills, enjoys interactions and working with different parties.
Able to work within tight timelines, as well as plan and coordinate among multiple stakeholders.
Organized and meticulous with a keen eye for details, particularly with numbers.
Ability to multi-task and work within tight timelines.
An exciting career awaits the right candidate! Click "Quick Apply" to register your interest now.

What do we do?

At Infosys Compaz(iCompaz), we focus on Digital Transformation for enterprises across industry vertical segments and services. We take clients on a rewarding journey of Digital Transformation, with strengths in AI, Data, User Experience, Cloud, Cybersecurity and Analytics, while also serving clients in their IT management in technology operations, infrastructure and applications. We serve a comprehensive client network spanning multiple industries and are helping clients meet the challenges of the digital economy in financial services, retail, transportation and logistics, telecom, services, and resource sectors, among others.

Why iCompaz?
iCompaz is a Joint Venture between Infosys Limited and Temasek Holdings, both global leaders in their respective industries, and the JV was created exclusively to bring Digital Transformation capabilities and global skills to the ASEAN market. Temasek Holdings is a global investment company headquartered in Singapore. Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting, headquartered in Bangalore, India.
We take pride in our fair employment opportunity. You are welcome at iCompaz regardless of age, race, gender, religion, marital status and family responsibilities, or disability.
We offer an inclusive and diverse workplace environment to support your career aspirations. We have a strong emphasis on continuous learning to your professional and personal growth. If you are looking for an opportunity where you would be able to make an impact with what you are good at, and at the same time being able to explore any other area that interests or motivates you, WE’VE GOT YOU COVERED!

Job Description:
Position Overview:
You would be part of a dynamic digital SoC design team that develops state-of-the-art video processing, neural processing, advanced video analytics accelerators, and the entire Camera Processor SoC. You would be joining the team to explore, evaluate and define innovative design SoC architectures, to meet or exceed the technical requirements of the SoC. You would be responsible for the successful implementation of the designs in Verilog/SystemVerilog coding, metrics measurement to meet key objectives & results, and follow-through in comprehensive verifications to successful silicon.

Requirements:
1. Experience in SoC architecture and design, and RTL coding with Verilog/SystemVerilog
2. Experience in ARM, RISC processor system
3. Experience in embedded C and assembly code programming
4. Experience in analysis of power, timing and area
5. Experience in at least one of scripting languages (e.g. Perl, Python, TCL, or Bash)
6. Disciplined, quality-minded, and highly driven for excellence
7. Excellent team player and good communication skills
8. MSEE/BSEE in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering
9. Candidates with relevant experiences would be offered as Staff, taking on higher responsibilities
10. Experience in always-on system, automotive system, secured system, bus interconnect, neural processing, video processing and video analytics is a plus
11. Experience in system modelling and simulation using emulator and SystemC is a plus
12. Passionate and strong in general programming is a plus

Job Description:
Supporting the Mechanical maintenance team, you will be responsible for the effective maintenance plant and equipment to achieve high reliability and availability in accordance with statutory, regulatory and safety requirement.

Execute approved plant improvement works

Job Description:
Role Purpose:
To lead Project's quantity surveyors’ team with integrity, supporting the project organization as a subject matter expert for quantity surveying, This role to be perform assigned project Quantity Surveying activities with administrative post-subcontracts (Block-K) documents (e.g. Major Fabrication Subcontracts Agreement and Related Exhibits A-J) with accountability.

Key Accountabilities:

Project QS Procedures implementation & Compliance
Incorporating best practices in quantity surveying policies as well as considering project-specific needs to ensure reasonable standardization of quantity surveying practices across projects.
Manage Yard Quantity Surveyors
Plan, select, recruit, train, deploy, develop, and manage the careers of Quantity Surveying Section team members to the satisfaction of project requirements, ensuring qualified resources are always provided on time to maintain project performance.
Communicate with Project Controls managers to ensure quantity surveying related issues are properly supported and pipelined for resolution to streamline and debottleneck project execution.
Contract Claims and Negotiations Support
Ensure contractual terms and conditions are properly followed and the project gross margin is protected.
Technical Guidance
Guide quantity surveyors and act as specialists on quantity surveying towards the organization to guarantee clarity on contracts quoting, approval, administration, and claim management.
Coordination with contractors & internal clients
Commercial and non-commercial negotiations are conducted in diligent, compliant, and transparent manner, driving the lowest total cost of ownership through the project lifecycle (proposal, EPCCI, operations and decommissioning).
Core Responsibilities:
Observe basic Subcontracts agreement’s core points of General costs and Remeasurement costs and it’s mechanism. Thoroughly understand of the “Method of Measurement”, Overall Pricing Schedule or Schedule of rates (SOR) and Support services unit rates as per Contracts Agreement Exhibit-E guidelines.
Ensure to determine of Base scopes and additional scopes. In depth knowledge on Excel formulas such as Pivot table, V-Lookup, Concatenate, $sign freeze in column & rows and its mechanism, including error reading and understand of the formatted documents from Subcontractor in a easiest and efficient way of computations.
Close coordination with Construction, Engineering, Planning and Quality team to update actual progress status and identify potential change works and understand it’s root cause of change.
Update on SI-Log / COR or CR, CO-Log and monitoring change work completion status Update on a timely manner and periodical distribute to PMT liaising with Snr. Lead QS. Verify Remeasurement Quantities submitted by subcontractor as guided by method of measurement in contracts and liaising with Project Lead QS using Company Standard format as per Subcontracts Agreement.
Verify reimbursable or Cost-Plus documents (Chinese, Portuguese, other) submitted by subcontractor and update to Project Lead QS of the outcome and notify immediately if any discrepancies found.
Verify Custom clearance documents (Chinese, Portuguese, other) submitted by subcontractor and update to project Snr.
Lead QS of the outcome and notify immediately if any discrepancies found in cost and inappropriate documents found.
Assess cost of the T&M works and timesheet verifications liaising with subcontractor’s counterpart to finalize the appropriate cost impact.
Material reconciliation against with free issued (MFE) materials and as built quantities and identify the gap, if found over issued the relevant cost to be back charged to subcontractor Assist the project Snr.
Lead QS for Final Closure accounts and safe keep Project Data in appropriate J-Drive folder / Share points as directed by the head of the department.
Financial and Operational Dimensions/Impact and Decision-making
He / She has got no specific budget responsibilities Work under general supervision and instructions by the Project Snr. Lead Quantity Surveyor as per established procedures to perform variable tasks time to time without limiting the job scope.
Work Relationships
Reports to Project Snr. Lead QS and Head of the department Regular close coordination with Subcontractor’s counterpart and Company construction team Perform prioritized work scopes as guided by Project Snr. Lead QS.
Regular interaction with all Engineering Team, Discipline Leads, Superintendent and Construction & Quality Managers to keep update day-to-day status.
Job Challenges and Problem Solving
Teamwork and sharing responsibilities are essential with own team as well as Subcontractor’s team to have smooth working environment.
To adopt the fast-track work environment and inconsistent / challenging working environment.
To handle high volume of works during peak periods without limiting scopes and timing Strong negotiation skills required to handle subcontractor’s counterpart by using Subcontract clauses and T&C without compromising of Subcontractor’s misinterpretations and influences at any circumstances.


Qualifications:
Bachelor of Engineering Degree, Engineering Diploma, Marine Degree / Diploma Graduates or Oil & Gas related Bachelor of Engineering Degree / Diploma is essential.
Experiences: Minimum 5-8 of Experiences in Oil & Gas especially FPSO shipbuilding or Shipyard experiences.

Competencies:
Technical:
Advanced MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) / AutoCAD / Primavera Training Certificates

· Performs total preventive maintenance (TPM) procedures as planned.
· Performs inspections required by scheduled TPM or Work Order requests.
· Performs basic troubleshooting on mechanical and hydraulic equipment.
· Perform regular maintenance tasks at the facilities in accordance with the SOP.
· Identify and pro-actively respond to maintenance and operation needs.
· Support the Maintenance Supervisor (Mechanical) in performing the maintenance duties.
· Allocate appropriate resources to execute the work order, follow up work order and ensure that resources are used to optimum effect.
· Assessing the need of mechanical spare parts to avoid delays in TPM. Tool & instrument inventory/ maintenance.
· Establish and run small workshop activities.
· Identify and pro-actively respond to abnormality.
· Trouble shoot equipment failure and execute TPM work.
· Attend to equipment breakdowns and propose remedial actions and conduct follow up checks.
· Work to incorporate efficient methods of maintaining new equipment or plant and involved in the installation and commissioning process.
· Ensure all maintenance activities carried out are following relevant quality and environment policies, safety & environmental rules, and regulations requirements.
· Supervise any external vendors providing maintenance services.
· Support the maintenance Supervisor to develop and implement plant improvement plan.
· Complete and maintain accurate, timely documentation and records as required by the Maintenance Supervisor.
· Undertake any other duties as assigned by the management.

Requirement:
Minimum NITEC / Diploma in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent with 2 years of experience in a Power Plant environment.
Possess good working knowledge of all operations in the plant.
