Job Description:
Nanyang Technological University (NTU) is an internationally renowned tertiary education institution. It boasts a strong engineering college and is ranked among the best globally. Committed to our mission of educating leaders and advancing knowledge for Singapore and beyond, we have built global programmes and established strong links with leading institutions around the world.

The School of Civil and Environmental Engineering (CEE), which is under the College of Engineering (COE), aspires to be a leading school for Sustainable Urban Systems. The School is rapidly expanding its range of educational and research activities. Its faculty has led major university-wide strategic research thrusts in space creation, water research, sustainable built environment and future driven maritime research. Going forward, CEE is addressing critical problems in urban systems such as building structures and energy systems, sustainability of urban cities, and resiliency to natural and unnatural risks.

The Maritime Studies (MS) Programme stands as one of the largest programmes in CEE and holds the distinction of being Singapore's largest MS programme. It is rapidly expanding to maintain Singapore’s position as the leading global port hub and international maritime centre. The MS programme also endeavours to support Singapore’s maritime industry in its effort on decarbonisation and digitalisation. CEE also houses the Maritime Energy & Sustainable Development Centre of Excellence (MESD) which primarily focuses on energy management, emission management, and sustainable maritime operations.

To fuel further development, we invite applications for Associate Professor (Tenure-track) position in the following areas of Maritime Studies.

Applicants need to have an earned PhD degree from a reputable university in relevant disciplines with expertise in areas such as maritime data analytics, maritime digitalisation and automation, maritime sustainability, carbon accounting, life cycle assessment, sustainability reporting, ship energy efficiency and performance measurement, marine environment and energy management, maritime resilience, shipping management, shipping finance and management, maritime technology and innovation management, maritime conventions and regulatory framework, maritime simulation and modelling, international trade and brokering, multi-modal transport, global strategy and risk analysis.

Applicants should demonstrate strong and relevant teaching ability and has excellent communication skills. Although not mandatory, at least 2 years of postdoctoral experience and teaching experience at the tertiary education level are preferred.

Application Procedures

Applicants are invited to submit their applications (cover letter, detailed CV including publication list, research and teaching statements, citation report, and/or any other documents that demonstrate qualifications and credentials) through the NTU Workday career portal.

Application remains open until the position is filled. Only short-listed candidates will be notified.

Job Description:
Overall Responsibility: Strategize, plan, and execute to achieve the assigned individual sales target. Key activities include:
Customer Relationship Management:
○ Strategic Planning: Design and implement strategic account plans that align with customer goals and company objectives, ensuring long-term partnership growth.
○ Develop and maintain strong working relationships with assigned strategic and emerging customers.
○ Maintain an in-depth understanding of the customer’s internal organization, including key contacts such as sponsors, decision-makers, influencers, and project managers.

2. Sales and Revenue Growth
○ Develop and implement sales strategies; mentor and guide junior team members.
○ Monitor team performance and ensure targets are met.
○ Sales Activity Management: Lead sales activities, ensuring alignment with strategic goals, and reporting on performance metrics to senior management.

3. Sales Strategy and Team Leadership:
o Develop and implement sales strategies; mentor and guide junior team members.
o Monitor team performance and ensure targets are met.

4. Collaboration and Coordination:
○ Cross-Departmental Leadership: Lead cross-functional teams in complex sales engagements, ensuring seamless coordination from pre-sales through to post-sale delivery.
○ Work with Pre-Sales Support and Marketing Specialists to follow up on high-priority opportunities.
○ Ensure timely responses to customer requirements, proposal writing, presentations, and submissions.
○ Drive brand coverage and mindshare to secure contract awards.

5. Cost and Pricing Management:
○ Pricing Strategy: Develop and implement pricing strategies that maximize profitability while remaining competitive in the market.
○ Manage the cost of sales and make final pricing decisions in line with gross margin target guidelines.

6. Client Intelligence and Feedback:
○ Market Insight Development: Collect and analyze market data to inform sales strategies and identify emerging trends that could impact client relationships.
○ Act as the client representative to gather commercial intelligence for internal analysis and decision-making.
○ Address client feedback and complaints promptly.

7. Project and Financial Coordination:
○ Financial Accountability: Oversee account profitability, ensuring alignment with financial goals and budgetary constraints.
○ Monitor closely with the Service and Project Delivery team to ensure timely delivery.
○ Coordinate with the Finance team on customer billing and ensure timely customer payments.

8. Presentations and Event Participation:
○ Deliver impactful presentations; represent the company at industry events and networking opportunities.

9. Leadership & Development:
o Scale-Up Experience: Proven experience in leading sales teams within scale-ups, particularly in technology companies that have successfully completed Series B funding or beyond.
o Team Development: Demonstrated ability to develop, mentor, and grow a high-performing sales team, including managing and guiding team members through periods of rapid growth and investor scrutiny.

Position Requirements:

Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field.
Experience Requirements:
5+ years of experience in sales, account management, or business development, preferably in a B2B environment.
Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
Experience managing strategic accounts and working with senior-level decision-makers.

IT Literacy:

Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Develops and update piping specifications according to P&lD, contract scope of work (i.e. GTD, SOW) and class/rules requirement (ABS, DNV), etc.
Builds Caesar II model for pipe stress analysis and Prepares pipe stress philosophy, pipe stress critical line list
Analyze calculation output and guide piping deigners
Runs pipe stress analysis and conduct checks (stress, deflection, equipment nozzle, flange, fatigue, blast case if applicable)
Optimize support load if the load is found too high and provide solutions if stress results fail
Generates load restraint summary for pipe support modellers and stress Isometric and/or stress mark up
Prepares report for clients and resolve owner comments
Issues pipe stress analysis report and perform trunnion calculation
Updates Caesar.II model base on modeller feedback/site feedback and conduct all relevant stress checks
Verifies types of primary pipe support based on pipe stress analysis results (rest, guide, hold-down and line stopper)
Performs visual check and calculate pipe support load for non-critical line
Performs Compressor equipment check, Expansion joint check and Spring hanger in stress analysis.
Carries out inspection at site and onboard vessel to do as built
Requirements:
Minimum Bachelor Degree in Engineering
At least 5 year of piping engineering related working experience or similar activities as described above
Proficient in Microsoft Office products, AutoCAD and Caesar ll Stress Analysis Software
Prefer to have experience in Offshore/Shipyard project, Rig building/Ship building, FPSO projects (both topsides & marine)
Understand class/rules requirement such as ABS, DNV, etc
Understand P&IDs and other related piping items (i.e. equipment specifications, etc)
Able to conduct stress checks and piping related checks
Able to communicate & write in English
Able to work overtime when required

Job Description:
Mon to Fri 8.30am - 5.30pm

Job Summary

Responsible for management of Asia Quality System, Policies, Programs and Initiatives. Part of the Global Quality Team to maintain global quality system and drive global initiative.

Role and Responsibilities
Quality Systems

1. Supports overall maintenance of quality systems
2. Monitor and reports on the quality performance for Asia Operations such as product quality performance, supplier performance and gaps for continuous improvement to the management team
3. Maintains the Master control and ISO document control system
4. Maintains customer related documents such as Quality Agreement, PPAP
5. Part of the Global Quality Team, to design and implementation of global policies and systems

Quality Policies
6. Ensures effective implementation of all company quality policies
7. Implements ISO and other recognized standards
8. Implements and monitors statistical techniques such as R&R’s to identify opportunities for improvement.
9. Sets, communicates, and implements quality objectives in line with business goals
10. Manage supplier and customer programs (CCAR, ICAR and SCARs) to ensure that complaints are handled effectively and timely.
11. Support and work with different stakeholders on reporting, monitoring and resolution on customer complaints.
12. Support and work with Supply Chain and Operation on supplier quality issues.

Auditing
13. Leads ISO quality standards implementation as Management Representative.
14. Conducts and leads quality audits to specific quality standards.
15. Leads customer related audits
16. Conducts supplier audits
17. Conducts internal audit investigations for product quality and process issues
18. Responsible for ensuring timely resolution to audit findings

Training
19. Provides training for all employees on basic quality and statistical concepts
20. Provides training to appropriate personnel for updates and changes to quality policy
21. Attends relevant external training sessions/courses and shares learning internally

Job Requirements:
• Degree or equivalent experience in a field of study such as chemistry, business, accounting, engineering, etc.
• Certificate in Quality Engineering is preferred.
• Position requires 3-6 years of quality management experience.
• Good experience into customer & supplier audit and able to conduct training
• ISO 13845 experience will be added advantage.
• Demonstrates introductory understanding and ability and with guidance, applies competency in typical situations.
• Able to design quality systems to meet customer expectations and internal needs. New approaches and continuous improvement must be ongoing
• Good interpersonal skills to be able to communicate and collaborate with all stakeholders and deal with situation proactively
• Junior with 1-2 experience in related field can also apply
• Occasionally overseas travel and weekly conference call is required for the role
• This position required to communicate closely with vendors in China.

Ensure that the solution and architectural design satisfies customer technical and program requirements (including budget and schedule); is implemented in line with product policy, legislation, appropriate Technical Regulatory framework, and design obligations and that technical risks are identified and managed.
This System Architect (Project Design Authority) member of the Engineering team, reports functionally to the Engineering Director and operationally to the Project Manager.
He/she interfaces with Technical Directorate from the Business Line.

It also involves the following tasks:
Oversee the conduct and approve the outcome of trade studies to evaluate design alternatives in order to provide advice to both the customer and internal technical teams.
Coach and mentor architectural and technical teams.
Lead collaborative discussion between internal teams, vendors and customers to clarify and define system requirements.
Consult with customers and their representatives in order to appropriately influence system architecture and design.
Ensure that the proposed architecture and design will meet the customer’s requirements
Approve the system architecture, and provide leadership and guidance to the architecture team
Through broad consultation, produce documentation in support of the project, to the satisfaction of the customer.
Review and evaluate Thales Ground Transportation and third party documentation and products.
Liaise with customers on technical, architectural and procedural issues as required.
Other duties as directed by the Project Manager.
Ensuring the implementation of multi-project synergies in order to optimize cost of technical solutions.
Developing and implementing policies, standards and procedures for the engineering and technical work performed in the Program, in conjunction with the Systems Engineering Manager.
You have:
QUALIFICATIONS
Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electronics Engineering or related discipline (essential)
Higher degree qualifications are desirable.
AWS Certification, CISCO Certification or others are highly desirable
ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE
Minimum of 10 years’ experience in a Senior Engineering role
Experience on architecting the complex solution, including hardware and software,
Experience on designing the IT infrastructure, large scale network, virtualization and containerization,
Experience on software architecture such as N-Tiers Architecture, SOA or micro-services,
Experience working on Communication System, SCADA system or Fare Gate Collection for Transportation projects,
Knowledge on Public Announcement system, Passenger Information system, Tetra Radio shall be advantage,
Experience in managing multi-disciplinary teams
Experience in managing multiple small projects simultaneously
Strong oral and written communications & liaison skills.
Membership of relevant professional organisation, e.g. INCOSE, Institution of Engineers Singapore, etc.
DESIRABLE EXPERIENCE
Experience on Data Analytic and Machine learning is advantage,
Experience in a project management or a systems delivery management role.
Experience working within a Systems Engineering lifecycle

Job Description:
Are you keen to explore a role in geotechnical engineering?

We are looking for an engineer who is open to a site-based project role, or an office-based design engineering role.

A day in the life of an engineer at site
Contributing technical expertise to project drawings/designs/operating parameter and overseeing construction engineering processes
Plan detailed instructions (with updated engineering drawings) on daily project activities, and monitor progress to ensure activities are executed as per project specifications.
Assist in project cost control in line with the project budget (e.g. ensuring value-based procurement practices, optimum machine utilisation and usage of spares and scrap process compliance)
Understand the geotechnical aspects of the project e.g. Soil Condition, CPT etc, so as to identify risk to project and to take steps to mitigate.
Ensure all project documentation (progress reports, progress claims, daily reports, site diary, QA/QC report etc.) are submitted and follow up to ensure collection of approved documents in a timely manner.
Performing cost calculations and preparing financial projections, to submit accurate Project Finance Reports and work related reports in a timely fashion.
Responsible to implement global QA/QC program and initiatives to ensure the QA/QC compliance in execution of projects. .
Responsible to implement global HSEQ programs and initiatives to ensure HSEQ compliance in execution of projects. Performing regular tests on materials and procedures to ensure compliance with project/athorities regulations.
Preparing work schedules in collaboration with the project manager. Liaising between clients, contractors, subcontractors, vendors, and suppliers.
A day in the life of a design engineer
Design support for tenders:
Review and summarize soil condition reports, tender specifications and requirements.
Identify and summarise geotechnical problems and technical risk.
Analyse geotechnical problems and draft technical proposal.
Design-related coordination work for ongoing projects:
Perform analysis and design in accordance with current legislation, standards and codes of practice
Prepare detailed construction drawings with the assistance of draughtsperson.
Conduct regular site visits to integrate design concept and actual ground conditions.
Quality Control (QC) review and verification between design assumptions and actual site conditions.
Carry out geotechnical analysis and design using tools such as Slope/W and Plaxis as well as Keller’s in-house software.
Conduct back analysis and research for future improvements based on actual performance and as-built data.
Prepare technical proposal for remedial work during construction when required.
Liaise with clients/consultants/ sub-contractors on technical related issues.
You will need:
A professional degree in Civil or Geotechnical Engineering
Experience in ground improvement will be advantageous (fresh gradudates are welcome to apply)
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Powerpoint), AutoCAD, Plaxis 2D and Plaxis 3D
A valid Supervise Construction Work for WSH certificate (preferable)
What we offer:
Annual Leave, Medical Insurance, Medical Leave, Variable Bonus, Learning & Development Opportunities, Referral Rewards & Employee Assistance Programme
Global & Regional networking opportunities
Friendly team and enjoyable working environment
We encourage applications from the right candidates regardless of age, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief or race. Learn more about Keller's Inclusion Commitment at https://www.keller.com/how-we-work/diversity-equity-and-inclusion

https://www.kellerasean.com/

Job Description:
About the Company
Deutsche Telekom Global Business is the international B2B division of Deutsche Telekom. We are addressing the network and connectivity requirements of globally operating companies through the design, implementation, and management of secure custom-designed solutions and related managed services ‒ whether it's SD-WAN, LAN infrastructure, Unified Communication & Collaboration, or Security (including SASE).

We help our customers build future-proof foundations for their digitalization strategies. Through a consultative and vendor-agnostic approach ‒ backed by the most comprehensive partner ecosystem in the industry ‒ we ensure that our end-to-end solutions perfectly match our customers' business needs, providing them with the flexibility to grow. With decades of experience, we know how to operate networks and deliver connectivity globally.

About the Job
We are looking for a TC Specialist Sales Hunter with passion, drive and genuine customer first approach to help enterprise customers achieve their digital transformation goals.

You will help to establish Deutsche Telekom as a critical business partner, building a sustainable reputation around our solutions and in the way we do business and drive our growth in the Asia region.

You will lead revenue generation, develop new sales opportunities, manage the pipeline, build & execute account strategies, close large enterprise-level deals, and lead customer expansion for our network managed services, security and collaboration solutions.
You will strategize and engage with enterprise level customer IT executives creating significant impact at a great company while building your sales career.

This business-critical role has global responsibility and will provide guidance to virtual teams across the world to develop corporate relationships, drive growth opportunities and deliver positive outcomes for our customers and organisation. It will also significantly contribute and influence the overall sales strategy to succeed in Asia.
This is a great opportunity for a high achieving individual with the ambition and talent to grow their career within a leading global technology company.

What will be your responsibilities:

You will lead revenue generation and have overall responsibility for winning new logo deals:

· Creating a pipeline for EURO 15m-20m or more in new business/new logos with focus in SD-WAN, IPVN, SASE, UCC solutions and other telecommunication products and solutions.

· Responsible from bringing in Order Entry (OE) and ensure achievement of Sales target in profitable core business.

· Establish structured sales channel partnerships and drive order entry through these channels.

· Ensure marketing initiatives are aligned with go-to-market strategy and with tangible impact on sales results.

· Create strategic account plans to expand DT’s customer relations within enterprise customers and to identify opportunities at early stage to increase our share of wallet.

· Develop proposals together with the pre-sales team and in close collaboration with service and project management in a matrix organisation to present winning solutions to the enterprise customers.

· You will be responsible for managing the entire deal process from lead to closure.

· Through Customer Business Management increase customer satisfaction and account profitability.

· Ensure reliable pipeline reporting and sales forecast (including global accounts that report directly to the MD).

· Close cooperation with MD, local peers from Finance and Delivery and global account teams to ensure achievement of joint goals and success of the Company.

· Any other tasks as assigned.


Profile of candidate

A true hunter with a strong track record of consistent Enterprise sales overachievement.
Track record of navigating large, complex deals and consistently achieving and exceeding quota.
Experience working for up-start, hyper-growth companies preferred.
Team player, able to work effectively cross functionally with senior management and corporate counsel and a wide variety of other team members.
Excellent presentation and negotiation skills.
Desire to win.
Self-starter, with integrity and accountability, highly motivated, competitive, entrepreneurial and attracted to a challenging opportunity.
Experience in selling SD WAN, SASE, Unified Communication & Collaboration, IPVN and other Telecommunication products & Solutions
Relationships to industry leaders (CEOs/CFOs) of relevant Accounts in the Asia Pacific region.
TC Specialist Sales hunting experience of minimum 10 years
Preferably a varsity degree in engineering, business or economics

Job Description:
Key Roles and Responsibilities:
1. Strategic and Team Leadership
- Define and implement the engineering strategy in line with business goals.
- Lead and develop the engineering team, ensuring high performance and innovation.
- Recruit, mentor, and retain skilled engineers to meet the company’s needs.
- Identify new technologies and drive technical advancements to maintain competitiveness.
2. Product Design and Technical Oversight
- Oversee the product design process, ensuring technical feasibility and alignment with market needs.
- Provide technical guidance to the team and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
- Continuously improve designs and introduce innovations to enhance product quality and performance.
3. Project Management
- Manage all engineering projects, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget.
- Collaborate with other departments to ensure smooth project execution.
4. Quality Control
- Ensure product design and production meet quality standards and customer expectations.
- Implement quality control measures and drive improvements in the production process.
- Review testing results and ensure compliance with quality requirements.
5. Supplier Management
- Oversee suppliers to ensure materials and components meet quality and cost requirements.
- Evaluate supplier performance and maintain a reliable supply chain.
- Conduct supplier audits to ensure standards are met.
6. Production Line Planning
- Design and optimize production lines to increase efficiency and meet production targets.
- Lead the installation of new production lines, ensuring effective setup and operation.
- Continuously evaluate production line performance to improve output and flexibility.
7. Process Improvement and Optimization
- Identify inefficiencies in production processes and implement improvements.
- Apply lean manufacturing and other techniques to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.
- Work across teams to streamline production and maintain high quality standards.
8. Risk Management
- Identify and mitigate technical and operational risks early in the project lifecycle.
- Ensure all operations comply with safety and regulatory requirements.
9. Collaboration with External Partners
- Work with external suppliers and customers to ensure technical solutions align with business objectives.
- Manage vendor relationships to ensure timely and high-quality deliveries.

Skills / Experience Requirement:
1. Educational Background
- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, or related field).
- Advanced certifications in project management or engineering leadership are a plus.
2. Experience
- Minimum 10 years of experience in engineering roles, with at least 5 years in a leadership or management position.
- Proven experience in leading engineering teams and managing complex projects from concept to production.
- Strong background in product design, manufacturing processes, and production optimization.
- Experience with quality control, supply chain management, and process improvement (e.g., Lean, Six Sigma).
- Hands-on experience with risk management, budgeting, and resource allocation.
3. Technical Skills
- In-depth knowledge of engineering principles, product development, and manufacturing techniques.
- Proficiency in CAD software and other engineering tools.
- Familiarity with industry standards and regulatory requirements relevant to the company's products and markets.
4. Leadership, Communication, and Problem-Solving
- Strong leadership and project management skills, capable of efficiently leading teams, managing cross-functional collaboration, and ensuring on-time project delivery.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with internal teams and external partners, influencing decision-making.
- Strong problem-solving and innovation skills, able to analyze complex issues and continuously drive product and process improvements.
5. Adaptability and Flexibility
- Ability to adapt to changing priorities, market demands, and technological trends.
- Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Job Description:
Saviynt is an identity authority platform built to power and protect the world at work. In a world of digital transformation, where organizations are faced with increasing cyber risk but cannot afford defensive measures to slow down progress, Saviynt’s Enterprise Identity Cloud gives customers unparalleled visibility, control and intelligence to better defend against threats while empowering users with right-time, right-level access to the digital technologies and tools they need to do their best work.

The Senior Solutions Engineer is a member of the Saviynt Sales organization, responsible for collaborating with the Account Executives and Regional VPs to sell an integrated suite of Access Governance and Cloud Security solutions to new and existing accounts. This individual will have a broad understanding of vendor solutions, industry best practices, and technology integration, demonstrating expertise and delivery of functional and technical solutions to sophisticated customer engagements. This individual will also provide expert knowledge to existing and prospective customers through conducting detailed technical discovery, responses to Request for Proposals (RFPs), and delivery of Proof of Concepts (POCs). Besides, this individual will be a contributor to Product Marketing collaborating in the development of white papers, solutions briefs, webinars, and blogs.

The Senior Solutions Engineer will work proactively, and independently with various facets of the business ultimately driving opportunities to closure and possibility impacting revenue. The Senior Solutions Engineer will be expected to mentor/coach Solutions Engineers on strategy, influencing the customer, managing scope, and execution of technical presentations.
The ideal candidate will be located in Singapore and will work remotely + travel.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
Develop and deliver technical presentations to demonstrate enterprise solutions, ease-of-configuration, simplicity of architecture, and intelligence of workflows providing the opportunity for customer interaction and demonstrating excellent presentation skills.
Effectively communicate solution value to the business and technical audiences that is clear and satisfies prospective customer requirements and/or inquiries.
Provide needs assessment, consultation, technical solutions, and customer support with a team of Saviynt professionals.
Collaborate with both the sales and global bid team members to respond to satisfy prospective customer inquiries resulting from an RFx.
Assist members of the global bid team and collaborate with members of the product management team in the curation of RFx responses.
Effectively communicate with sales directors and sales management, working proactively and independently to prioritize and manage top regional opportunities, driving them to closure.
Regularly provide solution feedback and competitive intel from the field to Saviynt product management, solutions strategy, and marketing teams.
Ramp and coach Solutions Engineers on solution demonstration, RFP responses and presentations, technical overviews, POC scope management, and execution.
Up to 50% travel
WHAT YOU BRING
Minimum of five years previous Solutions Engineering with demonstrable success in Cloud Security, Privileged Access Management, Application GRC, and/or Identity Governance and Administration solutions
Ability to work well both independently and collaboratively
Effective communication skills both verbally and written
Bachelor's degree in information systems or related areas, or demonstration of equivalent knowledge such as technical certifications from ISACA, (ISC)², AWS Cloud Practitioner, Microsoft Azure Fundamentals, Google Cloud Security Engineer, etc.
Peer collaboration

Job Description:
About Us
AsiaNext is a trusted digital exchange for institutional investors in Asia and globally. It will offer integrated listing, trading, and post-trade services for digital assets, including digital payment tokens. This joint venture between SBI Digital Asset Holdings Co., Ltd. (SBI DAH) and SIX Digital Exchange (SDX) will provide an institutional-grade platform to enable the tokenization and trading of existing securities and non-bankable assets.
AsiaNext will support the growing institutional demand for trading of public and private digital assets. It will leverage the extensive networks of SBI DAH in Asia and SDX in Switzerland and Europe, as well as their joint expertise in fulfilling institutional investors’ needs. Both SBI DAH and SDX have demonstrated leadership in digital asset markets globally through multiple investments, issuances and initiatives in this space.
Why Join Us?
With SIX Group AG and SBI Digital Asset Holdings Co., Ltd. as shareholders, AsiaNext has significant financial backing supporting its mission of building the world’s first institutional-grade digital exchange for institutional investors, and fostering trust through rigorous security and compliance to regulations. The team comprises members with traditional finance, digital finance and technology background spanning decades at UBS, JPMorgan, SIX, Thomson Reuters, MAS, SGX, DBS, Citi, Credit Suisse, Barclays, securities tokens and crypto exchanges, and many others.
If you are looking to develop your career in a professional and well-run environment, yet which moves and grows rapidly, join our diverse and talented team to build the digital exchange of choice for institutional investors.
About This Role:-
This position offers the opportunity to delve into the technical intricacies of a regulated digital exchange. The selected candidate will collaborate closely with the application team to develop, test, and maintain existing applications. Familiarity with Solidity, NodeJS, Angular, or similar technology stacks is expected.
Responsibilities
· Develop digital exchange services such as client workflow, bank connectivity, blockchain integration and post trade functionalities.
· Assist to establish an automated testing framework for regression testing.
· Maintain and improve the functionality of the existing web portal.
· Propose and maintain a streamlined workflow solution for client onboarding.
· Familiarity with Solidity, NodeJS, Angular, or similar technology stacks is expected.
Education:
· Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in a computer-related major or equivalent.
How to Apply
· Please send your resume to hr@asianext.com stating your name and title - Software Development Intern in the subject line.

Job Title: Senior Risk Engineer Or Risk Engineer Downstream Energy
Job Description:
Job Title: Senior Risk Engineer / Risk Engineer, Downstream Energy
Location : Singapore

The Opportunity:
Provides risk assessment and risk improvement services for customers and business partners in specific or multiple lines of business. Acts as a recognized expert with an enhanced level of expertise in respect of a specific line of business or significant risk area. The candidate must have experience in Oil Gas and Petrochemicals. Additionally, experience in LNG / Sustainable Fuel production will be added advantage.

Key Responsibilities:
Assess the quality of complex risks as described in the appropriate standard(s) and related competency level, and assess loss potentials in accordance with agreed definitions.
Support external customers by identifying, and reducing the risks that they face individually, and on an overall account basis.
Provide appropriate risk improvement advice, conduct loss investigations (including both trend and root cause analysis), and implement risk improvement programs.
Share technical expertise with colleagues, business partners and customers through training delivery or participation in a Centre of Expertise or industry segment.
Produce work that complies with Company standards, in terms of technical quality of policies and procedures.
Anticipate, recognize and respond to the needs of customers by providing expert solutions and training to key customer(s), and contribute to Business Operation Profit through opportunity spotting.
Develop and maintain positive customer and business partner relationships, and collaborate with both customers and Business partners to develop appropriate service plans.
Resolve technical issues, problems and projects in reference to policies and procedures within a specific function or unit.
Utilize established financial systems to assess loss potential in order to manage and control exposure to the organization.
Develop a simple business case for a defined project to determine potential benefits, clarify the rationale for investment and support the planning process.
Develop and maintain positive customer and business partner relationships, and collaborate with both customers and business partners to develop appropriate service plans.
Prepare draft manuals based on the accepted changes to policies and procedures, to ensure they are up to date and reflect new policies.
Research primary data sources, select relevant information related to ordinary types of risks and make appropriate recommendations to external customers.
Act as technical expert supporting external customers by identifying, assessing and reducing the risk they face in order to contribute to the continuous improvement of customer services.
Maintain oversight of service delivery to the customer to ensure service expectations are fulfilled, reinforcing customer focus across the team.
Provide specialist risk improvement advice to address specific technical queries from internal clients and deliver appropriate risk improvement programs, in line with the organization´s policies and processes and regulatory requirements.
Contribute to the Business Operating Profit through opportunity spotting and cross selling.
Anticipate, recognize and respond to the needs of customers by providing expert solutions and training to key customer(s) and contribute to Business Operation Profit through opportunity spotting and cross selling.
Qualifications, Skills & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering
Minimum 5 years industry experience in OGP - chemical process, troubleshooting and optimization or Loss control / Risk Engineering experience within Insurance industry
Good understanding and able to perform HAZOP Risk Assessment reviews and OGP safety management program
Strong consultation skills to identify and implement risk reduction strategies with customers
Functioned as safety leader and promote safety learning and training.
Familiarity of industry codes and standards such as API, NFPA, ISO, ASME & SS 506 - Singapore Standard Occupational Safety & Health (OSH)
Perform as investigator / senior investigator towards incident investigations and reports
Strong written and verbal communication skills and consultative skills
Proficient computer and software skills
Able to conduct presentations with large and small groups of all business level
Experience in LNG plants & facility will be an added advantage
Sells mindsets with a proven ability to obtain fee for service is a plus

Job Title: Assistant Professor  In Civil Engineering And Construction
Job Description:
Nanyang Technological University (NTU) is an internationally renowned tertiary education institution. It boasts a strong engineering college and is ranked among the best globally. Committed to our mission of educating leaders and advancing knowledge for Singapore and beyond, we have built global programs and established strong links with leading institutions around the world.

The School of Civil and Environmental Engineering (CEE), which is under the College of Engineering, aspires to be a leading school in Sustainable Urban Systems. Its faculty has led major university-wide strategic research thrusts in space creation, water research, and sustainable built environments. Moving forward, CEE is addressing critical problems in urban systems such as digital construction, urban solutions for the built environment and sustainability, and resiliency to climate change, as well as natural and unnatural risks.

To expand our range of educational and research activities and fuel further development, we invite applications for Assistant Professor (Tenure-Track) positions with the following expertise:

Land Surveying and Geodesy
Applicants should have a PhD in Civil Engineering, geomatics, geodesy or related fields. Suitable candidates must demonstrate strong and relevant research and teaching ability in the field of land/hydrographic surveying, geomatic applications in construction industry. Familiarity with the best practise in the relevant industry is a great advantage. In addition, strong interdisciplinary expertise is required in research areas such as intelligent construction, construction automation, built environment sustainability, systems modelling and risk management. Potential teaching areas include fundamental of land/hydrographic surveying, introduction to geodesy and geomatics engineering and geomatics applications in intelligent construction.

Structural Engineering and Construction Automation
Applicants should have at least a PhD in Civil Engineering or Construction Management. Suitable candidates must demonstrate strong and relevant research and teaching ability. Familiarity with the best practise in the relevant industry is a great advantage. In addition, strong interdisciplinary expertise is required in research areas such as digital construction, construction robotics, construction automation, building information modelling, lean construction, built environment sustainability. Potential teaching areas include construction technology and processes, building information modelling (BIM), building services in construction, project planning & management, engineering economics and project evaluation, information technology in civil engineering, and Design for Manufacturing and Assembly (DfMA) or Virtual Design and Construction.

Coastal Protection Engineering
Applicants would need to have an earned PhD degree in in Civil Engineering, Environmental Engineering, or a closely-related discipline, and have strong interdisciplinary expertise in the domains of coastal science/engineering, environmental fluid mechanics, or hydraulic engineering as applicable to protection of coastal infrastructures and/or ecosystems tapping into combinations of grey/green approaches. Familiarity with the best practise in the relevant industry is a great advantage.

Application Procedure

Applicants are invited to submit their applications (cover letter, detailed CV including publication list, research and teaching statements, citation report, and/or any other documents that demonstrate qualifications and credentials) through the NTU Workday career portal.

Application remains open until the positions are filled. Only short-listed candidates will be notified.

Job Description:
The School of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering (MAE) is one of the top 12 mechanical and aerospace engineering schools in the world. With well-established industry partnerships, MAE provides an active and vibrant research environment with excellent R&D infrastructure and numerous opportunities for research funding. The school has an enrolment of over 2500 undergraduate students with over 90 faculty members and 140 full-time research staff working in well-equipped state-of-the-art laboratories. A growing research student population of over 400 is also actively engaged in strategic research and development work.

We invite highly qualified candidates in the following expertise areas to join our dynamic team of faculty.
Mechanical Engineering
Candidate Profile:
Possess relevant Bachelor and PhD degrees from reputable universities.
A good research track record and postdoctoral experience would be advantageous.
Research intersects the multidisciplinary field of sustainable manufacturing and automation with transport phenomena, as well as thermal and fluids engineering.
Thermal and fluid sciences are applied to various areas of interest, including but not limited to artificial intelligence, sustainable energy systems, materials processing and additive manufacturing.
Demonstrate specialization in experimental methodologies, computational analysis/simulation and sustainable manufacturing.
Successful candidates are expected to teach at both undergraduate and graduate levels, supervise graduate students and undergraduate projects. Candidates on tenure-track would also be expected to acquire research funding and conduct research.
We Provide:
An active and vibrant research environment
Excellent R&D infrastructure and opportunities for research funding
Well-equipped state-of-the-art laboratories
Attractive research start-up grants and PhD student scholarships
A competitive remuneration package and attractive benefits

Job Description:
About NSING:
As part of Nations Technologies Group, NSING was founded in 2018 in Singapore bringing high-performance semiconductor products and solutions to global semiconductor industry. Our products includes General and Secure MCU, Secure IC for TPM (Trusted Platform Module), Bluetooth Low Energy BLE and BMS (Battery Management System). When you join NSING, you will be part of a talented team in the Singapore R&D Center where we develop high performance MCU targeting for Industrial and Edge AI applications.

Your Role:
As an Embedded Software Engineer, you will contribute to the development of application test software, device drivers and customer reference software. You will be working in various aspects of the SoC development in FPGA prototyping, post silicon validation and customer reference applications.
Work closely with SoC Design and Verification engineers to develop a comprehensive and complimentaryvalidation test plan.
Participate in SoC design reviews to have in-depth understanding of the chip.
Participate in PCB design review to provide requirements from software perspectives.
Develop Hardware Abstract layer drivers for in-house testing as well as production ready SDK for customers.
Validate new and existing hardware IP on FPGA prototype and actual silicon.
Validate system level performance and test for robustness of SoC.

Job Description:
Who we are
Do you want to join our Geo-data revolution? Fugro’s global reach and unique know-how will put the world at your fingertips. Our love of exploration and technical expertise help us to provide our clients with invaluable insights. We source and make sense of the most relevant Geo-data for their needs, so they can design, build and operate their assets more safely, sustainably and efficiently. But we’re always looking for new talent to take the next step with us. For bright minds who enjoy meaningful work and want to push our pioneering spirit further. For individuals who can take the initiative but work well within a team.


Job Summary:
Vessel Resource Manager's Responsibility shall include the following but not limited to:
Ensure timely availability of 3rd party chartered and owned vessels post mobilization ensuring efficiency and good planning of mobilizations and demobilizations.
Provide day-to-day support to Project Manager(s), offshore Technical Coordinator(s), on equipment related queries and troubleshooting, liaising with equipment resource team on technical topics as necessary.
Monitor and analyses the operational utilization of the company owned and 3rd party vessels ensuring optimized planning for maintenance days, and efficient management of any hired resources, with resulting guidance towards company procurement strategies in conjunction with Business Analysts.
Support and guide the business on all matters relating to 3rd party offshore vessel selection based on fuel consumption, vessel reliability, DP performance, availability and costing through the project life cycle.
Guide and support Commercial teams at project bidding stages, assisting project and operational teams with day-to-day operational performance and challenges, through to Lessons Learned (review and application) on project completion.
Support Operations Manager(s) and Service Line Manager(s) in long-term resourcing strategies, and annual review / adjustment of hardware White Book Rates.
Manage / perform annual maintenance OPEX budget planning for project equipment permanently installed on owned vessels.
Manage the operations of company internally owned and 3rd Party survey and light-geotechnical vessel operations, including mobilizations while keeping safety of operations as top priority.
Ensure timely vessel availability keeping mob / demob / maintenance time optimised and well planned.
Ensure efficient selection of 3rd party vessels for projects with detailed scrutiny of vessel systems to ascertain the reliability (i.e., maintenance & reliability of vessel systems and minimising equipment down time)
Ensure uptime for project equipment on owned vessels by ensuring proper planning and management of project equipment maintenance whilst they are onboard.
Ensure that expenditure on mob/demobs is optimized by proper planning and budgeting.
Ensure that day to day operations are planned systematically taking into consideration any SIMOPS and work collectively towards achieving a zero harm environment.

About You
Vessel Resource Manager (VRM) will be a qualified and experienced Marine Engineer / Naval Architect with operational and maintenance knowledge of electrical, and mechanical (hydraulics) systems. Ideally the VRM should have sailed as a minimum 2nd Engineer (unlimited) and / or possess a minimum 8 years of shore experience managing various types of Offshore Vessels (DP1/2/3) including preparation of technical budgets and understands BIMCO charter party contracts. It is desirable if he has a high-level knowledge of geophysical survey and / or seabed light-geotechnical site investigation, and technical equipment used to conduct such operations.


What we offer
Competitive salary with Annual Wage Supplement
Generous paid-leave
Career & training opportunities (international opportunities possible)
Company shuttle from various pick-up at MRT stations across Singapore
Collective health insurance and outpatient benefits;
Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) to provide help when you need extra support.
Additional benefits: Long Service Awards, Professional Membership, Weekly fitness-related activities, etc)
**Benefits may vary according to position/contract/grade level.


Our view on diversity, equity and inclusion
At Fugro, our people are our superpower. Their variety of viewpoints, experiences, knowledge and talents give us collective strength. Distinctive beliefs and diverse backgrounds are therefore welcome, but discrimination, harassment, inappropriate behaviour and unfair treatment are not. Everybody is to be well-supported and treated fairly. And everyone must be valued and have their voice heard. Crucially, we believe that getting this right brings a sense of belonging, of safety and acceptance, that makes us feel more connected to Fugro’s purpose ‘together create a safe and liveable world’ – and to each other.


How to apply
Please include your latest resume in the application.
Please describe your working rights in Singapore (work pass sponsorship is subject to quota and availability).
We regret to inform that we will only process applications made via our Careers website (and other linked portals) and only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

Job Title: Testing And Commissioning Manager   Waste Management
Job Description:
Job Descriptions:
On behalf of the Owner’s Engineer (OE), the T&C Manager shall be responsible for overseeing all testing and commissioning activities of the IWMF Contractors, including the coordination of testing and commissioning activities of TWRP that interface with IWMF.
The T&C Manager shall lead the OE’s proposed testing and commissioning team and coordinate with its Resident Site Supervision (RSS) Team and OE’s design team as well as the Contractors to review the development of the Contractors testing and commissioning plan and the Contractors execution of their plan in order to achieve the Project milestones for each of the IWMF EPC Contracts (EPC Package 1 – Waste to Energy/Materials Recovery Facility and EPC Package 2 – Sludge Incineration Facility/Food Waste Treatment Facility).
The T&C Manager shall oversee the whole of each Contractors testing and commissioning activities, and the interfaces between EPC1 and EPC2 and TWRP as relevant, which should commence from dry/cold to hot commissioning to successful completion of entire commissioning process and trial run, including optimisation of plant operation with the Contractors and O&M teams.
Direct liaison with Client’s Technical Directors/PGMs.
Attendance at Client Monthly Project Steering/Working Committee Meetings chaired by DCEO and any other relevant high-level meetings as required by the Client/PD/SO.
Chairing regular T&C Coordination Meetings with the Contractor and/or Other Contractors on adjacent sites (that is attended by Client representatives or similar others also)
Any other matters that may from time to time be delegated by the PD/SO.
Member of internal Senior Project Management Team (PMT) that meets regularly (chaired by PD/SO) to discuss progress and resolve any internal issues.
The OE’s T&C Manager is estimated to be mobilised to site at least 6 months prior to the commencement of actual testing and commissioning by the Contractor in order to familiarise themselves with the Works and the Contractors plans for the T&C and the expectations of the Client.
Job Requirements:
The T&C Manager shall have at least 15 years of hands-on relevant experience in testing and commissioning (and operation) of large scale solid waste management projects (Waste to Energy - WTE, sludge incineration, materials recovery and food waste treatment), or experience with large scale industrial/process/utilities projects (i.e. waste, water, oil & gas, power) testing and commissioning.
The T&C Manager shall have a relevant engineering degree or certification.

Job Description:
As a Mechanical Supervisor, you will be responsible for overseeing the construction and installation of mechanical systems on an FPSO project. Your role will ensure the safe, efficient, and high-quality execution of all mechanical tasks, from installation to handover, in alignment with project specifications, industry standards, and regulatory requirements.

Key Responsibilities:
Mechanical Systems Oversight: Supervise the construction and installation of mechanical systems, including pumps, compressors, piping, rotating equipment, and other marine systems.
Team Leadership: Lead and manage the mechanical team, providing guidance and supervision to ensure smooth execution of project activities.
HSE Compliance: Ensure all work is conducted safely and in accordance with Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) policies and standards.
Project Coordination:
Coordinate with project management, marine, and engineering teams to meet project schedules, milestones, and deadlines.
Manage site resources (materials, tools, manpower), ensuring timely delivery of equipment and services.
Monitor and report on mechanical progress, ensuring timely completion in line with project timelines.
Requirements:
5-10 years of supervisory experience in mechanical construction, particularly on FPSO or marine projects.
Strong knowledge of FPSO systems, marine operations, and mechanical equipment such as generators, pumps, compressors, turbines, boilers, and purifiers.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Mechanical Engineering, Marine Engineering, or related disciplines.
Recognized certifications in mechanical supervision within the Oil & Gas or Marine sectors (e.g., API, ASME).
Familiarity with industry standards and regulatory codes, including DNV, ABS, API, ASME, and IMO.
Skills & Competencies:
Strong leadership and communication skills, capable of managing teams and liaising with project stakeholders, vendors, and clients.
Problem-solving and decision-making capabilities, especially in high-pressure environments.
Excellent organizational and multitasking skills, able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Desirable Qualifications:
Experience working on international FPSO projects with offshore exposure.
Familiarity with mechanical systems, procedures, and standards is highly preferred.
Willingness to travel to offshore or remote project locations as required.

Job Description:

COMPANY DESCRIPTION
The National Volunteer & Philanthropy Centre (NVPC) is the steward of the City of Good vision for Singapore, where individuals, organisations, and leaders come together to give their best for others. Through our brands, programmes, and initiatives, we facilitate partnerships with non-profits, organisations, public sector bodies, and individuals to enliven the giving ecosystem within Singapore. A keen interest in social issues and/or the non-profit space, with a research interest linked with at least one of the four topic areas listed above.

Job Description:
Who We Are
We are an Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology backed by Shell, one of the world's leading energy companies, dedicated to tackling the most complex issues in the energy sector through groundbreaking research and development in AI and Data Science. Founded in Singapore, our ultimate goal is to establish ourselves as the leading hub for AI and Data Science R&D in Southeast Asia.
We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. As a Software Engineer, you will work on designing, developing, and improving key components of the technology stack related to AI, data engineering, high-performance computing (HPC), and geophysics, among other specialized topics. We are looking for people from various development backgrounds but most importantly someone who is passionate about solving challenging problems and can think out of the box.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and improve key components of the technology stack in high-paced, high-impact real-world projects.
Apply the technology to real work and high-impact client projects.
Maintain high code quality standards and be accountable for the work delivered.
Requirements
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computing, Science, or Engineering with 2 years of software development experience.
High proficiency in Python is a must. Experience in C, C++, Rust, or other programming languages is a plus.
Good aptitude for abstract thinking and problem-solving. Good understanding of complex algorithms and data structures.
Experience is required with essential development tools such as Git, Linux Shell Scripting, Vim/Emacs, etc.
Experience with parallel computing, system programming, full-stack development, and web development can be a plus.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with high expectations.
Benefits
Why Join LRD?
LRD offers a conducive work environment in a company culture that values authenticity, integrity, technical skills, teamwork, and results. Here are some of the opportunities offered by the position:
You are always presented with new challenges to solve intellectually stimulating problems. The work never gets stale, mundane, or boring.
Continuous learning opportunities to develop your technical expertise in many subfields of AI, ML, HPC, Geoscience, Engineering, etc.
Your work will have an immediate impact on high-impact real-world problems such as natural resource exploration and energy security.
Have your work recognized with publication opportunities in top scientific conferences and journals.
Be rewarded for your contributions with high-performance bonuses well above the market rate.
Friendly and casual working environment.

Job Description:
About Innowave Tech Singapore
Innowave Tech is an Artificial Intelligence (AI) company offering solutions for the Semiconductor and Advanced Manufacturing industry. Utilizing deep industrial domain knowledge, proven experience, and innovation, we provide expert AI solutions and systems to address various industry pain points.

Why Join Us
As our clientele expands within the semiconductor and advanced manufacturing sectors, our team needs to expand accordingly. If you possess quick learning abilities and thrive in a rapidly evolving environment, this is the perfect opportunity to join us!

Roles and responsibilities
We are seeking a dynamic and motivated Php Software Developer Intern to join our team. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the development and maintenance of software applications using Php programming language. You will work closely with our development team, gaining hands-on experience in database management, networking, and software design.

Key Responsibilities
• Assist in developing and maintaining web applications using PHP programming language.
• Work with MySQL and SQL Server databases to manage and manipulate data.

Job Description:
AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.

You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.

Amazon Reverse Logistics is an electronics processing, reuse, and recycling company that works to extend the life of used electronic equipment through reuse, repair, and recycling; providing IT Asset Disposition services to other Amazon companies with a specialization in the handling of valuable electronic equipment that was originally used in data centers. Come join our team and be a part of history as we deliver results for the largest cloud services company on Earth!

Amazon Reverse Logistics is looking for a talented, driven, and highly organized Program Manager who will focus on developing the strategic roadmap of the program. As a Program Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and coordinating the development and expansion of the program's intake mechanism as well as acting as the key point of contract for business expansion opportunities. Your primary goal will be to understand customer requests and work with internal stakeholders to develop scalable solutions. This effort will entail, intake mechanism development, customer requirement capture, solutioning, risk assessment, and financial ROI analysis.

The PM will play a critical part in assessing how to prioritize projects and gaining internal approvals. Once projects are approved the PM will support onboarding and project oversight to maintain scheduling commitments, budget considerations, and meet the objectives outlined by stakeholders. This includes partnership with internal operations and systems/technical teams to develop scalable processes, KPI metrics, developing monthly business reviews that drive progress on project goals, understanding of operational process and program objectives/SLAs, and customer centricity to drive adoption and expansion. The role plays a critical part in ensuring strategic commitments are made and critical parts can be dispositioned expeditiously. Clear written and verbal communication with an understanding how to develop focused metrics to drive accountability and expedite execution is a must.

As a Program Manger, you find clear paths through roadblocks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints. You will have an ability to take large, complex programs and break them down into manageable pieces, develop functional and technical user stories, then deliver them in a successful and timely manner. Maturity, high judgment, negotiation skills, ability to influence, analytical thinking and leadership are essential to success in this role.

Key job responsibilities
• Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of multiple projects simultaneously. Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, and resource efficiency measurements.
• Working on a diverse project portfolio supporting sustainability and recovery initiatives and strategy.
• Serve as the primary point of contact for internal stakeholders, including Operations, Commercials, Customer, Environmental, and Finance leadership. Regularly communicate project status, milestones, and risks, and address any concerns or feedback in a timely manner.
• Coordination of global monthly business reviews with associated metrics and narrative including document writing and presentations to influence necessary business actions benefiting program adoption and further global expansion.
• Partnership with reporting teams to develop new reporting & metrics to monitor efficiencies and SLA commitments.

Basic qualifications
• 5+ years of program or project management experience
• 3+ years of experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements
• 3+ years of experience owning program strategy, end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership
• 3+ years of experience managing Global Reverse Logistics programs

Preferred qualifications
• 5+ years of driving process improvements experience
• Master's degree, or MBA in business, operations, human resources, adult education, organizational development, instructional design or related field

Job Description:
Solutions Engineering at Wise is a post sales role, focussed on working with our integrating partners to enable them to successfully launch a product based on Wise’s products. The role is multifaceted but it has two main responsibilities — technical delivery of partners and solutioning of complex new integrations. This includes providing technical consulting, designing technical architecture and proposing novel features and how we will build them — solving for our partner’s constraints and working internally to influence the product roadmap.
Wise is expanding the Solutions Engineering function globally and we are looking for a Solutions Engineering Manager to join our APAC team to support both new and existing Wisers to achieve their potential in a fast growing team and organisation. You will work across our partners, your own team, Wise Platform and the wider organisation to maximise your team’s impact.
Your role in the team:
You’ll be responsible for the overall health, productivity and quality of your team and their output.
You’ll provide feedback on your team’s approach, help them make data-driven decisions and learn from their experiences and mistakes.
You’ll have an overview of what’s happening across the organisation and think about how this impacts partners, in terms of opportunities and risks, using this to input to the strategy of Wise Platform in APAC and beyond.
You’ll analyse how we work and deliver changes to improve our tooling and processes to streamline technical delivery.
When needed, you’ll roll your sleeves up to be involved in the project delivery process.
Qualifications
Is that you?
Have lead a team in a post-sales engineering or technical delivery capacity
Have a background in software engineering or similar technical role, writing and shipping production quality code, with at least three years experience.
Have previously worked with external parties to deliver technical projects with REST API integrations.
Experience building, leading and mentoring driven and a high performing technical delivery team.
Comfortable working on big challenges and a history of successfully delivering best in class solutions and products.
Experience building and designing scalable and performing systems within a microservice architecture.
Expert on all things API, such as RESTful design, OpenAPI, OAuth2, versioning, etc.
Have a strong product mindset and be able to support others to make the right decisions and compromises.
Experience on managing client relationships and setting accurate expectations, along with handling escalations.
…but don’t worry we don’t expect you to know everything!
Nice to have bonuses:
Have worked in the payment or fintech industries.
Experience working across multiple tech stacks and frameworks.
Experience working with large incumbent partners such as major banks.
What does success look like in this role?
You’ll have found your place in our mission by successfully supporting the team to deliver partner solutions.
You’ll understand our partners and the impact our product makes to their business and their customers.
You’ll make contributions to the wider engineering goals of the company.
You’ll inspire a team environment where ideas are shared and openness is valued.
You’ll help us scale-up and build an enterprise level experience in terms of the approach and the delivered product that will impact millions of people and businesses via partnerships.
#LI-SS3
Additional Information
For everyone, everywhere. We're people building money without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive.
We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission and able to progress in their careers.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.

Job Description:
Job Title: Metal Recycling Manager
Location: Kaki Bukit
Job Type: Full-Time
About Us: We are a leading company in the metal recycling industry, specializing in the purchasing, processing, and trading of ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals. We are looking for an experienced and dedicated Metal Recycling Manager to join our team and help us grow our business.
Job Description: The Metal Recycling Manager will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of our metal recycling operations. This includes identifying and handling various types of ferrous and non-ferrous metals, managing the purchase and sale of scrap metal, and coordinating the import and export processes. The ideal candidate will have extensive knowledge of metal recycling practices and experience in building strong relationships with suppliers and customers.
Key Responsibilities:
Identify, classify, and process ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals.
Manage the purchasing, sales, and trading of scrap metal, ensuring profitability.
Oversee import and export logistics for scrap metal shipments, including customs regulations and compliance.
Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers, customers, and logistics partners.
Monitor market trends to make informed purchasing and sales decisions.
Ensure compliance with environmental, health, and safety regulations.
Track inventory levels and coordinate with the operations team to optimize processing.
Lead, train, and manage a team of recycling staff.
Requirements:
Proven experience in the metal recycling industry, with specific expertise in identifying ferrous and non-ferrous metals.
Strong understanding of purchasing and sales strategies for scrap metals.
Knowledge of import and export processes, including customs regulations.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and relationship-building skills.
Ability to work independently and lead a team.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.
Familiarity with environmental regulations related to metal recycling is a plus.

Job Description:
KEY JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES

Lead and perform with consumer centricity & operational excellence, as business partner of brands, be the relay between TRM (Paris head office) and TRAP (Singapore office) to ensure the global Development responsibility of Travel Retail exclusive set (TREX) projects, in compliance with maximum agility for growth, sustainability frame & digital transformation.

- Responsible for the project management of local TREX set new launches for all divisions.
- Define Travel Retail Exclusive’s packaging launch plan with business by incorporating profitability, scheduling, time to market (TTM), quality, and sustainability challenges.
- Supervise the project status, alert on the risk, and deliver the industrial solution with flexibility and business priorities.
- Lead entire development process, drive the projects with operation excellence, in cooperate with global development organization and eco-system.
- Mobilize cross function internal and external to develop strategy and manage transversal cooperation.
- Analysis catalogue to set direction of change management and compliance projects.
- Verify and monitor the product quality by defining the packaging & finish goods(FG) specification, conducting the Packaging & FG homologation tests, validating samples and production piece.
- Steer innovation and eco solution on the packaging design, study new trend and technology, push the boundaries of sustainability transformation from conception to production.
- Monitor the data quality and compliance with launch and artwork workflows.
- Technical support on quality management, regulatory compliance and new supplier integration.
- Build, manage and develop the team, coach for job know-how and development expertise.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

- Bachelor’s degree is required, Engineering background highly preferred.
- 6-8 years of experience in relevant project management or product development,
- 2 years of experience in team management.
- Adequate knowledge on product development process, printing technology, quality management and manufacturing flow.
- Demonstrate leadership capacity and people development track record.
- Knowledge of Travel Retail dynamics and environment is a plus.
- Good understanding of FMCG or beauty industry. Sensitivity about brands, and products.
- Comfortable working across global locations and time zones with multi-cultural environment.
- Fluent in English, bilingual (Mandarin) is preferred, but not essential.

Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Has clear understanding of cloud and on-premises infrastructure and network components.
Hands-on experience in implementing solutions on AWS and Azure.
Hands-on experience in migrating on-premises infrastructure to cloud.
Design and implement infrastructure in cloud based on customer requirements.

Liaise with product vendors in implementing the cloud solutions.
Under minimal direction, plans and conducts research in application technologies in support of business objectives.

Ensuring the stability, security, and performance of the cloud systems.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand cloud infrastructure requirements and develop appropriate solutions.
Deploying, configuring, and managing infrastructure components, including servers, storage systems, virtualization platforms, and network devices.
Perform cloud infrastructure activities including Patch management, Antivirus and Backup operations, Install & Configure Windows server roles (Active Directory, DNS & IIS), configuration of SMTP, SFTP & DHCP, etc.
Conducting regular system monitoring, troubleshooting, and performance tuning to ensure optimal operation and minimize downtime.
Implementing security measures, including firewalls, access controls, and encryption, to protect the organization's infrastructure and data.
Managing backup and disaster recovery plans and procedures to ensure business continuity.
Assessing emerging technologies and making recommendations for cloud infrastructure improvements and optimizations.
Documenting infrastructure configurations, procedures, and processes.

Good knowledge of infrastructure components, including servers, storage systems, networking, and virtualization.

Knowledge / Experience in installation / configuration of enterprise applications and tools will be a key consideration. (ex. Office 365, SharePoint, CRM, K2, and Nintex)
Solid understanding of security principles and experience in implementing security measures.
Proficient in scripting and programming languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Bash).
Experience with monitoring tools and methodologies for infrastructure performance and availability.
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. Troubleshoot, diagnose, and resolve reported issues ensuring timely resolution.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Experience working in GDC, GPC, GCC projects will be an added advantage (SG Specific)

Job Description:
Metal Recycling Supervisor
Location: Kaki Bukit
Job Type: Full-Time
About Us: We are a leader in the metal recycling industry, focusing on the processing and trading of ferrous and non-ferrous scrap metals. We are seeking a skilled and hands-on Metal Recycling Supervisor to oversee our daily operations and ensure efficient processing while maintaining safety standards.
Job Description: The Metal Recycling Supervisor will be responsible for managing the daily activities on the shop floor, overseeing the processing of various scrap metals, and ensuring that all work is carried out safely and efficiently. This role requires hands-on skills in identifying ferrous and non-ferrous metals, as well as the ability to work in challenging environments, including dusty, noisy, and hazardous conditions.
Key Responsibilities:
Supervise and coordinate the daily activities of the recycling team, including the sorting, processing, and loading of scrap metals.
Identify, inspect, and classify ferrous and non-ferrous metals to ensure proper handling and processing.
Operate and oversee the use of recycling equipment and machinery, ensuring safe and efficient operation.
Work in a challenging 3D environment that may include exposure to dust, noise, and hazardous conditions; ensure adherence to safety protocols at all times.
Train and guide team members on best practices for sorting and processing materials.
Monitor inventory levels and coordinate with the operations team for material movement.
Inspect the work area to ensure compliance with safety and environmental standards.
Troubleshoot and resolve any operational issues that may arise.
Requirements:
Proven experience in a supervisory role within the metal recycling or a related industrial sector.
Strong hands-on skills in identifying ferrous and non-ferrous metals.
Experience working in challenging environments, including exposure to dust, noise, and hazardous conditions.
Ability to operate recycling machinery and equipment.
Strong leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
Familiarity with safety and environmental regulations.
Ability to lift and move heavy objects, as the role may require physical effort.
