Job Description:
Nanyang Technological University (NTU) is an internationally renowned tertiary education institution. It boasts a strong engineering college and is ranked among the best globally. Committed to our mission of educating leaders and advancing knowledge for Singapore and beyond, we have built global programs and established strong links with leading institutions around the world.

The School of Civil and Environmental Engineering (CEE), which is under the College of Engineering, aspires to be a leading school for Sustainable Urban Systems. Currently, it has over 50 faculty members and more than 1,500 students, and is rapidly expanding its range of educational and research activities. Its faculty has led major university-wide strategic research thrusts in space creation, water research and sustainable built environment. Moving forward, CEE is addressing critical problems in urban systems such as building structures and energy systems, sustainability of urban cities, and resiliency to natural and unnatural risks.

To fuel further development, we invite applications for Associate Professor (Tenure-Track) position in Construction Management.

Applicants should have at least a PhD in Civil or Construction Management. Suitable candidates must demonstrate strong and relevant research and teaching ability. In addition, strong interdisciplinary expertise is required in research areas such as construction automation, building information modelling, construction digitalisation, lean construction, built environment sustainability, systems modelling and risk management. Potential teaching areas include civil engineering management, building information modelling (BIM), engineering economics and project evaluation, information technology in civil engineering, construction technology and processes, and Design for Manufacturing and Assembly (DfMA).

Application Procedures

Applicants are invited to submit their applications (cover letter, detailed CV including publication list, research and teaching statements, citation report, and/or any other documents that demonstrate your qualifications and credentials) through the NTU Workday career portal.

Application remains open until the position is filled. Only short-listed candidates will be notified.

Job Description:
Responsibilities:

Lead technical teams through all stages of project development for EPC turnkey projects, including detailed cost estimation, feasibility assessments, engineering designs, technical proposals, and contract strategy formulation.
Conduct in-depth technical site surveys and evaluations, ensuring all project designs are grounded in practical, site-specific data and best practices.
Develop comprehensive risk management plans and financial controls, ensuring both budget compliance and effective mitigation of technical risks throughout each project phase.
Formulate and implement advanced quality management frameworks, including QA/QC procedures, to uphold engineering and construction standards across all phases of the project lifecycle.
Make strategic, data-driven decisions, providing clear, actionable guidance to project managers for streamlined execution of technical milestones.
Design and optimize project engineering workflows and technical strategies to enhance cost-efficiency and ensure timely project delivery.
Offer mentorship and advanced technical coaching to project managers and engineers, focusing on elevating project management and engineering competencies.
Drive efficient resource planning and deployment, ensuring balanced workload distribution and the continuous development of technical team members.
Conduct regular technical progress reviews with clients, stakeholders, and project managers to ensure alignment with engineering goals and strengthen client relationships.
Ensure that all project activities meet stringent regulatory, industry, and authority requirements, maintaining strict adherence to engineering and safety standards.
Lead competency development initiatives for project personnel, implementing specialized training and development programs to meet evolving technical demands.
Oversee the establishment and maintenance of robust Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and systems for enhanced project engineering and process management.

Qualifications & Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, or similar), Project Management, or a related technical field.
Minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in EPC turnkey project development and execution, with a strong emphasis on engineering and technical project management.
Demonstrated technical expertise in renewable energy, energy and utilities, and process plant projects is highly preferred.
Extensive experience in technical leadership, with a proven ability to guide, mentor, and manage high-performing engineering teams.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, with a strategic, technical mindset and the ability to make informed engineering decisions.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a successful track record of fostering strong client and stakeholder relationships through technical clarity and collaboration.

Job Description:
Job Description & Requirements
Job Description & Responsibilities:

The Lead Quality Engineer will:
a) Cultivate a continual improvement culture and “design for quality” mindset within the project team.
b) Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project processes comply with project specifications and Company requirements during the FEED and Execution Phases of the project.
c) Assist the Project Quality Manager in implementing the Project Quality Plan, which is developed by the Standards and Compliance section of the Project Management Office.
d) Assist the Project Quality Manager to ensure that the Project Execution Plan is duly followed by the Project Team.

Key Responsibilities
Quality Focus : Develop and review Quality documents ensuring alignment to Company and Project requirements during FEED and Execution Phases.Assist the Project Quality Manager to implement and maintain the Project Quality Plan and other quality deliverables as per Company requirements.Conduct and participate in project audits according to the audit program, monitoring the resolution of findings and corresponding corrective actions.Review, comment and approve Subcontractor / Supplier documents based on Company and Project requirementsAssist in setup and coordination of Classification Society (CS) and Regulatory Compliance (RC) management framework together with CS and RC coordinators;Involve in Quality Walks during site quality surveillance when required Assist to manage the project lessons learned and initiate improvements and ensure experience transfer.

Job Description:
Responsibilities
● Be responsible for coordinating department compliance, training, and document control for both GMP and non-GMP systems.
● Compliance tasks include: scheduling daily compliance meetings, following up on audit findings, leveraging best practices from other sites on audit procedures, achieving audit documentation, and conducting lessons learned, etc.
● Training coordination includes: tracking team members' training programs, setting up training modules for each SEM group in accordance with SOPs, scheduling regular training classes for the team, archiving training records, and coordinating with the QA training team on any issues.
● Participate in projects to develop training plans according to the operation readiness schedule.
● Manage general contractors and subcontractors regarding turnover package submission.
● Timely coordination with the SEM team and external teams to ensure all related work is completed on time.
● Act as the training coordinator to manage all SEM members' training records.
● Assist in drafting or updating SOPs, URS, or other necessary documents.
● Perform other tasks as assigned by leadership.
Requirements
● Diploma or higher qualification in human resource, public management, Pharmaceutical Engineering, or other related specialties; candidates with equivalent work experience is plus.
● Ability to quickly learn GMP related knowledge and all related calibration requirement and code.
● Possess good communication ability and comprehension ability.
● Display a good working attitude, strong work ethic, and willingness to follow leadership directives.
● Be open to accepting temporary work assignments, including overtime on weekends or weekdays, and other roles as required.
● Able to work independently with limited supervision in a fast-paced environment.
● Possess good multi-tasking and prioritization skills.
Career development
● Through complete systematic training, you will quickly grow to be a compliance/document control engineer and a subject matter expert of related work.
● A performance-oriented promotion system, diverse and comprehensive challenges in a cGMP manufacturing environment, and career advancement incentives will all contribute to your career development.
● Explore your management potential, grow with the team, and light up the growth plan of life.

Job Description:
Nanyang Technological University (NTU) is an internationally renowned tertiary education institution. It boasts a strong engineering college and is ranked among the best globally. Committed to our mission of educating leaders and advancing knowledge for Singapore and beyond, we have built global programs and established strong links with leading institutions around the world.

The School of Civil and Environmental Engineering (CEE), which is under the College of Engineering, aspires to be a leading school for Sustainable Urban Systems. Currently, it has over 50 faculty members and more than 1,500 students, and is rapidly expanding its range of educational and research activities. Its faculty has led major university-wide strategic research thrusts in space creation, water research and sustainable built environment. Moving forward, CEE is addressing critical problems in urban systems such as building structures and energy systems, sustainability of urban cities, and resiliency to natural and unnatural risks.

To fuel further development, we invite applications for an Assistant Professor (Tenure-Track) position in Structural Engineering.

Applicants must have a PhD degree in Civil Engineering or Structural Engineering. Specifically, the applicant must be able to teach mechanics of materials, determinate and indeterminate structural analysis, structural design in either reinforced and precast concrete, and/or steel and composite structures, and tall building structures at both the undergraduate and graduate levels and is expected to enhance the school’s exiting curriculum.

Application Procedures

Applicants are invited to submit their applications (cover letter, detailed CV including publication list, research and teaching statements, citation report, and/or any other documents that demonstrate your qualifications and credentials) through the NTU Workday career portal.

Application remains open until the position is filled. Only short-listed candidates will be notified.

Job Description:
Who we are:
minden.ai is a technology venture founded by Temasek in strategic partnership with DFI Retail Group and coalition partners BreadTalk Group, DBS Bank, PAssion Card, Mandai Wildlife Group, Singtel, FoodPanda, GoJek and Great Eastern. We are on a mission to redefine the engagement between brands and consumers in Southeast Asia.

The way we work:
At Minden, we treat each other with respect. We embrace authenticity and transparency. We pride ourselves on agility and innovation, and believe in embracing continuous learning and self-improvement. We strive to be the preferred employer by providing comprehensive benefits, a dynamic and exciting working environment, work-life balance and effort recognition.
We are seeking for individuals with grit and passion, an insatiable intellectual curiosity and a heart for people to amplify effectiveness as a team.

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will:
Contribute to the design and implementation of a scalable and reliable data platform based on the data mesh principles with modern data stack.
Develop and maintain efficient data pipelines to ingest, transform, and store data from various sources.
Collaborate with engineers across domains to understand their data needs and develop self-service data access tools and APIs.
Contribute to the development and improvement of internal data products
Partner with the data science and analytics teams to ensure their data needs are met.
Follow and contribute to the continuous improvement of data standards and best practices.
What you should have:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
4+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or similar role. Additional experience as backend software engineer is preferred
Proficiency in programming languages like SQL, Python, Java, or Scala, and experience with big data processing frameworks like Apache Spark.
Experience with dimensional modeling, data warehouse and data lake.
Experience with modern data stack (eg. Snowflake, dbt, airflow, etc) is a plus.
Understanding of data mesh principles and concepts is beneficial.
Experience working in an ambiguous, low control yet fast paced startup environment

We strive to be the preferred employer by providing comprehensive benefits, a dynamic and exciting working environment, work-life balance and effort recognition.

We are seeking a self-motivated, solution-oriented and experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our Product & Engineering Team.

In this role, you will:
Contribute to the design, development, testing and deployment of our backend services
Support full software development lifecycle for new and existing features
Collaborate with the product and design team to gather the requirements and provide optimal solutions
Work closely with the product and design team to understand requirements, provide product feedback, architect the systems, and implement the product from start to finish.
Collaborate with the QA and DevOps/SRE teams to make quality an integral part of our CI/CD systems, monitor performance, and ensure smooth operation of our software systems.
Document application requirements, design, test, integration, and other related processes
Ensure software development best practices and best-of-breed technologies are used to deliver high-quality software on time.
Keep up with the latest software technologies and engineering practices
You will be a great match if you have:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience.
At least 3 years of technical hands-on experience with product backend development
Developed and delivered software system for millions of users
Experience with debugging and diagnostic of distributed systems
Experience with performance optimization of various aspects of software systems
Experience working in an ambiguous, low control yet fast paced startup environment is an added advantage

Job Description:
About Vantage Data Centers
Vantage is committed to being a workplace of inclusion, equity, respect, and acceptance. We celebrate diversity and intentionally seek out opportunities to learn from one another’s experience.
Vantage Data Centers powers, cools, protects and connects the technology of the world’s well-known hyperscalers, cloud providers and large enterprises. Developing and operating across five continents, 18 markets, 26 campuses, with 1.5 GW of power, 10M square feet - and growing, Vantage has evolved data center design in innovative ways to deliver dramatic gains in reliability, efficiency and sustainability in flexible environments that can scale as quickly as the market demands. Vantage’s business is growing exponentially through a combination of greenfield market expansion and acquisitions across North America, Europe and APAC.
Site Selection and Acquisitions Department
New Site Development (NSD) evaluates new sites and coordinates pre-construction activities in line with corporate goals working hand in hand with the Construction team to come up with a vertically integrated design and ensures new and existing standards and designs are executed effectively. The team collaborates with Sales, Site Selection and Acquisitions, Design & Engineering, Construction, Operations, Legal, Finance and the regional Executive Leadership Team. One thing that distinguishes Vantage is that our technical staff are given the responsibility and authority to directly drive tangible results. Our team can align long-term operational sustainability with value engineering and cost metrics to deliver products aligned with corporate goals. This approach empowers each member of the team to drive high-impact decisions and results.
Ambitious growth of the core business has resulted in the New Site Development team hiring top talent. Our headcount continues to increase, and this brings with it exciting opportunities. Join our team and your career will accelerate on the back of your exposure to the kind of responsibilities and variety that come with being part of a growing business.
Position Overview
Vantage is looking for a Connectivity (data center fiber telecommunications infrastructure) Director to drive the physical connection of telecommunication providers to both new and existing data center campuses, in line with changing customer demands. Run increasing requirements for campus points of entry (POE), distances to, and associated interconnectivity between, existing telco hubs, self-investment both on and off site/campus. This position will be responsible for all activities required to prove connectivity feasibility of new sites and thereafter manage all activities required to facilitate the execution of connectivity in line with the customers’ exacting demands. In addition, the role entails the creation and implementation of all strategies regarding connectivity across the Vantage portfolio.
Constant communication with Site Selection and Acquisitions, Construction, Design & Engineering, Operations, and Sales teams, subject matter experts, and the wider APAC Executive Leadership Team will be required to keep pace with Vantage’s strategic land acquisition goals, including enhancing Vantage’s product and service offering wherever possible. Collaboration and integration in the sales lifecycle process including client interface is integral to the role as well.
Essential Job Functions
Lead feasibility (developing connectivity strategy) through contract execution and delivery (e.g., lit fiber).
Contribute to the design, schedule and CAPEX estimates during pre-construction phases, and assist with relevant contract negotiations.
Brief and transition ownership of fiber telecommunications infrastructure to VDC Construction Managers at the appropriate time for execution.
Develop and maintain a global connectivity strategy, including productization of connectivity, aligned with the management team's expectations and direction.
Provide thought leadership and team management, ensuring accountability for team results across all connectivity projects, assignments, and initiatives, including budget and schedule management, and coordination with internal and external stakeholders.
Stay current with new technologies, products, and innovative opportunities both within and outside the data center industry to enhance future deliveries.
Duties
Ensure Vantage has sites that meet customer network requirements, including KMZ creation and management in existing and new markets.
Conduct long-haul evaluations and develop schedules with cost certainty for the last mile.
Acquire dark fiber for facilities to ensure all customers can activate services from day one.
Negotiate carrier agreements to reduce costs while ensuring dark fiber availability on-premises from day one.
Support D&E with campus and building designs for internal and external conduit routing, including MMR/POE layout and customer fit-outs
In conjunction with VDC commercial teams and third-party consultants, qualify consultants, vendors, and contractors
Provide technical support as needed, including preparing technical materials for presentations to prospective customers and supporting marketing efforts to outline connectivity strategies.
Skills, Knowledge, and Experience
Minimum of 10 years’ experience in large-scale connectivity delivery.
Solid understanding of data center ecosystems and a network of key providers, with a recognized degree in computer science or equivalent preferred.
Project management experience, with the ability to conduct full feasibility studies.
Knowledge of customer requirements, business drivers, financials, and relevant legislative requirements.
Strong IT skills, with the ability to use multiple communication tools and software packages.
Demonstrated strong negotiation skills.
Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills at all organizational levels and with third parties, such as suppliers.
Flexible, adaptable, and self-directed; able to work in various circumstances, including remotely, while traveling, across multiple time zones, cross-functionally, and by project.
Highly organized with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, work well under pressure, and prioritize work efforts with minimal supervision.
We operate with No Ego and No Arrogance. We work to build each other up and support one another, appreciating each other’s strengths and respecting each other’s weaknesses. We find joy in our work and each other, actively seeking opportunities to inject fun into what we do. Our hard and efficient work is rewarded with an above market total compensation package. We offer a comprehensive suite of health and welfare, retirement, and paid leave benefits exceeding local expectations.
Throughout the year, the advantage of being part of the Vantage team is evident with an array of benefits, recognition, training and development, and the knowledge that your contribution adds value to the company and our community.
Don't meet all the requirements? Please still apply if you think you are the right person for the position. We are always keen to speak to people who connect with our mission and values.
Vantage Data Centers is an Equal Opportunity Employer
Vantage Data Centers does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm agencies. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired; such resumes will be deemed the sole property of Vantage Data Centers.

Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Prepare project planning include but not limited to work scopes, responsible matrix, manhours and softwares, interface matrix.
Prepare Master Document List (MDL) for overall piping design related work scopes with forecast date based-on Master Project Schedule.
Align the piping design input data and need date with the respective stakeholders to define the piping design output forecast date.
Review and monitor project budget related to piping especially for manhour and software utilization, exotic and high-cost material purchase, warehouse balance material utilization, etc.
Lead a group of piping engineers and designers for project execution or/and monitor the work executed by engineering design house where applicable.
Review and monitor engineering design progress related to piping work scopes.
Prepare and raise technical query (TQF) and engineering variation order (EVO) related to piping for additional work scopes.
Align the piping design output (such as piping isometric drawing, pipe spool drawing, etc) with construction team to ensure all the information required by construction teams are incorporated.
Understand department and project specific design workflow.
Understand Contract Specification and project requirement summary.
Understand Class and Regulatory Requirement, Piping, Special Item and Valve Material Specification.
Understand P&ID and piping routine requirements.
Understand equipment layout plan (include escape route, maintenance space, mechanical handling, other equipment).
Understand non-piping design related requirements such as fabrication, erection, painting, QA/QC, testing and commissioning.
Responsible for ensuring that all works meet scope and technical quality of the project and comply with project requirements.
Monitor P&ID revisions and ensure the compliance between piping 3D model with latest P&ID.
Monitor design input need date and data required to execute the piping design works.
Monitor 3D model clash and design review comments / punch lists.
Monitor the comments from Client and Classification Society.
Monitor all the piping related interface points.
Monitor all the hotwork, tank’s coating and drydocking related activities where applicable.
Monitor piping procurement status and surplus material due to drawing revision.
Monitor all the hold items that affecting piping design completeness.
Monitor and control the development of piping weight.
Ensure proper communication and workflow are well established between piping stress team with pipe routine and pipe support designer team. Closely monitor the compliance between piping 3D model with the latest pipe stress analysis report.
Review/comments piping arrangement, isometric and pipe supports drawings from piping designers.
Review/comments on piping calculations carry out by other piping engineers/ subcontractors (e.g. pipe stress analysis report, flow master report, surge analysis report).
Review/comments technical proposal from vendor.
Review/comments vendor certified Document (VCD).
Monitor and control drawing revisions especially when construction already started.
Ensure proper communication and workflow are well established between piping designing team with construction team. Monitor the compliance between piping construction drawing (piping isometric and pipe support drawing) with the latest 3D model.
Monitor the piping design database completeness (such as 3D model attributes, etc) to meet the project Digital Engineering requirements.
Interface with vendor, other discipline lead, procurement, production, commissioning.
Onboard vessel to carry out inspection at site.
Provide support to piping construction, QA/QC and other non-engineering design related activities such as inspection, coating, painting, welding, test packages, etc.
Requirements
Prefer to have at least 8 years of piping engineering related working experience or similar activities as describe above.
Prefer to have experience in Offshore/Shipyard project, Rig building/Ship building.
Prefer to have experience in FPSO project, both topsides & marine.

Job Title: Principal  Master Analog Ic Design Engineer
Job Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Development of Analog/Mixed-Signal circuits from specifications to prototypes.
System-level analysis and evaluation, full-chip architecture design, analysis, modeling, simulation, and integration.
Schematic entry, corner simulation, layout consideration, and post-layout simulation.
Work closely with the layout engineer to conduct the physical implementation (layout) and chip floor planning.
Responsible for post-layout extraction and parasitic analysis.
Able to work with other designers, Chip Architects, and layout engineers to achieve full-chip integration, place and route, top-level verification, and tape out.
Requirements:
Ph.D./Master/Degree in Electrical Engineering or Microelectronics with excellent technical background in Analog /Mixed-Signal IC design
Min. 8 years of experience in CMOS Analog IC design and simulation
Good design experience in Analog IC design involving two or more of the following blocks: low noise pre-amplifier (low offset, high CMRR, high PSRR and bandwidth up to 600MHz), CMOS Gigahertz Oscillator, switched capacitor circuit, LDO, Differential Amplifier, comparator, Opamp, TIA, and Bandgap Reference and high-frequency full-wave rectifier, etc.
Good design knowledge in ESD and Latch-Up.
Experience in isolator devices (capacitive-coupler or optical-coupler) and photodetector-associated circuits will be an added advantage.
Experience with sigma-delta modulators and IO drivers will be an added advantage.
Good working knowledge of relevant analog IC design and simulation tools (Spice or its equivalent)
Basic understanding and can develop simple design-related scripts with some common script languages, such as perl, Tcl, matlab or cadence skill etc.
A team player with good communication skills.
Able to work independently, flexibly, and creatively.

Job Description:
SPECIFIC DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
The Technician/Senior Technician is responsible for carrying out preventive / breakdown maintenance on all M&E services and building works. He will be required to be specializing in areas consist of plumbing, masonry, electrical, mechanical, air-conditioning, carpentry or other areas of maintenance work.
This role reports directly to the Chief Engineer/ Assistant Chief Engineer/ Duty Engineer/ Maintenance Supervisor

Carry out preventive / breakdown maintenance on all plumbing and sanitary systems of the Hotel to ensure that there is no chokage/ blockage in the plumbing and sanitary systems.
Operate and carry out preventive / breakdown maintenance on all mechanical equipment such as air conditioning system, freezer, refrigerators, pumps, coolers, ice-makers and other refrigeration equipment.
To operate and carry out preventive maintenance and repairs of all electrical installations and equipment such as generator, fire protection system (including emergency lighting), internal and external lighting, etc. at the hotel – including preventive maintenance for all 542 guestrooms, cycle based on Department Goals.
Able to carry out M&E installation and repair work
Able to trouble-shooting building defect and request
Construct and repair furniture such as cabinet, cupboard, table, chairs, doors and props.
To place order for materials, fittings and tools according to specifications needed for carpentry. Coordinate with Engineering administrator.
Carry out painting, polishing, varnish furniture and ensure that they are well varnished. To maintain constant checking of plant operation.
To ensure standard of operation, safety and housekeeping are up to standard.
Assist in energy conservation programme and participate in fire-fighting and safety exercise.
To know the procedures of firefighting.
To minimize energy wastage.
To carry out any other duties when directed by the Superior.

Job requirements
Candidate must possess at least Nitec in Electrical, Mechanical or Building Services or equivalent.
Preferably with minimum 1-2 years of experience in Engineering related industries for Technician.
Preferably with minimum 2 years or more of experience in Engineering related industries for Senior Technician.
Possess skills in maintaining, troubleshooting and repairing of building equipment
Good communication skills (verbal and written)
Willingness to learn and work as a team member
Possess high level of integrity and respect for others

Job Description:
Your New Company
Join a leading financial institution renowned for its commitment to excellence and innovation in the banking sector. My client prides itself on fostering a dynamic and inclusive work environment where employees are encouraged to grow and develop their skills. They are dedicated to providing top-notch financial services and solutions to our clients, ensuring their financial well-being and success.

Your New Role
In this leadership role, you will be at the forefront of ensuring our company's internal controls and risk management measures are robust and effective. Your primary responsibility will be to develop a comprehensive, risk-based annual audit plan that focuses on credit-related areas and operational risk. This involves identifying potential risks, evaluating existing controls, and recommending improvements to enhance our risk management framework. You will also be tasked with executing the audit plan, which includes conducting thorough audits, documenting findings, and presenting actionable recommendations to senior management. Your expertise will be crucial in overseeing the resolution of both internal and external audit findings, as well as addressing any issues identified during regulatory inspections. Furthermore, you will provide valuable audit consultation across various risk areas within the bank, particularly in operational risks related to processes, people, and systems.

What you need to succeed
10 or more years of relevant internal audit experience at a prominent financial institution
Good knowledge of banking business and operations
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills for cross-functional and multi-level relationship building
Meticulous with excellent critical thinking skills

What you will get
In return for your dedication and hard work, you will be rewarded with:
A highly competitive base salary paired with a lucrative performance bonus
Multiple opportunities for professional development and career advancement
A highly flexible working environment (at least 2 WFH days)

What you need to do
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new Governance position, please contact Jet Wong at +65 6027 2245 or email Jet.Wong@hays.com.sg for a confidential discussion on your career.

Job Description:
Vacancy in O&G/ Marine offshore industry
Position: Commercial/ CONTRACTS Manager

Our client’s principal activities are to provide Clients with Full Turkey Project Management. This includes engineering, project management through the pre-construction planning, critical path development, construction / fabrication / site management, commissioning and hand over. It has executed a wide range of major projects involving Marine FPSO Conversion/Process Module Construction related to Oil and Gas Industry, Sub-Sea Products, Semi-Submersibles, Repair of Oil Rigs, Pharmaceutical Process Packages and Power Generation Facilities since its foundation in 1990. This vast experience and Total Commitment to Customer Satisfaction has since earned it a strong reputation in the industry as a reliable local business partner that aspire to exceed our clients’ expectations.

It is looking for a Commercial/ Contracts Manager.

Job Highlights

Listed Company with Good Benefits
Good Stable Career Advancement Opportunities
Conductive and Friendly Working Environment
Career Growth Opportunity |Trainings for Career Growth

Job Description

Responsibilities

· Planning, scheduling and monitoring of QS’s work for respective projects to ensure that works are completed on time for submissions to Client parallel to Project Schedule both in re-measurements and change proposals.
· Provide quotations to Client’s for any new additional works arises out of the original scope of works (if any).
· Checking and approving the change proposal for submission to Clients.
· Prepare forecast of overall projects costs inclusive of revised MTO’s and change proposals of each project. (Will provide to Client periodically.)
· Meeting up with Clients to reconcile and close up on the re-measurements and change proposals submitted.
· Compilation and close-up of final account for each project completed with the respective client.
· Prepare and monitor of invoices and payments from Client for each project.
· Provide contractual advice to the PM or Project Team for any commercial issues.

Responsibilities

· Diploma/Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Quantity Surveyor or any Technical Discipline
· At least 10 years of experience in Marine shipyard for large constructions projects
· Experienced in the quantification and valuation of works for claims is essential, together with sound knowledge of commercial processes such as contracts, subcontracting, tendering and procurement
· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
· Good written and verbal communication skills
· Proficient in Microsoft Excel is a must.
· Sound knowledge and skill in contracts review, preparation and management
· Possess good initiatives to ensure that tender submission deadlines are met.
· Organised, positive attitude and detail oriented.
· Team Player, resourceful with sense of responsibility.

Job Related Information

Permanent – 5.5 days’ work week | Monday-Friday 8am-5pm, Saturday 8am-12pm
Head-Office Location: Office Location: Gul Circle, Singapore.

Salary & Benefits
Monthly Basic Salary: Based on expertise, academic qualification and skills

Healthcare benefits such as Outpatient, Dental, Health Screening etc.
Cover with insurances, Personal Accident, Hospital & Surgical, Term Life and Work Injury policy

14 days Annual Leave and 14 days sick leave

Job Description:
Our client’s principal activities are to provide Clients with Full Turkey Project Management. This includes engineering, project management through the pre-construction planning, critical path development, construction / fabrication / site management, commissioning and hand over. It has executed a wide range of major projects involving Marine FPSO Conversion/Process Module Construction related to Oil and Gas Industry, Sub-Sea Products, Semi-Submersibles, Repair of Oil Rigs, Pharmaceutical Process Packages and Power Generation Facilities since its foundation in 1990. This vast experience and Total Commitment to Customer Satisfaction has since earned it a strong reputation in the industry as a reliable local business partner that aspire to exceed our clients’ expectations.

It is looking for a Senior/ Estimation Manager.

Job Highlights

-Listed Company with Good Benefits
-Good Stable Career Advancement Opportunities
-Conductive and Friendly Working Environment
-Career Growth Opportunity |Trainings for Career Growth

Job Description

Responsibilities

· Responsible for leading and directing estimating resources and proposing costing strategies through the review and analysis of completed projects as well as global and regional cost data to affect such strategies towards the realization of client’s business objectives.
· Responsible for ensuring that the Estimation & Analysis (E&A) Team personnel are in possession of correct skills, are given appropriate training, are up-to-date on the latest methods, procedures and requirements, and are sufficiently resourced to accomplish their tasks effectively
· Responsible for the effective review of tender specifications by E&A team and to ensure full understanding of project preambles and methods of measurement for purpose of generating accurate costing for tenders in line with project requirements.
· Responsible for leading the post-mortem analysis of costs based on data collected from completed projects and to conduct lessons learned on tenders which were not successful.
· Lead E&A team in vendor and customer techno-commercial clarifications and negotiations together with Procurement/Subcontracting teams and Marketing team, respectively.
· To develop, establish and implement effective business processes within the E&A team to ensure an acceptable degree of accuracy and credibility in the estimation of costs, for the company to remain competitive in pricing decisions by senior management.
· Refine and reconfigure estimating and analysis business processes that will ensure applicability at the project level.
· Ensure the setting up of a robust bid analysis system to evaluate cost estimates metrics by trades, categories, cost codes etc.
· Responsible for leading the implementation of cost estimating strategies for projects, including direct labor, materials, permanent equipment, construction equipment, project conceptual layout, outsourcing, etc.
· Responsible for ensuring the preparation and submission of accurate cost estimations, cost summaries and bid analysis by E&A team, and concise presentation in a timely fashion for submission to senior management.
· Responsible for the triangulation of cost estimates, actual past project costs, and proposed basis for costing strategy, for discussion and review with senior management.
· Responsible for the setup and preservation of database system for project cost estimates versus actual project costs by working with Marketing, Project Management, Production, Procurement, Sub-Contracting, Quantity Surveying, and Finance functions within the Company.
· Responsible for the review of project plans and specifications and ensure effective coordination between the E&A team and other departments to confirm complete scope.
· Responsible for identifying and evaluating all cost-related technical issues in projects.
· Responsible for ensuring the comprehensive review and completion of the bid forms and to ensure that they are within the given specifications.
· Responsible for ensuring the close monitoring of tender results and to ensure proper updating in the tender register.
· Responsible for conducting tender costing review with senior management and tender committee for approval.
· Responsible for the preparation and issuance of project budget for commercial handover to Project Managers and Production upon project award.

Job Requirements

· Bachelor’s Degree in any Technical discipline
· Minimum 10 years of commercial experience with roles in cost estimation and/or quantity surveying, preferably in the Singapore marine and offshore industry.
· Experience in the fabrication of Oil & Gas process modules, structures and skids preferred.
· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
· Good written and verbal communication skills
· Proficient in Microsoft Excel is a must.
· Sound knowledge and skill in cost estimation.
· Possess good initiatives to ensure that tender submission deadlines are met.
· Organised, positive attitude and detail oriented.
· Team Player, resourceful with sense of responsibility.

Job Related Information

Permanent – 5.5 days’ work week | Monday-Friday 8am-5pm, Saturday 8am-12pm
Head-Office Location: Office Location: Gul Circle, Singapore
Salary & Benefits
Monthly Basic Salary: Based on expertise, academic qualification and skills
OT pay entitlement: OT Flat rate S$8/- per hour
Healthcare benefits such as Outpatient, Dental, Health Screening etc.
Cover with insurances, Personal Accident, Hospital & Surgical, Term Life and Work Injury policy
Variable Bonuses
14 days Annual Leave and 14 days sick leave
Birthday leave / Festival eve half day leave
NTUC membership – Applicable for only Permanent confirmed staff
Company transport @ designated places

Job Description:
This role offers the opportunity to work closely with trading desks, international and onshore clients, custodian banks, external brokers and exchanges. You will be responsible for managing pre-matching and settlement of client trading and driving efficiencies and process enhancements in day-to-day operations.
Opportunity to work in a global financial services group operating in 34 markets
Key role supporting equities trading in Asian markets including China, Hong Kong, Japan and Singapore
Broad exposure to post trade operations for equities in a collaborative and fast paced environment

What you'll do:
As an Equities Operations Specialist, you will play a pivotal role within the team based in Singapore. Your primary responsibility will be supporting equities trading in Asian markets including China, Hong Kong, Japan and Singapore. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders such as trading desks, international and onshore clients, custodian banks, external brokers and exchanges. Your expertise will be crucial in managing pre-matching and settlement of client trading. Furthermore, you will be instrumental in driving efficiencies and process enhancements in daily operations while also supporting change initiatives as a subject matter expert.
Handling post-trade life cycle controls for equities trading in global markets
Managing trade allocation, booking, settlement, funding, reconciliation and client management
Working closely with the trading desks, international and onshore clients, custodian banks, external brokers and exchange
Managing pre-matching and settlement of client trading
Driving efficiencies and process enhancements in day-to-day operations
Supporting change initiatives as a subject matter expert

What you bring:
The ideal candidate for the Equities Operations Specialist role brings a wealth of experience from the financial sector. With at least 5 years' experience handling post-trade equities operations ideally in a settlement's capacity, you have developed a strong understanding of control and risk frameworks within banking operations. Experience working with Asian markets, particularly China, Hong Kong and China Connect would be highly beneficial. Your ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining attention to detail will set you apart.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in handling post trade equities operations ideally in a settlement’s capacity
Strong understanding of control and risk frameworks within banking operations
Experience in Asian markets, especially China, Hong Kong and China Connect is advantageous

What sets this company apart:
Our client is renowned for bringing together diverse people and empowering them to shape all kinds of possibilities. They are committed to accelerating digitalisation, sustainability and social impact for the benefit of their people, customers, shareholders and communities.

Do note that we will only be in touch if your application is shortlisted.

Job Description:
Facilities Executive – Soft Services
Work Dynamics -Integrated Facilities Management (Singapore, APAC)
Account Site: Bukom
Facilities Executive duties and responsibilities include working closely with both the hard services and soft services manager, assisting Soft Services Manager to oversee cleaning, landscape, pest control, waste disposal, locker & laundry management, events management, meeting arrangement, support and manage residential blocks. You will oversee the facility’s day-to-day operations and ensure that all administrative functions, soft services issues and facility services are covered. You will strive for continuous improvement in the process. You will also keep an eye out on the facility’s supplies and ensure that it has adequate stocks and materials to keep the operations smooth. In addition, you will help mitigate risks by taking part in emergency evacuation procedures, and handling crisis management and business continuity plans. You will also be on top of health and safety issues that may arise, and actively participate in reviewing them. Also part of your mandate is to monitor the facilities infrastructure, vendor’s performance and processes comply with standards. Report to the Soft Services Manager.
Responsibilities:
Oversee in-house maintenance team for all daily maintenance issues and conduct daily inspection to ensure quality standards are being maintained.
Monitor submission of service partners’ daily inspection and periodic service reports.
Support and responsible for coordinating and improve efficiency of storage, transportation, space planning, event planning and meeting room arrangement.
Oversee the planning and executing of the waste, pest control, cleaning, landscaping, car wash scheduling and locker allocations.
Review soft service partners’ deployment and duties to optimal use of manpower.
Regular inspection for conformance to service standards and expectation of Soft services scopes.
Write and prepare communication, SOPs, and workflow processes.
Investigates feedback regarding housekeeping service, events and equipment and takes corrective action.
Coordinate and support events from set up requirements to logistical support including AV set-up, liaise with onsite support team on layout etc.
Assist in sponsorship and gate pass for third party vendors and visitors.
Support the Site lead in contract drafting and renewal process.
Verify and track timely submission and payment of vendor invoice.
Conduct and coordinate regular Vendor performance management scoring for the team. Maintain and develop good relationship with vendors and building management.
Support the team in sourcing and ordering ad-hoc purchases.
Planning of collection of goods arrival at warehouse.
Assist in the development and management of the facilities budget, monitoring expenses and optimizing costs.
Design and create power point presentation, posters and signages.
Standby for activation provide coordination after office hours or involve in turn around activities when required.
Any other related activities and tasks as assigned.
Requirements:
Able to handle large numbers of outsourced workers.
Customer-oriented, relationship building.
Passionate about delivering consistent excellence.
Proactive thinking.
Competent writing and communication skills, time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work.
Able to work under pressure and meet tight deadline.
A positive attitude and a good team-player with good interpersonal and supervisory skills.
Degree or Diploma in Integrated Facilities Management/Marketing/Mass Communications/ Business studies or equivalent.
May required to work overtime or weekend occasionally if required

Job Description:
Our Company is working closely with a Prestigious Public Listed organisation in Singapore. Due to our dynamic expansion in projects, we’re looking for an analytical and process-oriented Cyber Security Engineers in a junior operational role, to administrate user access and perform security risk assessments and testing to identify and fix gaps.

Job Description:
Maintenance and operations of Security Solutions
Provide operational security administration including creating and implementing user-defined rules according to requirements;
Make recommendations and oversee the implementation for Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) solutions;
Follow-up on Regulator’s Cybersecurity advisory
Ensure compliance to security standards and recommend security implementations
Conduct testing of security controls to identify and close gaps.
Deploy and perform vulnerability assessment to IT assets and projects
Participate in Internal audit
Support in Vulnerability assessment and tracking
Any other Security related task as assigned
Work closely with managed security provider, vendors, information system owners or representatives and infrastructure technical staffs on security incidents to perform incident handling and provide remedial actions.

Respond and remediate in a timely manner in relation to any service outages, with customer satisfaction as priority.
Troubleshoot and remediate issue when necessary.

Diploma / Bachelor Degree in Information Security/Cyber Security or IT-related discipline /Computer Science or equivalent
At least 3-5 years of relevant experience; (For the Senior guy)
Have a strong understanding of IT infrastructure and security operations
Professional security certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or other equivalent are preferred
IT Security Management experience of various aspect, e.g. network security, server security, application security, end point security, email security, physical access security, logical access security, etc will be an advantage

Possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Job Description:
Our client is a fast growing pharmaceutical company

Responsibilities
Develop E&I specifications based on project requirements and standards.
Involve or conduct feasibility studies, instrument criticality and risk assessments for instrumentation and electrical systems
Develop and maintains various engineering documents such as project instrumentation specifications & instrument catalogue, preferred vendors list, specifications, equipment list, layouts, etc.
Evaluates and specifies instruments and electric devices designed for process & utility applications
Creates and maintains instrument objects and datasheets and loop diagrams in project database
Collaborate with other engineering disciplines to ensure integrated designs. Review and approve design documents, drawings, and calculations.
Responsible of procurement by developing URS for purchase and leading/support bidding process including inspection of equipment and materials
Working together with the Qualification team & user QA team for preparation and maintaining of the documents for the Commissioning & Qualification of the instrumentation. Ensure compliance with design specifications, codes, and standards during installation
Supports and arrange calibration activities on site prior to commissioning, qualification or handover to operational
Manage contractors and subcontractors involved in installation activities.
Review, support or develop commissioning plans, qualification protocols and procedures for electrical and instrumentation systems.
Perform or oversee the functional testing of electrical equipment, control systems, and instrumentation devices.
Troubleshoot and resolve commissioning issues and discrepancies.
Support or execute qualification tests and inspections according to approved protocols. Document qualification results and deviations, and ensure compliance with validation requirements.
Responsible to research and select appropriate master calibrators for various instruments used in the workshop. These calibrators serve as reference standards to ensure the accuracy of measuring instruments.
Responsible to set up calibration workshop, procure and maintain standard calibration equipment such as multimeters, temperature and pressure calibrator, signal generator, Mass and Weight Calibrators, etc., needed to perform calibrations accurately as per procedures.
Collaborate with all stakeholders to ensure smooth transition and startup of electrical and instrumentation systems.
Provide training and support to team members and maintenance personnel on system functionalities and procedures and compliance with relevant standards.
Create and maintain a plan/list of all instruments requiring calibration in the workshop and field. This plan/list should include information such as instrument type, serial number, calibration due dates, and historical calibration data within the Maximo system.
Establish a calibration schedule based on instrument types, usage frequency, manufacturer recommendations, and regulatory requirements to ensure timely calibrations and compliance.

Job Description:
Element has an opportunity for Laboratory Engineer (Geotechnical Laboratory) for Singapore

The Geotechnical Laboratory Engineer plays a vital role within the organisation, upholding the scientific rigor and analytical precision that underpin the integrity of our engineering solutions. Their expertise in assessing the mechanical properties of soil is essential, providing a solid foundation for informed engineering decisions and the design of durable structures. By carefully performing and interpreting geotechnical tests, the Laboratory Engineer contributes to key design choices, reduces risk, and ensures the long-term success and sustainability of projects. Their thorough work and insights are critical to maintaining the company’s dedication to safety, environmental responsibility, and innovative engineering practices.

This will be a site based position in Singapore

Core Responsibilities
Supervising lab testing team on daily testing works.
Ensuring testing is performed in accordance with the approved codes / standards and SAC-SINGLAS requirements.
Ensuring quality, accuracy and timely output of work including data processing and report preparation.
Maintaining equipment, test records and reports, etc.
·Performing other duties relevant to the laboratory testing works as required, including preparing and testing soil, rock and concrete samples, etc., when assignment is received.
Performing other duties relevant to the laboratory testing works as required, including preparing and testing soil, rock and concrete samples, etc., when assignment is received
Requirements
Diploma / Degree in Civil Engineering, Geology or equivalent
Minimum two years experience
Good working attitude and basic computer knowledge
Ability to multi-task and to work under pressure
Good team player with ability to handle task independently
Good Interpersonal and communication skill
Ability to work overtime as and when required
Good knowledge of soil and rock classifications
Familiar with 5S and safety knowledge
Capable in the testing, data processing and result reporting for Triaxial Tests, Oedometer Test, Direct Shear Test, Permeability Test, Physical Properties Tests and Rock/Concrete Compression Tests, etc.
Completion of ISO/IEC 17025 2017 training course will be an added advantage.

Job Description:
We are seeking an exceptionally skilled and detail-oriented NDT
Systems Engineer to join our team. This role demands extensive
expertise in advanced NDT methods, system design, programmin
and hands-on testing. The ideal candidate will have a proven trac
record in operating and programming advanced NDT equipment,
including PAUT, ToFD, DRT, ECT, and ACFM, and will possess
advanced skills in software and mechanical design.
1. Advanced NDT Equipment Handling:
Phased Array Ultrasonic Testing (PAUT): Operate PAU
systems, including setting up and calibrating equipment
configuring probe arrays, and conducting complex
inspections on various materials.
Direct Radiography Testing (DRT): Execute DRT
procedures, including optimizing exposure parameters,
interpreting radiographic images, and ensuring complia
with safety and quality standards.
Eddy Current Testing (ECT): Perform ECT for detecting
surface and near-surface flaws, including setting up test
parameters and analyzing signals.
Alternating Current Field Measurement (ACFM): Utili
ACFM to detect and size surface-breaking defects, includ
setting up equipment and interpreting measurement da
2. System Design and Programming:
Automatic Immersion Systems: Design, program, and
implement automated immersion systems for ultrasoni
testing. This includes developing custom software soluti
and integrating with hardware components.
Software Simulation: Use CIVA software to simulate an
model NDT scenarios, optimizing test setups and predic
inspection outcomes.
Equipment Programming: Develop and troubleshoot
custom programming for ultrasonic testing equipment,
including creating scripts for specific test procedures an
automating test sequences.
3.Technical Skills:
CIVA Software:

Job Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Avocado Guild is recognized as one of the earliest web3 gaming guilds working closely with blockchain games. The company was first established in 2021 and grew to become the largest web3 gaming guild, providing benefits for communities in SEA via gaming opportunities. Over time we’ve evolved to become a leading web3 gaming incubator, dedicated to building out the sector via strategic investments, game design, community building, and infrastructure development.

Our goal is to empower and educate the public about blockchain technology and opportunities through web3 Gaming. We are venture capital-backed by leading investors such as Animoca Brands, Solana Ventures, and Polygon Ventures just to name a few. The company is well-equipped to navigate and evolve within the sector of Blockchain technology with a focus on gaming.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES:
Strategic Development: Collaborate with the COO and Head of Engineering to craft and execute sprint plans that drive our business objectives forward.
Documentation and Specification: Take charge of documenting product scopes in Jira, using multimedia tools such as videos and wireframes, alongside comprehensive summaries to ensure clarity of product features for the development team.
Quality Assurance: Oversee the creation of detailed test cases for each user story to facilitate effective QA processes.
Sprint Management: Work closely with the development team to maintain sprint schedules, addressing any roadblocks promptly.
Data-Driven Design: Employ data analytics to strategically design and refine product features, significantly enhancing user engagement and satisfaction.
Continuous Improvement: Spearhead enhancements in our product design, delivery, and QA processes.
Ownership: Manage the complete product delivery cycle, from design through testing to launch, ensuring excellence at every stage.
Market Analysis: Conduct comprehensive market research and competitive analysis to inform product strategy and positioning.
Customer Interaction: Engage directly with customers through interviews and feedback sessions to derive insights that shape product features and strategies.
Roadmap Development: Develop and maintain a clear product roadmap, aligning product milestones with strategic business goals.
Strategic Impact: Contribute to the broader strategic planning of the company, shaping how product initiatives support business growth.
CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS:
Strategic Experience: Minimum of 5 years in product management, with a proven track record of strategic planning and lifecycle management in the tech or gaming industries.
Agile and QA Proficiency: Expertise in managing agile development sprints and using project management tools such as Jira. Experience in overseeing quality assurance processes and ensuring alignment with product specifications.
Advanced Analytical and Market Research Skills: Demonstrated capability in data analysis and feature optimization through A/B testing. Strong skills in conducting market analysis and competitive research to inform product strategy.
Customer Engagement Expertise: Extensive experience in directly interacting with customers, conducting user research, and integrating feedback to enhance product development.
Technical and Blockchain Proficiency: Proficiency in using advanced product management tools such as Confluence, and ClickUp. Knowledge of blockchain technology, particularly as it applies to gaming, is highly advantageous.
Leadership and Cross-functional Coordination: Highly disciplined and self-driven with proven leadership skills, capable of managing and coordinating cross-functional teams. Experience in developing and maintaining product roadmaps that align with business objectives.
Organizational and Communication Skills: Exceptional organizational and documentation skills, combined with the ability to communicate effectively across teams and with senior management. Demonstrated ability to articulate product visions, decisions, and strategic priorities clearly and persuasively.

Job Description:
Did you know KONE moves over one billion people every day. We employ over 60,000 driven professionals in over 60 countries worldwide joined together by a shared vision. As a global leader in the elevator and escalator industry, it is our mission to improve the flow of urban life.

What will you be doing?

Project Management Generic

Site supervision process:
• Accountable for the delivery of the installation project
• Accountable for Site Safety
• Responsible for securing efficient management of environmental aspects of the installation (waste handling, hazardous material, minization of travel)
• Accountable for the financial result of the project (cannot be responsible for costs associated with changes in factory prices or exchange rate variables)
• Participates to the sales/installation hand-over and validates the term of the order received from the customer together with the salesperson
• Prepares the overall installation program and resource planning
• Responsible for planning and organizing the delivery and storage of materials and tools to the site and placing the orders to subcontractors and Non KONE factory material suppliers
• Responsible for site preparations and follow-up of site readiness
• Accountable for use of correct KONE installation methods throughout the installation
• Ensures cost control as per action plans during budget, and pre-calculated CM2% towards achieving the R80 targets
• Responsible for administrative activities of the project including daily human resource management (absences, time sheet review/approvals) and reports project progress (schedule, installation hours, fitter time sheets, budget and risks) to his superiors
• Responsible for maintaining project documentation
• Updates information to company management systems (eg S-plan milestone updates)
• Collaborates with Accounts payable / Controlling to ensure site activities are planned and executed in accordance with contractual payment terms and actual payments received.
• Accountable for final testing of the equipment and handover to maintenance

Customer and Sub-contractor Relationship management:
• Accountable for customer satisfaction and quality of installation
• Accountable for Sub-contractor quality and Safety performance
• Single point of contact towards the customer during installation regarding site management, responsible for internal and external communication during the project
• Aims at achieving allocated sales targets and add-on sales and variations during installations
• Develops and maintains a cordial and professional relationship with the sub-contractors

At KONE, we are focused on creating an innovative and collaborative working culture where we value the contribution of each individual. Employee engagement is a key focus area for us and we encourage participation and the sharing of information and ideas. Sustainability is an integral part of our culture and the daily practice. We follow ethical business practices and we seek to develop a culture of working together where co-workers trust and respect each other and good performance is recognized. In being a great place to work, we are proud to offer a range of experiences and opportunities that will help you to achieve your career and personal goals and enable you to live a healthy and balanced life.
Read more on www.kone.com/careers

Job Description:
Introduction
Nova Prospect is a systematic prop trading firm, founded by industry experts who previously built some of the most successful businesses in quant finance and blockchain. This is a rare opportunity to join a growing A-team with incredible talent density, meritocratic culture, no politics and razor-sharp focus on outcome.
The ideal candidate is demonstrably among the best in their field, highly ambitious and a proven problem-solver with excellent judgement. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to learn from the best, grow their role significantly over time and build a highly rewarding, long-term career in systematic trading.
Responsibilities
Build out a next generation research platform that is leveraged by our quant researchers for alpha and strategy research
Develop scalable, distributed and highly performant systems for production trading and portfolio management including automated production, deployment and real-time monitoring pipelines
Collaborate closely with a team of exceptional software engineers and quantitative researchers
Play a crucial role across our entire systematic trading pipeline, learn from your peers and industry experts, and help others on the team succeed
Become a core contributor to our trading strategy and research platform
Qualifications
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline
Prior internships or full-time work experience that demonstrate your ability to architect and implement complex software systems to solve real-world problems
Exceptional software design and development skills in Java or Python
Expertise in object-oriented design and functional programming
Solid understanding of systems programming or demonstrable experience in distributed systems design and/or implementation
Experience with workflow systems and highly scalable environments such as Kubernetes is a plus
Basic knowledge of machine learning methods or statistical modelling techniques. Advanced knowledge is a plus
Familiarity with cloud environments and Linux
Versatile problem-solving skills, and a drive to succeed. Desire to learn continuously and increase your impact
Ability to work closely with other software engineers in a highly collaborative environment
Knowledge of financial markets or quantitative trading is a plus but not required – we will invest in the right candidate

Job Description:
Min. 10 years of end-to-end IT infrastructure management experience, preferrably within financial Services industry and knowledge of Singapore’s regulatory requirements.
Experience in monitoring, production support, infrastructure and system security, Familiar with IT audit and risk management functions.
In depth knowledge of cloud services, in particular AWS and Azure Clouds.

Job Summary:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced VP/SVP, Technology Operations to lead our IT infrastructure and Development team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing the IT infrastructure, production monitoring and support, production releases and optimization of our technology infrastructure, ensuring the highest levels of availability, performance, and security.

You will be working closely with our Chief Operating Officer in accordance to the requirements of business needs, technology platforms, information security, regulatory, and compliance.

Together with the team, you will be working with internal and external stakeholders on Infrastructure Platforms, Identity & Access Management team, including assignments that may consist of parts of a single technical area, application, software, or technical methodology within the infrastructure engineering discipline.

Key Responsibilities:
- Infrastructure Management:
Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of the company’s technology infrastructure, including servers, networks, storage systems, HSM and cloud services.
Ensure the infrastructure is scalable, reliable, and secure to meet current and future business needs by conducting capacity planning in cooperation with the business lines and development teams.
Manage external vendors, including monitoring of the SLA.
Maintain a tight control on costs.
Oversee day-to-day IT operations, ensuring efficient and effective service delivery.
Monitor production and provide support to ensure timely resolution of incidents and problems, liaising with the relevant IT software support and development teams to resolve incidents. Handle the crisis management process if needed.
Develop and enforce policies and procedures for incident management, problem management, and change management.
Monitor system performance and implement proactive measures to prevent issues.
Be the main person in charge for IT audits and regulatory inspections.
- Risk & Control Management:
Assess the effectiveness of controls, determine the impact of control issues, identify corrective action, and track issues to closure.
Perform risk assessments, regulatory and compliance assessments for services and processes.
Partnering with internal and external parties to manage technology and infra related risks and compliance to regulatory requirements.
- Compliance & Security:
Ensure compliance with industry standards, regulatory requirements, and internal policies.
Implement and maintain robust security measures to protect the company’s data and systems.
- Foster a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.
- Manage of team of IT professionals in Singapore.

Qualifications:
Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Minimum of 10 years of experience in IT infrastructure management.
Experience in monitoring, production support and troubleshooting issues.
In depth knowledge of cloud services, in particular AWS and Azure Clouds.
Familiar with information security, audit and risk management functions.
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.

Job Title: Assistant Director Informatics  Eastern General Hospital Planning Office
Job Description:
The upcoming Eastern General Hospital (EGH) aims to provide excellent healthcare and promote healing centred around each person. When operational, EGH will provide a comprehensive range of inpatient and outpatient clinical specialties and healthcare services, covering emergency, acute and secondary care. EGH’s vision is to be a hospital for the community and a great workplace for staff. It seeks to do so by harnessing innovative technologies in patient care, journeying closely with patients and the community to lead healthier and more fulfilling lives, and being an employer of choice that empowers staff in their careers.
In this role, you will plan intelligent / autonomous systems to support the clinical and operational needs of EGH, aiming to achieve the mission and vision of the new institution in transforming healthcare service delivery. Your responsibilities will include overseeing the smooth operations of the Healthcare Living Lab (HLL) with the Development Secretariat, which is set up to conduct integration testing and trial new technologies. You will engage multi-disciplinary teams to ensure the successful and smooth implementation of these new technologies at EGH. Additionally, you will undertake and lead a team in research and development for the operation of intelligent systems for healthcare.
Job requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical / Mechanical / Computing Engineering
At least 12 years of relevant experience with exposure at management level, and at least 5 years in software programming/ engineering/integration work
Team player with excellent planning, analytical and communication skills
Possess critical thinking skills and willingness to think outside the box
Able to engage various stakeholders in a fluid environment and a growing organisation
Ability to work under pressure and adapt to challenging conditions
Good knowledge of both front-end and back-end designs of products/-systems
Familiarity with quick prototyping tools e.g. Unity, Wire framing, Solidworks
Familiarity with management of engineering collaboration platforms e.g SLACK/GitHub
Knowledge in areas such as
Robotic Platforms
Familiarity with software development on/with robotic platforms, SLAM, or related fields.
Experience in the following is preferred:
Robot Operating System(ROS), Gazebo, Unity, Linux, OpenCV
Robotics perception, LIDAR, object tracking, motion planning, machine learning, sensor fusion and system engineerin
Embedded and real-time systems
Algorithm development in C/C++, Python. Unix shell scripting

Job Description:
This job role is for an experienced Senior Technical Project Manager with expertise in ICT delivery architecture, cloud operations, and ITIL-based service operations.

The candidate will have hands-on experience managing technical projects, working with Solutions Presales, and overseeing the transition of new telecommunications products and services into Day1 and Day2 operations.

The candidate should possess a deep understanding of both on-premises and cloud-based ICT environments, particularly Azure operations, and be familiar with Digital Platforms for Automation, Monitoring tools, and ServiceNow.

Make an Impact by:
1. ICT Delivery Operations
Support the end-to-end delivery of ICT outsourcing projects, focusing on server, storage, and network operations within both on-prem and cloud environments.
Participate in ICT cloud outsourcing efforts, particularly in Azure operations, ensuring seamless service delivery and optimization.
Collaborate with Solutions Presales teams to define delivery scope, assess costs, plan resource utilization, and evaluate potential risks in technical projects.
Apply ITIL framework principles to manage Delivery Service lifecycles, ensuring adherence to best practices for service delivery and operations.
Lead the implementation of technical projects, including timelines, resource allocation, and risk mitigation.
Implement automation and monitoring tools to improve operational efficiencies and service reliability.
Participate in ServiceNow operations to implement incident management, service requests, change management, problem management, and maintaining the configuration management database (CMDB).
2. Delivery Service Operations
Collaborate with Product and Product Engineering teams to transition new telecommunications products and services into Day1 (go-live) and Day2 (ongoing) operational environments.
Oversee and manage the transition scope of work, ensuring that all deliverables meet operational readiness criteria.
Ensure the successful integration and support of networking products, including Fortinet, Cisco SD-WAN, Cisco Route and Switch, and VMware VeloCloud.
Work closely with Product, Product Engineering, Day1, Day2 operations teams to ensure a smooth handover of services and monitor the performance and stability of the new products post-transition.
Skills for Success:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years of experience in ICT outsourcing, cloud technologies, and networking, with a hands-on approach to project delivery.
Certifications: Azure Cloud Certified (required) ITIL Practitioner (preferred).
Strong experience with cloud platforms, particularly Azure, in a delivery and operations capacity.
In-depth understanding of networking technologies, including Fortinet, Cisco SD-WAN, Cisco Route and Switch, and VeloCloud.
Demonstrated experience leading technical projects, including managing scope, costs, resources, and risks.
Proficient with automation and monitoring tools for ICT infrastructure management.
Experience with ServiceNow for IT service management, specifically in incident, service request, change, and problem management, as well as CMDB.
Strong leadership and project management skills with the ability to manage cross-functional teams and work under pressure.
Proven ability to deliver technical solutions aligned with business goals while managing costs and risks.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving capabilities, with a focus on improving service delivery and operational efficiency.
Adaptability to evolving technologies and business needs within the telecommunications sector.
