Job Description:
The role involves supporting the Singtel SD-WAN platform by overseeing maintenance and operations to ensure optimal performance. Responsibilities include representing or leading Platform Operations in resolving technical issues, particularly during escalated incidents.

The candidate will execute configuration changes based on reviewed work orders and change requests, ensuring thorough testing prior to implementation.

The role requires governing the SD-WAN platforms against security vulnerabilities and managing incidents and remediation efforts. Regular reporting on platform performance, security posture, and changes is essential, with reports generated daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annually. The candidate will also participate in the design, review, and implementation of new platform products and services as needed.

Handle regular preventive maintenance on the SD-WAN Platform Operations.
Support the expansion, upgrades and rollouts of new network and systems infrastructure involving hardware such as routers, switches, firewalls, virtual appliances, VNFs, network monitoring and management systems.
Support engineering teams on new product/ feature implementation, node deployment, and technical support matters.
Responsible for troubleshooting and timely resolution of faults/issues within the SD-WAN platforms services.
Analyse SD-WAN platforms performance and take proactive actions and preventive measures to monitor and enhance the network performance including software and hardware upgrades, etc.
Prepare statistical reports on network and equipment performance.
Analysing financial information (e.g. revenues, expenditures and cash management) to ensure all operations are within budget.
Presenting annual budgets to management.
Vendor negotiation and preparation of cost analysis and justifications.
Perform SD-WAN platforms performance analysis.
Proactively engages Engineering teams and recommend courses of actions to prevent incidents that may be caused by performance issues.
Archive prepared reports for future reference of job performance.
Review financial documents in preparation for the next cycle.
Negotiation with vendors has led to expenditures within budget and maximized value.
Audits and reviews of the SD-WAN Platforms in parts or as a whole to keep in terms of the environment landscape.

Skills for Success:
Diploma in Electrical / Electronic / Computer Engineering / Computer Science / Information Systems from a recognized institution.
Minimum 5 years of Network Experience
Possess expertise with routers and switches installation e.g. Cisco, Juniper, Mellanox, Dell SONiC.
Hands on experience with Cisco SD-WAN, VMware VeloCloud SD-WAN, HPE Aruba SilverPeak SD-WAN, Fortinet SD-WAN, FortiSASE etc.
Good understanding of Internet routing protocols and technologies including TCP/IP, BGP, MPLS/VPN.
Knowledge of routers/switches architecture and software upgrade procedure. Good analytical and trouble-shooting skills in the area of technical fault isolation and rectification
Knowledge of hypervisors such as eSXI, Adva, proxmox and KVM.

Job Title: Junior Electrical And Mechanical Service Engineer In Singapore
Job Description:
Are you a hands-on person who is able to make mechanics and electronics work on a higher level and do you have an ambition to travel the world as a service engineer, then you are the person we are looking for.

The company
With innovative design and solutions in the absolute high-end scale of the market, we are dealing within the business of cylinder lubrication systems for 2-stroke engines worldwide. With the foundation of Hans Jensen Lubricators in 1917, we take advantage of our 104 years of experience in order to keep our position in the lead, and to assure our clients always meet the highest quality and service. We currently employ 85 colleagues, our culture is characterized by openness and dialogue combined with an exciting and dynamic environment, where we all bring the customer into focus.

Our customers include ship owning companies, technical management companies and engine makers. Our usual point of contact is technical directors, technical managers, Superintendents and Chief Procurement Officers.

The job
In the beginning of your employment you will be train in Singapore, where you will undergo in-house training in our products, both theoretical and practical. Here after you will be sent on service visits on vessels around the world.

Your primary tasks will be:
· Service jobs in fields of mechanics and electronics (performing installations etc.).
· Testing existing electrical projects.
· Troubleshooting and repairing internal and external.
· Customer instructions and customer service when you are on board the vessel.
· Overhaul of lubricators.
You have to be prepared on traveling approx. 130 days a year and need to be able to travel on short notice, also on public holidays, to implement service tasks on vessels which are either sailing, in port or in dock.

Your profile
We imagine that you have a background as marine engineer, preferable with sailing, knowledge of electrical and mechanical experience as well as engine would be an added advantages. You are used to working according to instructions and diagram-drawings. It will be an advantage if you already have experience in travel work.

You are comfortable with working alone on service jobs, far away from your everyday life, but also manage to take part in team work, when more colleagues are on the same job. You possess a high professional pride and understand that quality and service are essential to make you succeed in your job. You are fluent in English both in writing and speech.

We offer
An intriguing position in a growing company, where you will have the opportunity to achieve both personal and professional goals. You will be part of a committed team with a high level of professionalism and a team where respect and collaboration are a focus point. We have an informal culture and there is room for an open and honest dialogue. We are always ready to adapt to the requirements and wishes of the customer and the market in which we navigate in general.

Your application

Applications are processed on a rolling basis.

You can read more about our products on our website: www.hjlubri.dk/en

Job Description:
This position is for an experienced individual with strong knowledge in networking and expertise in one of the following areas: routing/switching, SDN, Application Delivery Controller (ADC), network management, or security.

The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience and will be responsible for transforming ideas, solutions, and proposals into technical blueprints. Additionally, they will lead project teams to manage complex technical setups.

Make an Impact by:
Analyze technical needs, requirements, and state of the network’s infrastructure design, integration, and operations.
Produce high level architecture designs to meet customer requirements for semi-complex (or) complex systems. Articulate with sufficient knowledge to convince and explain customer on the design.
Produce low level technical designs from high level architecture designs. Translate a broader infrastructure design or blueprint into technical specifications and details.
Refine design specifications and prototypes based on inputs from internal / external stakeholders.
Installs or removes hardware and/or software, using supplied installation instructions and tools including, where appropriate, handover to the client.
Develop a comprehensive testing plan to assess stability, suitability and performance of on-site infrastructure and systems.
Conducts tests, corrects malfunctions, and documents results in accordance with agreed procedures.
Provides specialist guidance and advice to less experienced colleagues to ensure best use is made of available assets, and to maintain or improve the installation service.
Develops installation procedures and standards, and schedules installation work.
Configures the hardware environment, produces integration test specifications, conducts tests and records the details of any failures.
Drive the troubleshooting with internal/external system components.
Reviews requirements and specifications and defines test conditions.
Designs test cases and test scripts under own direction, mapping back to pre-determined criteria, recording and reporting outcomes.
Conducts tests as defined in an integration test specification, records the details of any failures, and carries out fault diagnosis relating to simple failures, reporting the results of the diagnosis in a clear and concise manner.
Reviews test results and modifies tests if necessary. Provides reports on progress, anomalies, risks and issues associated with the overall project. Reports on system quality and collects metrics on test cases. Provides specialist advice to support others.
Skills for Success:
Degree or Equivalent
5-8 Years of Network Experience
Network specialization skillset in Routing & Switching, Wireless, Data Center solutions, SDWAN.
Good at problem solving
Able to explain technical problems in a simple terms
CCNP & ASCP or ACMP

Job Description:
Assistant Project Engineer

Our client is a Mechanical and Electrical (M&E) engineering firm that specialized in a one stop solution in integrating M&E needs from start to end with 900 over major projects that includes corporate, industrial, institutional and government bodies. The Assistant Project Engineer is responsible for coordinating M&E works at site and maintaining and updating the drawing data.
Remuneration: $3200 - $4500 (Depending on experience)
Working Hours: Monday to Friday; 9am – 6pm
Location: Aljunied (15 mins walk from Aljunied MRT)
Job Responsibilities:
Oversee and manage M&E fit-out projects, ensuring timely and budget-compliant completion.
Handle addition and alteration works on-site.
Manage electrical systems, ACMV, fire protection, and plumbing services. Site Supervision: Monitor site activities, ensuring adherence to project specifications, safety, and regulations.
Coordinate and liaise with clients, contractors, and subcontractors.
Ensure all work complies with relevant codes, standards, and safety regulations.
Review and verify as-built drawings for accuracy.
Supervise installation of M&E services.
Ad-hoc duties as assigned
Job Requirements:
Minimum Diploma in Electrical Engineering or relevant field
Minimum 1 – 2 years of relevant experience in project management, A&A works,M&E services and site supervision
Knowledge in Electrical/ACMC/ Fire Protection System/ Plumbing and installation of M&E Services on site

Job Description:
Leads a team of REs, RTOs, QS and document controller and provide direction for field engineering for system-wide MEICA works which include Odour Control & Air Jumper Facilities and Site-Wide Instrumentation Monitoring for DTSS2.
Site supervision and commissioning of the system-wide MEICA works including coordination and interface with the DTSS2 contractors and PUB.
Supports the Project Director, Deputy Project Director and Construction Manager in leading a team of technical professionals to deliver construction and programme management services.
Ensures the Contractor provides consistent quality of works in accordance with approved drawings and contract specifications.
Resolves construction and commissioning-related issues raised by Client/Contractors.
Monitors and reports on Contractor’s work progress, schedule and cost performance and safety records.
Responsible for the review and approval of Contractor submissions which include but not limited to reports, RFI, claims, specification, calculations and drawings.
Ensures consistent and thorough submittal reviews of the Contractors’ submission have been done throughout the submittal approval process.
Chairs meetings, lead discussions with Clients and Contractors and prepare meeting notes.

Resolves contractual issues (which include variations and EOT claims) with the Contractor and recommend to the Client for approval.
Ensures that records of all works including but not limited to tests, inspections, and minutes of meetings are filed in the DTSS2 Project Information Management System.
Maintains a high profile in HSES by active participation in HSES audits, inspections and reviews.
Promotes a near-miss reporting culture and ensure lessons learnt from these near-misses are shared across the programme.

Experience in managing and administering engineering work in multiple disciplines and multiple contract environment
Broad working knowledge of all engineering disciplines.

Job Description:
Your new company
Client is a public corporation seeking to hire a 2-year Mechanical Project Engineer.

Your new role
The role is to be based at Senoko, in Singapore. The role includes the planning and management of a programme of Mechanical and mixed trades projects carried out on the facilities operated and maintained by the company, ensuring that all work is executed on time and to budget/estimates and in full compliance with company standards and applicable legislation.

The Mechanical Project Engineer will have responsibility for all stages of development and implementation of several projects and/or engineering across the Singapore estate.

Lead the management and inspection of Static Equipment to include pipelines, tanks, vessels, and associated equipment.
Develop Mechanical scopes of work at concept, FEED, and detailed design level,
Develop budgets and forecasts for programme of work,
Liaise with other members of the Asset Technical Team on standards & codes,
Produce detailed programme of works/Gantt charts etc,
Working knowledge of COMAH, MOC, and CDM regulations,
Previous experience of managing multiple site works.
Supervise and function as client’s representative on tank inspection works
What you'll need to succeed
Have extensive experience of leading direct and indirect technical engineering projects and Stakeholder groups / teams engaged in the delivery of complex projects within demanding time, quality, and cost constraints,
Able to demonstrate good management / people relationship skills, in particular team management and dealing with Contractors,
Solid understanding of good project management principles; able to act as an “intelligent client.”
Working knowledge of current local legislation and best practice relating to industry such as API, EEMUA, ASME, ATEX, BS, PSLG, COMAH, CDM etc.
What you'll get in return
This is an exciting opportunity to join a public corporation in Singapore. You will be part of a dynamic team and you will be remunerated at market competitive rates.
What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call Ernie at Hays on +65 6424 0157 or email Ernieza.Zailani@hays.com.sg for a confidential discussion.

Referrals are welcome.

Job Description:
Note: This role will require travel to China and Vietnam for approximately 10 months per year. Proficiency in Mandarin is essential for effective communication with Chinese-speaking clients and stakeholders.

Job Summary:
We are seeking a talented Senior Design Quality Engineer (DQE) to lead quality initiatives for our thermal cooling solutions within the electronics and computing industry. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring design and process quality while driving continuous improvements to achieve product excellence. If you are passionate about quality control, process optimization, and collaborating across functions, we encourage you to apply.
Key Responsibilities:
Implement advanced monitoring systems to enhance product quality and yield. Identify areas for improvement and lead initiatives to optimize production processes.
Take charge of addressing and improving abnormal quality issues in manufacturing processes. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement effective solutions and preventive measures.
Strengthen internal quality control processes and improve overall capabilities, particularly in mechanical processes such as metal stamping, forging, brazing, die casting, CNC machining, and milling. Drive initiatives aimed at maximizing operational efficiency.
Lead corrective actions for customer-reported quality issues and communicate preventive solutions to relevant stakeholders.
Streamline quality inspection planning by integrating automation and advanced technologies whenever possible.
Promote effective communication and coordination with design, production, and other teams to ensure adherence to quality standards.
Manage task assignments, performance, and development of the quality team, ensuring timely completion of deliverables.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Quality Engineering, or a related field.
Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in quality engineering, particularly in manufacturing and design quality.
Proven experience in mechanical processes, including metal stamping, forging, brazing, die casting, CNC machining, milling, and knowledge of tooling and the design/manufacture of fixtures and jigs.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and leadership abilities.
Familiarity with quality management systems and standards.
Six Sigma certification or equivalent is a plus.
Willingness to travel frequently and work abroad in China and Vietnam for a minimum of 10 months per year (includes four round-trip tickets to Singapore annually and separate arrangements for living accommodations).

Job Description:
Note: This role will require travel to China and Vietnam for approximately 10 months per year. Proficiency in Mandarin is essential for effective communication with Chinese-speaking clients and stakeholders.

Job Summary:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Supplier Quality Engineer (SQE) to lead quality and process optimization efforts across our supplier network, with a strong focus on mechanical processes (e.g., metal stamping, forging, brazing, die casting, CNC machining, and milling). The successful candidate will work within the electronics and computing sectors, particularly focusing on thermal cooling solutions, ensuring that our suppliers meet rigorous quality standards and process reliability. You will collaborate closely with suppliers to enhance product quality, optimize processes, and drive continuous improvement.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and implement systems to monitor and assess supplier quality. Ensure that materials and components, particularly those related to mechanical processes (e.g., metalworking, tooling, fixture and jig design), comply with specified standards. Address and resolve any non-conformance issues.
Work closely with suppliers to optimize their manufacturing processes, such as metal stamping, forging, brazing, die casting, CNC machining, and milling. Drive improvements in process yield and consistency to ensure the high quality of materials and components.
Lead the resolution of abnormal quality issues in collaboration with suppliers, focusing on root cause analysis and the implementation of corrective and preventive actions.
Perform detailed audits to evaluate suppliers' quality management systems and process capabilities, particularly in mechanical and metalworking processes. Ensure adherence to relevant industry standards, and drive improvement actions based on audit findings.
Work in partnership with suppliers to develop and enhance their quality processes and manufacturing practices. Ensure that their systems align with company standards, especially in the areas of tooling design and fixture/jig manufacturing.
Collaborate with internal teams (design, production, procurement) to ensure clear communication of quality expectations and standards.
Promote a culture of continuous improvement within the supplier network, focusing on enhancing quality management systems and manufacturing practices for metal-based components and mechanical parts.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Quality Assurance, or a related field.
Minimum 5-7 years of relevant experience in supplier quality engineering or a similar role within the manufacturing or electronics industry.
Proven experience with mechanical processes such as metal stamping, forging, brazing, die casting, CNC machining, and milling.
Strong understanding of supplier quality management systems and industry standards.
In-depth knowledge of metalworking, tooling design, and the manufacture of fixtures and jigs.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and negotiation skills.
Experience with supplier audits, corrective actions, and continuous improvement processes.
Six Sigma certification (or similar qualifications) is advantageous.
Willingness to travel extensively (approximately 10 months per year) to China and Vietnam. Travel includes four round-trip tickets to Singapore annually, with separate living arrangements provided.

Job Description:
Employment Type: 1-Year Contract (Renewable based on Performance)
Location: Changi Business Park

Key Responsibilities:
As a Technical Business Analyst, you will actively participate in the software development life cycle (SDLC) and Agile methodology, from project initiation through requirements gathering, development, implementation, and post-implementation review. Your role will encompass the following key areas:
Collaboration & Communication: Liaise extensively with external and internal clients, as well as vendors, to understand and address project needs.
Requirement Analysis & Solution Design: Lead design thinking sessions and discussions to gather, analyze, and clarify customer requirements. Identify requirement gaps, technical challenges, and other issues. Translate users’ requirements into detailed technical solutions and use cases.
Requirement Presentation: Effectively present and communicate functional requirements and use cases to technical and development teams. Ensure system functionalities align with business needs and system requirements.
Technical Design: Contribute to defining system-level architecture, high-level and detailed design, architectural policies, implementation risks, and mitigation measures.
Customer Engagement: Engage with customers to explain architectural decisions or technical issues and provide guidance.
Documentation: Prepare comprehensive documentation, including requirements and functional specifications, design specifications, data/application management frameworks, interface specifications, infrastructure requirements, and data migration plans. Facilitate reviews and obtain customer sign-off on documentation.
Training & Testing: Develop and deliver training programs for customers. Create and execute test plans, test cases, and ensure comprehensive coverage. Review and validate test results, ensuring they align with customer expectations.
Functional & Backend Testing: Perform functional and backend testing, review logs, troubleshoot issues, and ensure the quality of the application.
User Acceptance Testing (UAT): Brief stakeholders on test results and support UAT activities.
Issue Resolution: Troubleshoot system issues faced by project teams and customers, following up until resolution.
Change Impact Analysis: Conduct change impact analysis for customer requests and manage change management processes.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with both local and offshore teams to deliver technical aspects of projects.
Pre-sales Support: Assist with pre-sales activities by preparing solutions and proposals.
Requirements:
Degree in Computer Science or Engineering.
Must have experience in the banking industry.
Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience as a Business Analyst, with good exposure to testing. Experience in a Java environment is a plus.
Proficient in SQL, Linux, system analysis, and UAT testing.
Development skills in a Java environment and familiarity with Jira are advantageous.
Experience with backend system logs analysis, data mapping, and functional testing.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to follow up on reported issues until resolved.
Experience in issue, problem, and change management processes.
Self-motivated with a positive, proactive attitude.
Strong communication, negotiation, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Detail-oriented with a creative mindset and persuasive ability.
Ability to work effectively under tight timelines and as part of a collaborative team.
Strong customer-service orientation with excellent presentation skills.

Job Description:
Job Description:
Develop accurate and detailed 3D BIM models of ACMV systems, including ductwork, piping, equipment, and components, based on engineer's drawings, specifications, and calculations.
Model complex geometries and assemblies while adhering to project standards and BIM execution plans.
Generate shop drawings, sections, and details from the model for fabrication, installation, and coordination.
Collaborate closely with architects, engineers, and other disciplines to ensure design integrity and resolve clashes effectively.
Participate in BIM coordination meetings to identify and resolve potential conflicts between different building systems.
Utilize clash detection software (e.g., Navisworks) to identify and resolve clashes early in the design process.
Job Responsibilities:
Embed relevant data into the model such as material specifications, manufacturer details, installation instructions, and maintenance schedules.
Maintain model integrity and consistency throughout the project lifecycle, ensuring it remains up-to-date with the latest revisions.
Generate reports and schedules from the model, including material takeoffs, equipment lists, and construction sequencing.
Possess a strong understanding of ACMV principles, including ventilation rates, duct sizing, pipe sizing, and equipment selection.
Be proficient in relevant BIM software such as Autodesk Revit, AutoCAD MEP, and Navisworks Manage.
Stay updated with the latest BIM standards and technologies and assist with the preparation of as-built drawings.
Provide technical support to the project team and contribute to the development and implementation of BIM workflows.
Skills and Qualification:
Diploma or Degree in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. Proven experience as an ACMV BIM modeller or a similar role.
Proficiency in Revit MEP and other related BIM software. Strong understanding of ACMV design principles and standards.
Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
Strong independence and good communication in English
Advantages / Remunerations
5 days work week
AWS included
Variable Performance Bonus
Annual Incentive Trip
Various Medical Benefits
Flexible working hours and Work From Home accepted on top of physical attendance
Fast progression position
Progression-centric
Further learning / education encouraged and sponsorships.

Job Description:
As part of the Infrastructure Information Development & Digitalisation Division that drives LTA’s strategic initiative toward a digital organisation via digitalization of all infrastructure development projects. This division develop strategies and programmes to drive the digital transformation to shift mindset of internal and interfacing stakeholders within the infrastructure industry through adoption of BIM processes and work within the digital environment.

You will be involved in the implementation of a holistic data eco-system to support the Infrastructure development digitalisation to house Confidential Cloud-eligible classification and Restricted data. You will have to ensure the digital environment supports digital engineering project delivery and complies with the ISO 19650 information management processes. You have to drive and oversee the information management data standards development, governance and administration of the data environment, including project information amalgamation with GIS implementation.

Responsibilities:
- Work with internal groups to identify the respective BIM requirements for Road or Rail, green / brown field / renewal projects and to align with LTA’s overall digitalisation strategy developed.
- Plan and organize engagement strategy and programmes to permeate BIM and digitalisation efforts within the organisation and industry. This will include being actively involved in change management efforts to promote and shape adoption on BIM processes, ISO19650 standards, Inter-operability, LTA’s taxonomy, InSIGHT digital ecosystem.
- Horizontal scanning and keep abreast of the technology, tools and applications that could potentially improve the organisation’s project delivery productivity or manpower efficiency.
- There will also be opportunities to lead and facilitate prototype studies on these new technology implementations through prototyping or Proof of Concept etc.
- Involve in process re-engineering to develop, review, update and maintain new digital process that would leverage on LTA’s InSIGHT platform to improve project management information management, and model geometry & model content information checks application.
- Includes administration support for the division.

Requirements:
• Tertiary qualification in relevant engineering discipline, such as Civil & Structure / Electrical / Mechanical Engineering, Construction Management, or related engineering qualification.
• Preferably, Certification in any tier of Digital Delivery Management (DDM)
• At least 3 years of experience in construction, manufacturing or technology related industry
• Preferably with experience in Digital Engineering processes (e.g. VDC) and knowledge in delivering building and infrastructure projects
• Preferably with experience in delivering infrastructure projects and familiar with the delivery processes in the capacity of a project team, consultant or contractor.
• Knowledgeable in BIM practices, Standards, ISO19650, IFC4.X, Uniclass and COBie
• Good interpersonal skills with good presentation, communication and written skills.
• Highly adaptable team player who can work independently and multi-task in a fast-paced environment; self-motivated to achieve work excellence
• Would be advantageous if the candidate is a trained facilitator

Job Description:
Job Overview:
As a Cryptographic Engineer, you will function as the technical interface between R&D and the customers. You will engage with customers to understand their technical and business requirements, work with R&D to scope and test the product, and maintain our delivery channel to distribute the product.

Responsibilities & Duties:
· Understand and articulate customers’ requirements to internal pQCee teams
· Work with R&D team to build and deliver the product in accordance with the roadmap
· Work with sales and partner channel teams to drive sales and adoption of PKI product.

Skill sets and Qualifications:
· At least 5 years’ experience in a relevant role.
· Working knowledge of DevOps tools such as Jira, Github to build a delivery channel for customers
· Strong software engineering background with proficiency in C, Rust, Java, WebAssembly and/or Javascript.
· Able to build, compile and use utilities and cryptographic APIs such as PKCS#11, PKCS#7 and OpenSSL.
· Good working knowledge of public key cryptography, certification authorities, X.509 certificates, and digital signing.
· Possess strong integrity, able to work independently and challenge existing norms
· Good written and oral communication skills
· Good pass in an undergraduate degree from a reputable university

Please submit resumes to hr@pqcee.com with the following information:
· Personal particulars
· Contact details of one character reference
· Notice period
· Expected salary

About the Company

pQCee Pte Ltd is a startup in the quantum cybersecurity space. We are in the business of designing and building post-quantum products and solutions to strengthen and protect the next generation of computing against quantum attacks. As a startup, we are excited to grow our team and we welcome bright and dynamic individuals who share our vision and are passionate about cybersecurity to join us.

About ASUS
AICS is part of ASUS, a multinational company known for the world’s best motherboards, PCs, monitors, graphics cards and routers. Along with an expanding range of superior gaming, content-creation and AIoT solutions, ASUS leads the industry through cutting-edge design and innovations made to create the most ubiquitous, intelligent, heartfelt and joyful smart life for everyone. Job Description:
About Air Liquide Singapore
Headquartered in Paris, France, Air Liquide Singapore Private Limited (ALSg) is the largest and leading industrial gas company in South-east Asia. ALSg employs 750 people recognized for their high level of expertise to provide gases, equipment, services and packaged solutions to support the requirements of the Singapore manufacturing industry. With assets of more than S$1 billion, ALSg operates the largest network of air separation plants and gas production facilities dedicated to serving the different industries in Singapore. Strategically located on more than 20 sites in Singapore, our complete range of gases, which are produced under stringent quality control, are used in a wide variety of applications.

Summary:
Operations Controller is to oversee the financial operations and play a key part in achieving the entity’s long-term growth, and to support business leaders/initiatives from a reporting perspective to drive performance improvements.

The mission is to coordinate the setting & implementation of strategic objectives, to provide analytical information by developing a deep understanding of business results, to quantify the impact of action plans and to validate business assumptions. Operations Controller will perform operational and financial analysis, suggest corrective actions, drive and authorize investment processes, and coordinate strategic objective settings. Operations Controller will need to work in close collaboration with the operations and industrial teams and report directly to the Operations Control Manager.

Responsibilities:
Play a key role in financial planning and analysis to drive profitability and ensure the company meets it's financial targets.
Conduct business analysis and reporting to support sales & operations teams to increase efficiency and drive the performance.
Report the performance to the global headquarters and local management level
Advise and collaborate with the entity’s stakeholder to define business development strategies, closely with industrial and operations teams.
Build strong relationships with the various business and industrial leaders.
Propose and recommend improvements or corrections to his manager in order to optimize operations on an operational level and in terms of quality and safety, while reducing operating costs.
Proactively identify potential financial risks and implement follow-up measures and business rules.
Ensuring that investment decisions are adequately evaluated and that progress are measured and reported.
Take part to the development of projects with Business Development and provide support on product cost base from checks and validation of project documents / canonics, challenge business / strategic assumptions from business team and monitor the implementation on the project in terms of Financing, timing of first industrial production (FIP); Post project FIP to perform financial analysis vs RIC approved economics.

Required Qualifications And Competencies:
Bachelor in Engineering/Finance or relevant discipline.
Minimum 5 years’ relevant experience in Operations/Business Development/Finance in the gas industry.
Analytical thinking ability, focused, self-organized and good articulation skills.
Strong communication skills with a capability to influence stakeholders.
Understanding of ERP and BI systems.

Job Description:
About Air Liquide Singapore
Headquartered in Paris, France, Air Liquide Singapore Private Limited (ALSg) is the largest and leading industrial gas company in South-east Asia. ALSg employs 650 people recognized for their high level of expertise to provide gases, equipment, services and packaged solutions to support the requirements of the Singapore manufacturing industry. With assets of more than S$1 billion, ALSg operates the largest network of air separation plants and gas production facilities dedicated to serving the different industries in Singapore. Strategically located on more than 20 sites in Singapore, our complete range of gases, which are produced under stringent quality control, are used in a wide variety of applications.

Summary:
ALSg's 24-month Future Leaders Programme (FLP) enables graduates to gain real insights into life at Air Liquide. It is a structured programme that allows for an in-depth exploration of interest in the chemicals industry and develop their professional skills and competencies. For the duration of FLP, our Future Leaders will be rotated to work on special mission projects across various Business Lines.

Hands-on experience
On-the-job learning starts immediately when you are placed in a real role under the supervision of a senior business leader. The hands-on experience is complemented by specific rotations to related job units to better understand the different functions. Expect learning to be steep and you will need to be highly self-driven, proactive, resourceful and resilient.

Excellent mentorship
Learning through others can be one of the most significant ways of advancing in your journey. You will therefore be assigned a reporting officer who is also a senior business leader in Air Liquide. You can fully leverage on their valuable knowledge, learn from their experience and perspectives to help you complete the programme successfully. This mentoring relationship is driven by you and it is up to you to make the most out of it.

Requirements:
A Bachelor's degree in Engineering from a reputable educational institution with good academic and co-curricular record
Entry level applicants or a maximum of 3 years of full-time working experience candidates are welcome to apply
Strong leadership qualities, excellent numerical and communication skills, high learning agility and resilience to succeed in a dynamic environment

Job Title: Testing & Commissioning Manager  West  Consultancy Firm
Job Description:
Our client is an MNC Consultancy in the water and wastewater industry. With more than 100-year heritage, helping companies across the globe efficiently and effectively collect, store, move and treat water and wastewater, plan and manage watersheds and harness the energy embedded in the treatment and movement of water.

Contract period: 1 year (renewable/ extendable)
Work location: Tuas
Work Hours: 5.5 days
Bonus: 1-month gratuity bonus per year

Roles and Responsibilities:
On behalf of the Owner’s Engineer (OE), the T&C Manager shall be responsible for overseeing all testing and commissioning activities of the Contractors, including the coordination of testing and commissioning activities of stakeholders.
Lead the OE’s proposed testing and commissioning team and coordinate with its Resident Site Supervision (RSS) Team and OE’s design team as well as the Contractors to review the development of the Contractors testing and commissioning plan and the Contractors execution of their plan in order to achieve the Project milestones for each of the EPC Contracts (EPC Package 1 – Waste to Energy/Materials Recovery Facility and EPC Package 2 – Sludge Incineration Facility/Food Waste Treatment Facility).
Oversee the whole of each Contractors testing and commissioning activities, and the interfaces between EPC1 and EPC2 as relevant, which should commence from dry/cold to hot commissioning to successful completion of entire commissioning process and trial run, including optimisation of plant operation with the Contractors and O&M teams.
Direct liaison with Client’s Technical Directors/PGMs.
Attendance at Client Monthly Project Steering/Working Committee Meetings chaired by DCEO and any other relevant high-level meetings as required by the
Client/PD/SO.
Chairing regular T&C Coordination Meetings with the Contractor and/or Other Contractors on adjacent sites (that is attended by Client representatives or similar others also)
Any other matters that may from time to time be delegated by the PD/SO.
Member of internal Senior Project Management Team (PMT) that meets regularly (chaired by PD/SO) to discuss progress and resolve any internal issues.
The OE’s T&C Manager is estimated to be mobilised to site at least 6 months prior to the commencement of actual testing and commissioning by the Contractor in order to familiarise themselves with the Works and the Contractors plans for the T&C and the expectations of the Client.
Requirements:
At least 15 years of hands-on relevant experience in testing and commissioning (and operation) of large scale solid waste management projects (Waste to Energy - WTE, sludge incineration, materials recovery and food waste treatment), or experience with large scale industrial/process/utilities projects (i.e. waste, water, oil & gas, power) testing and commissioning.
The T&C Manager shall have a relevant engineering degree or certification.

Job Description:
Join Our Team as a Procurement Assistant!

Are you passionate about procurement and ready to make an impact with a dynamic team? We're looking for a motivated Procurement Assistant to join our growing organization. Whether you're starting your career or bringing valuable experience, this role offers exciting opportunities for growth and development.

Job Responsibilities:
Prepare and issue purchase requisitions and purchase orders based on project requirements, ensuring timely and cost-effective procurement.
Review and evaluate contract documents from clients and main contractors to ensure compliance and understanding.
Conduct price comparisons and negotiate with suppliers and vendors to achieve the best possible pricing and terms.
Manage variation orders and other contractual changes, ensuring proper documentation and approvals.
Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and subcontractors, ensuring reliable and efficient procurement processes.
Maintain accurate records of purchases, pricing, and contract details.
Job Requirements:
Diploma/Degree in an Engineering field or related discipline.
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite and strong computer literacy.
Excellent negotiation and communication skills, both verbal and written.
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.
Why Join Us?
Grow your career in procurement with opportunities for learning and advancement.
Work alongside a supportive team that values collaboration and innovation.
Contribute to exciting projects and initiatives that make a difference.
Enjoy a positive work environment that encourages growth, creativity, and continuous improvement.

Job Description:
Join Our Team as a Quantity Surveyor – Build Your Career with Us!

Are you ready to take the next step in your career with a dynamic and growing company? We are looking for a motivated Quantity Surveyor to join our team, where you’ll play a key role in shaping exciting construction projects. Whether you have a few years of experience or are a fresh graduate with a passion for the industry, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:
Review tender documents, drawings, and specifications to ensure a thorough understanding of the project scope
Develop accurate cost estimates and detailed analysis for various construction projects
Measure quantities, compile Bills of Quantities (BQ), and coordinate with suppliers to call for quotations for tender submissions
Prepare comprehensive tender packages, including pre-qualification documents, clarifications, evaluations, and reports, while providing insightful analysis and recommendations
Attend site showrounds to gain a better understanding of project requirements and client expectations

Job Requirements:
Diploma/Degree in Quantity Surveying or a related field
At least 2-3 years of relevant experience in quantity surveying or tendering (fresh graduates with strong potential are encouraged to apply!)
Strong attention to detail, good analytical skills, and a passion for cost management and project analysis

Job Description:
About CAD-IT:

Established in Singapore in 1991, our vision is to be the preferred Industry 4.0 partner to our valued customers and a key global contributor to the successful use of innovation and technology. Our mission is to provide world-class Industry 4.0 solutions, thereby helping our customers and their supply chains achieve greater innovation, quality, productivity, reduced costs and time-to-market, whilst being good stewards of the resources that are entrusted to us.


Key Responsibilities:
Establish and maintain long-term relationships with existing and prospective customers to maximize business opportunities.
Build and own a sales portfolio, & develop and maintain a sustainable pipeline.
Create, execute and maintain account plans for existing customers highlighting profile, share and value opportunities including strategy, goals, tactics and milestones.
Stay up-to-date with the company's new and existing products/services so that once you have identified customers' needs, you are able to conduct technical presentations, product demonstrations and software evaluation.
Initiate and drive technical activities in line with the business goals such as:
Leverage on advanced-level engineering knowledge to analyze technical needs and solve complex engineering problems
Perform engineering simulation consulting services
Customize and conduct ANSYS software training

We would love to hear from you if:
You possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Electrical, Electronics, Telecommunications, Mechanical, Mechatronic, Electromechanical) or equivalent.
You have knowledge in MEDDIC, Product Design, Manufacturing Process, FMEA, DOE Optimization, Root-Cause Analysis, Six-Sigma or TRIZ methodologies.
Experience in ANSYS software will be highly advantageous.
You have experience in applying PLM/CAD/CAM/CAE/Additive Manufacturing solutions in solving industrial problems.
You have the ability to build relationships with prospective customers through the use of various prospecting techniques as well as maintaining relationships with current customers.
You have 1 to 2 years sales experience.
You are professional, with a strong sense of ethics and morals.
You are self-motivated and sales-driven.
You have excellent communication, presentation and influencing skills.
You are able to work in a fast-paced environment.

What would you get?
Training and Development
Commission on sales
Discretionary Yearly Bonus
Medical & Insurance Benefits
CAD-IT rewards employees in various ways based on their role, contribution and performance. We believe in training and developing our employees to help them achieve their fullest potential.

Job Title: Staff Engineer  Technical Manager Design Verification
Job Description:
What you will do
Develop and review test plans.
Develop verification environment/testbench in Module/IP/SOC level.
Develop verification IP and reference model.
Implement test with randomization based coverage driven verification methodology.
Implement functional and functional/code coverage closure.
Hands-on code/debug with UVM, SystemVerilog, Verilog and SystemC.
Low Power verification.
Verification automation flow.
What you will bring
Bachelor's/Master's Degree in EEE/Computer/IC design/equivalent.
With min. of 8 years of relevant verification experiences.
With IC/ASIC design verification experience on SOC, Ethernet, PCIe, DDR, USB, ARM CPU.
Strong experience and debugging ability on SystemVerilog/UVM.
Skilled in Synopsys/Cadence/Mentor Simulator and debugging flow.
Experience on Low Power and formal verification is a plus.
Strong in UNIX scripting with Pyhon, Perl, makefile Cshell.
Fast learner and a good team player.
Candidates with more years of experience will be considered for a more senior role.
About the team
Our ASIC DV Team focus on developing full and advanced verification methodology IP/SOC. You will have chance to work on challenging projects that attractive and be immersed in leading tech e.g.: WiFi, 5G, AR/VR, AI, Cloud Networking. A comprehensive program for professional development / career growth will be provided to the new joiner and he/she will have chance to learn from the best expert in this area.
In MediaTek, we promote diversity and inclusiveness. Passionate talents who love new challenges and keen on learning new technologies, do send us your cv our way today and join our multicultural team that consists of talents from all over the world!

Job Description:
What you will do
6G technology research & development
New technology prototype, proof-of-concept, and system validation/verification
Develop technical proposals for international standardization
Eco-system engagement for 6G initiatives
What you will bring
MS or PhD degree in Electrical Engineering, Communication Engineering or related.
With min. 8 years of relevant experience in similar field.
Possess strong knowledge in digital signal processing (DSP) and have experience in evaluating and designing communication algorithms.
Deep understanding of mobile communication system and specifications, including standards such as 3G, 4G, 5G, and beyond.
Hands-on experience in practical implementation for wireless communication system. Programming skill in C/C++, Matlab, Python, Verilog or VHDL, etc. is preferred.
Strong background in the wireless communication industry, with a proven track record of working on wireless communication technologies.
Expertise in at least one of following special areas is preferred: artificial intelligence (AI) applied to wireless communication, satellite communication systems, or energy engineering related to wireless networks.
Location: One North, Singapore

Why MediaTek?
MediaTek Incorporated (TWSE: 2454) is the world’s 5th largest global fabless semiconductor company. Joining MediaTek means becoming part of a team that powers over 2 billion ICs worldwide, enriching and enhancing everyday life. Our chipsets are integral to a wide range of products, from smartphones, mobile devices to home and IoT devices, in entertainment and multimedia products, and provide connectivity and communication solutions that keep people connected with friends and their families with access to online resources. Working at MediaTek offers you the opportunity to contribute to the world through the devices we use in our daily lives – it’s more than just a job, it’s a chance to make a meaningful impact. – Join us now!

Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Develop and execute strategic sales plans to identify, pursue, and establish relationships with new clients across key industries, including consumer electronics, mobile devices, medical devices, and automotive.

Job Description:
Job Responsibilities:
Independently carry out design safety philosophy, HSE Plan, and specifications for fire protection systems (Active and Passive), HFE, etc.
Participate in process hazard reviews and analysis, including HAZOP/HAZID/SIL studies, and be responsible for action close-outs.
Lead/Chair the HAZOP/HAZID/SIL workshops, if required.
Review third party safety studies, including FERA, dispersion analysis, EERA, ESSA, dropped objects study, QRA studies, etc. (not limited to). Capable of independently carrying out similar safety studies, as required.
Independently design active and passive fire protection systems and prepare Hazardous/H2S Area Classification documentation, safety and fire fighting layouts, escape route and lifesaving equipment layout, and other safety drawings.
Carry out safety critical elements performance standards, RAM, fire and gas detection mapping, etc., based on project requirements.
Act as Package Engineer for safety and firefighting equipment.
Manage and guide Junior/Senior Engineers and Designers on Concept/FEED/Detailed Engineering projects.
Provide health and environmental inputs (including health risk assessments such as chemical exposure, noise and lighting, Ergonomics/Human Factors Engineering, environmental impact assessments, etc.) to projects.
Interface/Coordinate with other engineering disciplines and clients, and take the lead in resolving technical matters related to safety aspects.
Deliver project safety deliverables as per the project schedule.
Provide inputs and support to projects in all safety aspects, including progress reports.
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering or equivalent from an accredited university.
Minimum 22 years of relevant design engineering experience.
Good HSE Engineering experience in the oil and gas industry, in process safety/technical safety, with a minimum of 3-5 years in a Lead position on similar projects.
Involvement in design projects for offshore (FPSO/Platforms) and onshore (Refineries, LNG facilities, Storage terminals, etc.).
Experience in a minimum number of offshore projects (FPSO/Platforms).
Good knowledge of oil and gas process facilities, local and international process safety codes and standards, and regulatory/marine codes and standards (MODU, SOLAS, DNV/Lloyds Register).
Hands-on experience in plot plan review, HAZID, HAZOP, SIL classification/verification, and other safety reviews (e.g., SIMOPS, ALARP).
Good working knowledge of PIPENET Vision, Flaresim, and other consequence modeling software such as DNV PHAST, etc.
Ability to influence designs to achieve optimal HSE outcomes.
A team player with leadership potential and proactive inter-discipline communication skills.
skills: ['Firefighting', 'Leadership', 'Lighting', 'Modeling', 'HAZOP', 'Fire Protection', 'Onshore', 'Process Engineering', 'Process Safety', 'Communication Skills', 'Team Player', 'Manufacturing', 'Layout', 'Chemical Engineering', 'Commissioning', 'Mapping']

• Repair and maintenance of Test Board
• Maintain max passing yield results
• Test Board Maintenance activities (Perform socket replacement and testing)
• Identify Issues
• Reporting of service activities
• Management of spare socket inventory
• Technical service on industrial chambers

Service Engineer – Diploma in Engineering
Technical Specialist – Diploma in Engineering
1 - 2 Years Experience
Strong in hands-on, able to work independently with minimum supervision
Able to do soldering work on tiny component

Job Description:
Job Description & Requirements
NACT Engineering provides tethered drone systems for drones of all sizes and use-cases. Our intimate knowledge of robotics systems places us at the forefront of a burgeoning mechanical revolution. As a company at the cutting edge of engineering and robotics, we are looking for a suitable candidate that will push NACT forward as a bespoke drone solutions provider for our clients in the APAC region.
Roles and Responsibilities
Monitor the functioning of all equipment and report any problems or substandard condition to the supervisor.
Ensure all log books are maintained according to standard operating procedures.
Perform equipment assembly according to engineering drawings and guidance from engineers.
Perform cleaning of all parts as per established cleaning procedures.
Perform pre-assembly activities such as cleaning and lubricating.
Conduct product testing and performance testing and record the results.
Perform final checks and adjustments for any defects to ensure high quality products.
Perform installation, repair, inspection, reassembly, replacing, refitting, and adjusting products as required.
Order and stock materials and supplies to avoid materials shortages.
Receive, unload, unpack and transfer materials to different work stations.
Develop preventive maintenance procedures to avoid any breakdowns and failures.
Maintain work area to be clean, safe and orderly.
Job Requirements
Relevant qualifications in Electrical, Electronic and Robotics Engineering/ Mechanical Engineering or Aerospace Engineering
Fresh graduate welcome to apply
Independent and initiated
With a “can do” attitude and ability to innovate around challenges
Willing to learn new industry techniques
Salary package will commensurate with experience and competency
Highlights of working at NACT
Many amenities available along Alexander Road
Competitive compensation package remunerated based on skill and experience.
High level of autonomy on the job with training opportunities provided for upskilling and learning
Open culture and collaborative environment
